Thank you!

story:
Накратко

За всички български поддръжници, става дума за пътешествие с поразклатен и поръждясал, но все още в перфектно движение Опел Рекорд, модел 1979 година до най-високите проходими за коли превали в света, които се намират в Ладах, Индия.

Като говорим за пътешествия, аз имам две такива по суша в посока Индия. Първото го осъществих отчасти с колело, отчасти с обществен транспорт през 2005 година. За него написах книга, която публикувах с издателство Вакон през 2011 година. В момента книгата е със свободен досътп на - https://chitanka.info/book/4812-na-iztok-kym-in...

Второто повтаря същият маршрут, но този път изцяло преминат от гореспоменатия Опел през 20016/2017 година. 2016 година с жена ми стигнахме с Опела до Индия, а през 2017 върнах колата обратно до България с помощта на приятел - Радослав Колев.

Повече за пътешествието може да намерите в статия написана от мен и, публикувана в Opel Post, Германия - https://opelpost.com/07/2017/samiras-first-trip/

Снимки от пътуването на върщане може да видите на - http://kolev.info/files/rekordtrip/

В момента се опитвам да финансирам пътешествие поради простата причина, че сам, въпреки че много ми се иска, няма да мога да се справя. В същото време напирам кампанията да се осъществи просто, защото в момента е 40 годишния юбилей на Опела.

Определил съм за кампанията си сумата от 13000$, което покрива:

- документи на колата - 1000ЕВР - в това се включва, застраховка с ограничена помощ на пътя до Турция включително, carnet de passage и депозит към него в клон на СБА, винетни такси.

- визи за двама човека - на човек средно по 300ЕВР ще са визите. Таксите варират, но в общи линии покриват Иран - 150EUR, Пакистан - 100EUR, Индия - 50EUR. Общо 600ЕВР за шофьора и помощника.

- гориво за колата и други консумативи - 2000ЕВР за отиване и връщане. Според предишния преход с колата до Индия в едната посока горивото бе около 620ЕВР до границата с Индия. Сумата от 2000ЕВР, която съм определил идва от тежеста на терена и евентуалната необходимост от смяна на части или ремонт на превозното средство поради тежкия маршрут, който трябва да минем.

- фотоапарат - пътешествието без снимков и видео материал ще е отчасти на халос. Поради факта, че ми откраднаха апарата и всички обективи, след като ми разбиха колата и ме окрадоха в Индия през 2017 година. Сега ми се налага да купя или взема назаем оборудване. През 2017 взех назаем видео камера, която за щастие отчасти полицията намери и ми върна, но към камерата вървяха аксесоари, които в последствие трябваше да платя, което ми струваше около 400лв, след като се върнах в България. Сумата определена като 4000ЕВР ще покрие разходите по читав фотоапарат и поне два обектива.

- неочаквани разходи - 1500ЕВР, в случай на нужда, че по някаква независима от нас причина трябва да напуснем пътешствието и да се евакуираме, или да покрием разход от неизменен ремонт на автомобила.

- хотели/храна - 1500ЕВР. Поради времевия диапазон на пътешествието - от юли до ноември, екипажът на Опела ще има нужда от храна и подслон. Парите са да покрият основните нужди на двама души в продължение на 4 месеца и половина.

И ето ни, че достигнахме 10600ЕВР. Определената от мен сума 13001$ покрива таксите на Indiegogo. банкови трансфери и резервирани фондове от Indiegogo, за да може в крайна сметка екипажът на Опела да разполага със средствата от 10600ЕВР. Мащабна сума за едно толкова лекомислено пътешествие, но ако го погледнем като пътешествие на душата за откриване на себеподобни в същност сумата е незначителна.

Набирането на средства е фиксирано, защото в противен случай няма да мога да обезпеча поддръжниците си с това, което съм им обещал. Ако кампанията не събере на 100% средствата, всички поддръжнци ще получат обратно даренията си.


Short Summary

My name is Vladimir and I live in Bulgaria. I am an adventurer with a free spirit. In 2016 together with my wife, we drove our legendary Opel Rekord built 1979, from Bulgaria to India. Our plan was to give birth to our first baby in India. We have started from Bulgaria in late October and have reached India in December just in time for the baby to be born which happened in January 2017. You can read more on the topic covered by Opel at – https://opelpost.com/07/2017/samiras-first-trip/

We have stayed in India until June 2017 when we flew back home. We left the car in India and in August 2017 I went back to pick it up. I had an ambitious plan, to drive from Shimla to Tabo and Spiti Valley and then if still possible to bring the car to Leh and from there to go over Kardungh La at 5615m above sea level, to continue to Srinagar and from there back to Amritsar and the border with Pakistan. Unfortunately, my adventure was stolen along the way. One night in a small village in Rajasthan where I was camping, my car was broken into. Somebody broke the side window at the driver side while I was not attending the car and stole all my belongings. I have overtrusted the villagers as I usually do and they have taken advantage of stealing all my camera equipment, in the face of my beloved Nikon Df along with 5 lenses Nikkor Ais 28mm f2.8, Nikkor Ais 105mm f2.5, Nikkor Ai 80-200mm f4.5, Nikkor AF 50mm f1.8, Samyang 14mm f2.8, and a camcorder which I have borrowed from a Bulgarian TV Station, but the worst was that they have also found and stolen my wallet with my travel documents, so I have lost my passport and the adventure was killed just at its birth. I was fortunate enough to have my car papers intact.

You may say I am stupid to leave my documents inside the car, but I can not break my perception to trust immensely people. When I am traveling I am roaming alone surrounded by people who have all the power to help me, to hinder my plans, to do anything with me. If I keep too much tension on what negative can happen it will eventually happen anticipating it, or I will live through it any second I am in a foreign land. My principle is to surrender and to embrace whatever life serves me. And life has plenty of surprises at hand. I was penniless and the people from the police department gathered money - a total of 7000 INR - 100 EUR, to help me with the travel expenses, to get with the car to Delhi to report at the embassy of my country. I was also released paying toll road tax with a special letter prepared by them. A heart-touching gesture of people with an immense heart.

A week after the robbery, the police found and returned to me my driving license and the borrowed camcorder, the rest was never found.

Next, I went through a tough process on acquiring a temporary passport stamped with all the necessary visas, which at one point seemed impossible to be done from inside India and I was very close to go back to Bulgaria by air just because of some ridiculous bureaucracy rules. Thanks to the help of some open-minded government officials of 3 different countries I was free to go limited only by the duration of my temporary passport which the Bulgarian government has issued to be valid for only 30 days from which 15 were lost on visas and the remaining 2 weeks were a hectic driving back home through 4 countries. A friend of mine Radoslav Kolev came to India after I had acquired all the needed documents and helped me drive the car back to Bulgaria. Here you can find pictures of the return trip taken by him on his phone - http://kolev.info/files/rekordtrip/

Mission

The Opel Rekord is a legendary car. Seldom you can see it on the road nowadays. Year by year it is getting more and more difficult to maintain it because of lack of spare parts. Luckily my car is still running. It will be a great tribute to this car to say thank you for the service with one epic adventure. An epic car deserves an epic adventure for its anniversary birthday. The Opel turns 40 this year. It will be a way to say thank you to the engineers who put together such a remarkable piece of machinery. During the years when changing parts, I heard the comment from technicians repairing my vehicle "Look how thoughtfully this is done!" addressing a part of a key assembly.

My plan is again to go by road from Bulgaria to India, en route to drive on some spectacular roads in Turkey, Iran, and Pakistan. In India to attempt the route, Shimla, Spitti Valley and then Leh and Kardung La going back to Srinagar and back to the border with Pakistan. If there is time, the weather permits and the crew is well we can attempt the Karakoram highway on the way back. The product of the adventure will be a pool of photos and video footage featuring the car in all these locations. After returning I will put together a spectacular, fine-art, 200+ pages large format photo book and a short film documenting the adventure.

At the moment I am not able to finance a journey like this, let alone to buy or rent equipment in replacement of my stolen one, to document it. With my wife, we have two babies now to take care of and all our resources are centered there. I can see the idea happen only with community support, a community with a passion for machinery made to last.

So far I have only received compliments on that I still drive such a car on a regular basis. Some years ago, when stuck with problems which I was lucky enough to solve on the road other people were joking pointing out that the car deserves to be sent for scrap, my answer was that before it goes for scrap I will drive it to India. India is already an achieved goal, behind our back are also trips to Germany, France and one to Cyprus through Turkey and the unrecognized Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. The wheels of the Opel rolled in Serbia, Croatia, Slovenia, Germany, Austria, Hungary, Switzerland, Italy, France, Monaco, Turkey, Iran, Pakistan, India, Cyprus. And with your help and my dedication I would be happy to drive and support the car to reach the highest motorable road in Ladakh.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will be spent to cover the following needs:

carnet de passage/insurance for the vehicle - 1000EUR will cover the price for the carnet and a security deposit to the Bulgarian Automobile Association and insurance with partial road assistance in Turkey;

visas and other entry permits - multi-entry visas are required for Iran and Pakistan and a single entry for India. Price per person - Iran - 150EUR, Pakistan - 100EUR, India - 50EUR. 600EUR needed for the driver and co-driver.

fuel and other consumables for the car. The car runs on LPG and Benzine. LPG is available in Bulgaria and Turkey. In Iran and Pakistan LPG is not available, on my last trip I could not manage to find any. In India, LPG is available at some locations. The car spends about 10l fuel per 100km. Price for fuel in Iran in 2016/2017 was 1/3 to Europe, in Pakistan 1/2 to Europe, in India and Turkey it is the same as in Europe.

Estimated approximate distance per country one way. This is the bare minimum to reach our goal:

Turkey - 1700 km;

Iran - 2500 km;

Pakistan 1700 km;

India 2200 km;

Regarding the price of fuel, we will drive 2500 at maybe 1/3 the regular price, 1700 km at 1/2 the regular price and 3900 km at the regular price. Calculated for the bare minimum distance of 8100 km one way we will need around 620EUR. We will need to maintain the car along the way changing oil, adding coolant, changing air filters, rotate or maybe change tires, pay for toll roads so let us have the minimum of 2000 EUR to reach our goal with minimum safety.

renting/buying camera equipment, tripods, and mounts. This section will need about 4000EUR to get a few lenses with a decent DSLR, a tripod, 360-degree camera with proper mounts and storage. From my former equipment, I have remaining Atomos Ninja Star HD recorder, Nikkor Ais 50mm f1.8 lens, Samyang 100mm f2.8 Nikon mount and Nikon FM2 with 10 rolls of expired slide film. A DSLR camera in the range of Fuji XT3, Nikon D750 capable to be connected to Atomos recorder costs above 1500EUR, add two more lenses, storage cards, backup storage, extra batteries, car battery charger with a battery bank and the price runs over 4000EUR;

unexpected - 1500EUR, if we need to abandon the trip, evacuate ourselves, do a major repair on the car, etc.

hotel/food - 1500EUR for the Opel crew will be sufficient to drive in limited comfort for the time span middle of July - middle of November.

Total the goal runs to 10600EUR. I have set the goal to 13001USD to cover the fees applied by Indiegogo, Indiegogo reserved funds, for a bank and currency transfers. If the goal is met and there is still funding, the money will be used on getting more equipment like a drone to film the car from the air, to fit the car with some spare parts, to cover more distance going to more locations. The fundraising is fixed because in my view I will not be able to accomplish it to the fullest with a flexible goal.

Because I really want the community to take part in this adventure I am offering you to join me. There are 7 PERKS offered to any of you willing to be part of the Opel adventure.  You hop aboard at an arranged in advance location. As an Opel crew member you can participate to spend valuable time together, by telling us stories, discussing, planning the route, navigating, building camps, preparing food, maintaining the car, do plenty of photographs, shoot video, or do anything which will not compromise the vehicle, the passengers safety, nor harm the environment nor the people around us, in general to be a good and trustworthy companion willing to give a hand when needed. We will be 3 persons in the car with you, space will be a bit cramped, but still not unbearable because we stop frequently visit places, hike, shoot photos and video or just enjoy a view. You will share our humble meals and I will provide with a tent when camping, the rest is on you. Each PERK is for the duration of crossing a country, which may take 10-15 days. If you are willing to join us for the whole trip you can get all the PERKS in one direction and join us for the whole distance hopping in and out any time you want.

“Take only photos and leave just the tracks of the vehicle behind” is our motto.

The Impact

Documenting a trip like this brings hundreds of technical challenges like adjusting the fuel mixture at high altitude or maneuvering the car at road conditions above the car capabilities. People also need to acclimatize to the altitude. For the section of the road Tabo - Valley - Keylong - Leh I have already acquired car drivers roaming in the area and all of them report the road as difficult but not impossible for a car like the Opel. Nevertheless, it will be a technical and human challenge to overcome all difficulties and successfully drive to the Kardungh La pass. It is a pure adventure to accomplish such an endeavor and documenting with photos and video footage the progress of the trip is a great tribute to the car manufacturers and engineers behind the Opel Rekord, to the car owners and to all people supporting this goal.

As we live in a consumer-oriented world where business competes on increased sales we are producing more and more unusable garbage. Driving with the 40 years old Opel I would like to bring up again the awareness to people to make things to last and save natural resources when planning to produce the next good for nothing contraption to sell to the public.

Risks & Challenges

We will drive through some not quite secure countries in the Middle East, acquiring visas and permits to visit places may be hindered. The car is well maintained, but nevertheless we may experience a malfunction in the middle of nowhere, weather changes may deteriorate road conditions we must be prepared to abandon the vehicle or change the route or shorten the time of the trip or break the trip due to illness of the crew, irreparable problems with the vehicle, car accidents etc.

Health issues may arise, high altitude acclimatization is needed, roads are of a changing state in the mountains.

The car does not have airconditioner, but there is a working heater which will be very useful when the temperatures drop.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you live in any of the countries we will go through it will be great if you can offer us shelter, help us with clever planning the route telling us in advance of hidden obstacles, hang out with us, exchange stories, help us do a technical check up on the car, oil changes, any other maintenance we may require. You can donate us photography equipment, car navigating tools, camping gear, special tools for the car, just send us a message that you are there for us to help us.
story_txt: НакраткоЗа всички български поддръжници, става дума за пътешествие с поразклатен и поръждясал, но все още в перфектно движение Опел Рекорд, модел 1979 година до най-високите проходими за коли превали в света, които се намират в Ладах, Индия.Като говорим за пътешествия, аз имам две такива по суша в посока Индия. Първото го осъществих отчасти с колело, отчасти с обществен транспорт през 2005 година. За него написах книга, която публикувах с издателство Вакон през 2011 година. В момента книгата е със свободен досътп на - https://chitanka.info/book/4812-na-iztok-kym-in...Второто повтаря същият маршрут, но този път изцяло преминат от гореспоменатия Опел през 20016/2017 година. 2016 година с жена ми стигнахме с Опела до Индия, а през 2017 върнах колата обратно до България с помощта на приятел - Радослав Колев.Повече за пътешествието може да намерите в статия написана от мен и, публикувана в Opel Post, Германия - https://opelpost.com/07/2017/samiras-first-trip/Снимки от пътуването на върщане може да видите на - http://kolev.info/files/rekordtrip/В момента се опитвам да финансирам пътешествие поради простата причина, че сам, въпреки че много ми се иска, няма да мога да се справя. В същото време напирам кампанията да се осъществи просто, защото в момента е 40 годишния юбилей на Опела.Определил съм за кампанията си сумата от 13000$, което покрива:- документи на колата - 1000ЕВР - в това се включва, застраховка с ограничена помощ на пътя до Турция включително, carnet de passage и депозит към него в клон на СБА, винетни такси.- визи за двама човека - на човек средно по 300ЕВР ще са визите. Таксите варират, но в общи линии покриват Иран - 150EUR, Пакистан - 100EUR, Индия - 50EUR. Общо 600ЕВР за шофьора и помощника.- гориво за колата и други консумативи - 2000ЕВР за отиване и връщане. Според предишния преход с колата до Индия в едната посока горивото бе около 620ЕВР до границата с Индия. Сумата от 2000ЕВР, която съм определил идва от тежеста на терена и евентуалната необходимост от смяна на части или ремонт на превозното средство поради тежкия маршрут, който трябва да минем.- фотоапарат - пътешествието без снимков и видео материал ще е отчасти на халос. Поради факта, че ми откраднаха апарата и всички обективи, след като ми разбиха колата и ме окрадоха в Индия през 2017 година. Сега ми се налага да купя или взема назаем оборудване. През 2017 взех назаем видео камера, която за щастие отчасти полицията намери и ми върна, но към камерата вървяха аксесоари, които в последствие трябваше да платя, което ми струваше около 400лв, след като се върнах в България. Сумата определена като 4000ЕВР ще покрие разходите по читав фотоапарат и поне два обектива.- неочаквани разходи - 1500ЕВР, в случай на нужда, че по някаква независима от нас причина трябва да напуснем пътешствието и да се евакуираме, или да покрием разход от неизменен ремонт на автомобила.- хотели/храна - 1500ЕВР. Поради времевия диапазон на пътешествието - от юли до ноември, екипажът на Опела ще има нужда от храна и подслон. Парите са да покрият основните нужди на двама души в продължение на 4 месеца и половина.И ето ни, че достигнахме 10600ЕВР. Определената от мен сума 13001$ покрива таксите на Indiegogo. банкови трансфери и резервирани фондове от Indiegogo, за да може в крайна сметка екипажът на Опела да разполага със средствата от 10600ЕВР. Мащабна сума за едно толкова лекомислено пътешествие, но ако го погледнем като пътешествие на душата за откриване на себеподобни в същност сумата е незначителна.Набирането на средства е фиксирано, защото в противен случай няма да мога да обезпеча поддръжниците си с това, което съм им обещал. story:
Sick of Plastic?

So are we. Globally, we are producing 300 million pounds of plastic per year, 50% of which is for single-use purposes (plasticoceans.org). If the world continues this rate of plastic production, by 2050, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean* (Ellen MacArthur Foundation). Because of plastic pollution, people on average eat 5 grams of plastic a week - that's the equivalent of a credit card** (World Wildlife Foundation, 2019). Plastic is threatening the health of humans, marine life, and the planet. What can we do about this?

We've Got a Solution

Make your Home Zero Waste. For each house that goes zero waste we save 100 plastic bottles from going into our oceans and landfill.  Pono Home Essentials, our Hawaii-based company, has been delivering custom zero-waste subscription boxes with personal care and home cleaning products to customers to help reduce plastic use for two years now. Our subscription boxes are:

  • Customizable. For each box, you choose your own customize box of whatever home and personal care products you need right now. Next box? Change it up again! 
  • Flexible. Pick your frequency - monthly, bimonthly, or quarterly. 
  • Satisfaction guaranteed. Don't like something? Let us know and we'll replace it or refund it. 
  • Organic, all-natural products that are locally made.
  • Zero-waste. We buy your empties back, then clean 'em and refill 'em! We use aluminum and glass containers. For added zero-waste benefit, reuse the box and shipping materials and send back your empty bottles to us for free.
  • Free shipping. Both ways. 
  • Cancellable and refundable. Not into it anymore? No sweat - let us know and we'll refund the remaining balance minus your next box. 

We Want To Do More

Through this campaign, we will expand this zero-waste model across the U.S. to reduce plastic use. Our goal is to raise $20,000 to scale the Pono Home Essentials model nationally. To support this campaign to reduce plastic, you can purchase an annual subscription and receive products monthly, bi-monthly, or quarterly with deep discounts of up to 50% off!

The Impact

 

Rising to the Challenge

Disrupting business-as-usual is no easy task, and we're innovating new ways for companies to do things with more integrity. We also know that these are challenging times and it's hard to commit to a longer-term investment. Our intention is to disrupt the current system and provide models to help create a plastic-free world, and offer you value for your contribution through deeply discounted all-natural products.

If we reach our goal of raising $20,000, we can begin to scale this zero-waste model across the U.S. If we are not able to reach our goal, you won't be charged anything. 

This is open to anyone across the U.S., except Alaska (sorry Alaskans!).  

 

Tell Your Friends

Please share this zero waste offer with your social networks. We are active on Instagram and Facebook @ponohomeessentials  or you can subscribe to our newsletter to receive direct emails at the bottom of our website: www.ponohomeessentials.com

 

Additional Campaign Rewards

This book, Green Living Ideas, was written by our founder, Scott Cooney, who is a five-time eco-entrepreneur, former professor of sustainable business in the MBA program at the University of Hawaii, and a dude really stressed about plastic waste. It contains tons of energy/water/money saving tips to green your home, a list of the most common toxic ingredients in your personal care products, and DIY recipes if you want to make your own personal care products! 

You can also buy artwork that is made from plastics cleaned up off beaches!  The word "pono" in Hawaiian language can mean "doing the right thing, being moral or virtuous".  Get 1'x1' or 2'x2' custom-made artwork - 2'x2' pieces include a reclaimed wood frame! It's a major conversation starter to get people to understand the magnitude of the problem, and on top of that, it's gorgeous! Each piece will be custom made by a local artist in Hawaii, and delivery will likely be February or March 2021. 

 

Who Are We?

Pono Home Essentials is a small Hawaii-based business which is focused on providing customers with  all-natural and organic products through a zero-waste model. We're using this IndieGogo campaign to expand our zero-waste model across the U.S. for greater impact. This has been our passion project and we have invested blood, sweat, and tears into developing a business that supports zero-waste, circular economy, and provides quality products for everyday use. We now have a fully functional subscription service that makes zero-waste easy and we want to share it with you! 

We are a Green America certified Green Business that is committed to being a relentless force for good. Our parent company, Pono Home, provides energy efficiency services to residents to help save them energy and money. Since 2016, we have eliminated over 30 million pounds of carbon pollution per year.

We love what we do, and our products reflect that - they are made and delivered with love, and solutions for all the problems in mind. 

Questions? Contact us at info@ponohome.com 

---

* MacArthur Foundation study found that by 2050, there will be more tons of plastic in the ocean than all the fish combined.

** We don't eat a credit card worth of plastic on purpose, of course...but it's literally everywhere in tiny bits and pieces called microplastics, and verifiable studies show we're all eating about 5 grams a week - hidden in our food, water, and elsewhere...gross, right? You don't need to be a scientist to know that plastic, which is made from petroleum (crude oil), is not good for us to eat!

story:
Meet APiS Technology

Apis Technology is a smart solution designed to improve bees and their keepers’ lives.

Apis Technology is the ultimate tool for professional, hobbyist and scientist beekeepers. It was designed to improve the way beekeepers manage their apiaries, the comfort and safety of the bees, and to provide feasible data to your private devices.

In the last two years, we worked like crazy and we are now good to go straight to the pre-sale of the early units of Apis Technology products. This is a unique opportunity for you to be one of the first to get it and be a part of our cause.

This time, change happens inside the box. Join us, for the love of bees.

Read the whole campaign to know more.



As featured in


A bee problem

If you just saw our video up there, this will sound familiar to you: bees are dying faster than they did before. And this is important because one of three meals we eat is only possible because of bees, with great significance in global economy and health.

There are problems with beekeeping that one cannot control, like monocultures or pesticides. The so-called Colony Collapse Disorder (CCD). But there are other challenges that beekeepers can face.

The problem is that regular beekeeping is hard work, and there’s no way to run from that. It involves regular visits, unnecessary and disturbing inspections and a time consuming logistic effort. Naturally combining the typical difficulties of the bees (like winter or invaders) with the most recent ones (CCD), the result is systematic losses for beekeepers.

Bees demand dedication, care and all the love they deserve.

With APiS Technology we can’t manage to save them all but we are seriously improving things.

Apis Technology was born from the need to change things we find bee unfriendly. We saw many beekeepers making mistakes that could be avoided with the use of harmless technology.

But that is about to change.



APiS Monitoring System


Apis monitoring system is beekeepers’ best friend

Suitable to any beehive

Tracks bees’ activity in real time


Are bees foraging? Are they producing? Is there anything wrong with one of my apiaries or beehives? Apis Monitoring System automatically analyzes everything for you.

This way you can reduce and manage the visits to each apiary, making it easier to you and much more peaceful to the bees. All the beekeeper has to do is to check the computer, smartphone or tablet. Your bees are just one quick click away.


If something goes wrong with your girls, you receive an immediate notification

You can be sure that your bees are safe


Features


Apis monitoring system analyzes the state of your colony and sends all the information to the platform, sending you a personal notification in case of alarm. Example: your new queen just started laying. You will get a notification to party hard.

More:

You can monitor the hive performance. With Apis Technology we are able to check the honey production of the colony, with aggregate or individual readings, assess the production of honey even before the harvest or check the working level of bees each day.

You’ll be able to control threats. We obviously can’t avoid big animals next to the hives or parasites taking care of our bees, but we can predict something bad is happening and send an immediate notification so the beekeeper can protect the girls.


HOW TO USE IT

First of all, our technology is really quite simple to install.


Communication module

The Communication Module is responsible for receiving the information of all beehives and sending it directly to the cloud. This module allows you to save money because it’s the only one that needs to be connected to the internet. This network mechanism allows you to place all your hive monitors the way you want, and shift them, without a problem. Truly a masterpiece.

The only thing you have to do is to bolt or place it at the center of the apiary. As simple as that.


Hive Monitor

The Hive Monitor is the brain of each beehive. This module reads everything about what happens inside the beehive with the swarm, like knowing if the queen is laying, assess if the temperature is comfortable and if the level of humidity is between the sanity levels.

The Hive Monitor Module was designed to be as scalable as possible. This means that our goal was to make this product affordable to every beekeeper and handy enough to be easily placed inside the beehive without any effort.

The Hive Monitor module is the brain because it receives the readings from Bee Counter and the Scale and sends it to the Communication Module through a wireless connection.


Bee Counter

It's exactly like an entrance reducer but with incorporated electronics. Apis Bee Counter protects the inside of the beehive from bigger animals, while reading the foraging level of your bees or if a beehive is being attacked by an Asian wasp, for example.

The Bee Counter was developed by the Apis Technology team assuring that bees are comfortable with that and that the beekeeper can easily install it.

To install the Bee Counter you only have to connect a small cable to the Hive Monitor Module and insert the upper part of the metallic counter in the beehive. Just like a normal entrance reducer. Super easy.



Apis Scale


The scale measures the development of your beehives. This way you can check the honey production or the development of your swarms, along the time.

Apis Scale is built with industrial strain gauges and metallic body which means that we didn’t compromised on quality, assuring that this product can face the adversity of weather conditions.

To install it you have to place the Apis Scale where you want the beehive and place the beehives above it.

Apis Interface
Apis Interface is where you will see everything happen. It's where all the hardware comes together to show the data. The interface was designed to make it easy and comfortable to assess your bees. You'll be able to access it in your smartphone, tablet or laptop.


HOW  IT WORKS

Specs


Apis Beehive


APiS beehive assures thermal efficiency with a passive solution (without electronics). It promotes 50% more temperature control in the hive just because of its construction.

Winter is no piece of cake for bees. They can even die from coldness or produce less because they are so much more focused on trying to survive. Our Apis Beehive assures a controlled temperature due to its patented triple wall with intermediate insulate coating, providing better thermal efficiency regarding the outside temperature.

The beehive is also much more durable. How? Our country is premium in cork. And that made it pretty easy for us to decide to use an exclusive coating ink based on that material. Our hives become more resistant. Besides that the cork coating provides a greater look. The Taj Mahal of the hives.

Apis Beehive is also more comfortable for both bees and beekeepers. For bees it is hotter and cozier. For the beekeeper, besides the peace of mind that the monitoring technology brings, physically it has holding wings that allow him to easily hold the beehive when he needs to transport it. You know what we’re talking about.

Our beehive offers the possibility of having a solid bottom or a screened one, so let us know which one you want when you buy a hive.

Hive type – Langstroth

Hive components:

– brood box

– flight board

– metal entrance block

– metal roof (outer cover)

– inner cover



A BEE-FRIENDLY APPROACH

When we talk about technology it may seem scary for those who just want to keep things natural with the bees. Well, we want you to know that we get that.

Our team worked the last two years to create a way to bring a smart non-offensive hive and monitor technology. And we mean non-offensive in every way. We assure you that bees will not be affected by radiation or anything else that may disturb them. The idea is to make things better for them. Never the opposite.

Let’s cut to the chase.

First we must tell you that we did an intensive research to find the best materials to fit our hive and the best technics to improve our monitoring technology. The result is an apparently traditional beehive, but prettier, safer, more comfortable and mostly more efficient.

By keeping things natural (but better) for bees, this technology will change the way beekeeping goes.



Perks



Stretch goals

Free Perks

Now you can win Apis Products. Refer as many friends as you can to unlock new perks.


Timeline

Team

We are beekeepers, engineers, designers, managers, sons and boyfriends, but above all we are bee lovers.


We need you

We chose to sell the first units of APiS technology products through a crowdfunding campaign, so we can produce our products at an industrial scale and read all your suggestions to turn this into a disruptive system.

Your contribution will help us to:

-  Fine tune the hardware to make the products cheaper

-  Launch the pre-series and obtain the regulatory approvals

-  Start the manufacturing process


Risk & Challenges

We are committed to bring you the finest products, and won't settle for anything less. We will work closely with our manufacturing partners to ensure that the APiS products come in perfect form and function in a timely manner.

Please be aware that we are constantly trying to improve our products so the final version can be slightly different than the one being presented.

We are dedicated to our project timeline and will keep you informed on the status of our progress on a regular basis. Thank you so much for all your support and contributions.


Frequently Asked Questions


How many products does APiS have? Do I need to purchase all of them?

APiS Technology’s product line consists of a beehive and a hive monitoring system. If we put the hive and the hive monitoring system together we get our Smart Hive. You can purchase the hive, the hive monitoring system or both. The hive monitoring system needs a Hive Monitor and a Communication Module and they heavily depend on each other. Then you can add a bee counter and a scale, they are optional.

What is an APiS Hive?

An APiS Hive is a langstroth beehive that is thermally more efficient then the common ones.

For whom is the Hive Monitoring System for?

The Hive Monitoring system is a tool for every professional, hobbyist or scientist beekeeper.

Can I apply the APiS Monitoring System into my current beehives?

Yes. We want this to be as affordable as possible so we have designed it so you can use it in your current beehives, whatever the kind their kind. However, if you use an APiS beehive, you will have some sensors already installed in it.

Do the APiS Monitoring System disturb the bees?

Not in any way. The life of the bees stays untouchable. We will even prevent some inspections, which helps to not disturb the girls.

Can I inspect the hive without turning the APiS Monitoring System off?

Yes. You can inspect a hive like you always did. You just have to take out the temperature probe when you're inspecting the brood box and put it in again when the inspection is over. No harm for any one.

How many should I buy if I have multiple apiaries?

You should buy at least one Communication Module per apiary and one Hive Monitor per hive that you want to monitor.

If I don't have GSM network at my apiary, can I use the Hive Monitoring System?

Yes. If you don't have GSM network at your apiary, the Hive Monitoring System can record all the data in a SD card and you can download it to the APiS platform after.

When can I buy one?

You can pre-order at Indiegogo starting September 7th, 2015.

How is it powered?

The APiS Hive Monitor is powered by 2 AA batteries and the APiS Communication Module is powered by 4 AA batteries. The Scale and the bee counter are connected to the hive monitor. The batteries are not included.

How long will the battery last?

Our first tests point to around 2-3 months. But we are constantly trying to improve our systems.

What kind of SIM card can I use with the monitoring system?

You can use whatever SIM card you want as long as it has a data plan for internet. The SIM card is not included.

Is the shipping cost included?

The shipping cost will be added at check-out based on the shipping destination.

Does it come with tech support?

For tech support, please email info@apistech.eu.

When do you ship?

In early 2016 (targeting April).

Can I get a refund?

Pre-orders are not refundable. By making a contribution to this campaign, you acknowledge that you understand you are contributing to a work-in-progress and not making a direct purchase. For more details please see Indiegogo's Terms of Use.

I don't see my answer.

Please email us at info@apistech.eu. Keep in mind that we're getting many answer requests every hour. We will get back to you ASAP.

We are dedicated to our project timeline and will
keep you informed on the status of our progress on a regular basis. Thank you so
much for all your support and contributions.


Frequently Asked Questions




How many products does APiS have? Do I
need to purchase all of them?
APiS Technology’s product line
consists of a beehive and a hive monitoring system. If we put the hive and the hive monitoring system together we get our Smart Hive. You can purchase the hive, the hive monitoring system
or both. The hive monitoring system needs a Hive Monitor and a Communication Module and
they heavily depend on each other. Then
you can add a bee counter and a scale, they are optional.
What is an APiS Hive?
An APiS Hive is a langstroth beehive
that is thermally more efficient then the common ones.
For whom is the Hive Monitoring System for?
The Hive Monitoring system is a tool for every professional,
hobbyist or scientist beekeeper.
Can I apply the APiS Monitoring System
into my current beehives?
Yes. We want this to be as affordable as
possible so we have designed it so you can use it in your current beehives, whatever
the kind their kind. However, if you use an APiS beehive, you will have some
sensors already installed in it.
Do the APiS Monitoring System disturb the bees?
Not in any way. The life of the bees stays untouchable. We will even prevent
some inspections, which helps to not disturb the girls.
Can I inspect the hive without turning
the APiS Monitoring System off?
Yes. You can inspect a hive like you
always did. You just have to take out the temperature probe when you're
inspecting the brood box and put it in again when the inspection is over. No
harm for any one.
How many should I buy if I have multiple apiaries?
You should buy at least one Communication Module per
apiary and one Hive Monitor per hive that you want to monitor.
If I don't have GSM network at my
apiary, can I use the Hive Monitoring System?
Yes. If you don't have GSM network at your apiary, the Hive Monitoring System can record all the data in a SD card and you can download it
to the APiS platform after.
When can I buy one?
You can pre-order at Indiegogo
starting September 7th, 2015.
How is it powered?
The APiS Hive Monitor is powered by 2 AA
batteries and the APiS Communication Module is powered by 4 AA batteries. The Scale and the
bee counter are connected to the hive monitor. The batteries are not included.
How long will the battery last?
Our first tests point to around 2-3 months. But we are constantly trying to improve our systems.

What kind of SIM card can I use with the monitoring system?
You can use whatever SIM card you want as long as it has a data plan for internet. The SIM card is not included.

Is the shipping
cost included?
The shipping cost will be
added at check-out based on the shipping destination.
Does it come with tech
support?
For tech support, please email
info@apistech.eu.

When do you ship?
In early 2016 (targeting April).

Can I get a refund?
Pre-orders are not refundable.
By making a contribution to this campaign, you acknowledge that you understand you are contributing to a work-in-progress and not making a direct
purchase. For more details please see Indiegogo's Terms of Use.
I don't see my answer.
Please email us at info@apistech.eu.
Keep in mind that we're getting many answer requests every hour. We will get
back to you ASAP.

story:
Short Summary

 

  • We are a UK-based start up, founded by a pharmacist with industry experience in fast moving consumer goods (FMCG) and a procurement professional with a healthcare background.
  • Here at Bamboo Buddy, we are conscious about the environmental impact of plastics and are therefore developing a bio-degradable, eco-friendly alternative to an everyday use item; a non-plastic, sustainable version of the interdental tuft brush. 
  • Although starting small, we hope to develop even more environmentally sustainable products as alternatives to existing plastics.
  • We hope that you will help us with this project, so that our vision of a more sustainable consumer market and and fewer plastics on our Earth can come true.
  •  We also welcome any new ideas for sustainable products, that our Bamboo Buddies may have.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are already in the final stages of developing this product and are almost ready to ship. We hope to attract environmentally conscious retailers and consumers who are looking for a high quality, eco-friendly interdental tuft brush or for alternatives to everyday items.

 

  • You can buy one interdental tuft brush for £4.00, which is 20% discount off our normal retail price (RRP). This would be ideal for an individual. Buy a four tuft brush pack for just £15.00, which is 25% discount off RRP. For our larger deals; buy sixteen tuft brushes for £58.00 (27% off RRP), thirty two tuft brushes for £110.00 (31% off RRP) and sixty four tuft brushes for just £194.00 (39% off RRP). Our larger deals are perfect for individuals looking to stock up for the year, families (both small and large) and retailers looking to make a change for the better.
  • Funds will go towards the development of of our non-plastic alternative products. All contributors will still receive their products if we do not reach our goal.

 

The Impact

 

  • As you know, plastic is a very common material, used in many everyday items. Unfortunately, since plastic is a material which is made to last, it will take hundreds of years to biodegrade. Plastic is also a toxic material, so whilst it breaks down it contributes to air pollution, leaching toxins such as bisphenol-A (BPA) into the atmosphere. That's where we come in. Within the Bamboo Buddy development process, we ensure that all materials used are eco-friendly and biodegradable. We don't just stop at what the majority of the product is made from to call it 100% biodegradable. This is why we have chosen to source plant-based bristles rather than Nylon-6, which people are claiming to be biodegradable. Unfortunately Nylon-6 is not biodegradable due to its strong amide bonds. Enough of the chemist talk, let's just say you can trust us to provide you with eco-friendly quality. 

 

  • Founded by a pharmacist with relevant industry experience in FMCG and a procurement expert, we feel we have the necessary skills and expertise for this project. We are looking to develop a market for this product as we believe it is an environmentally sustainable solution to an everyday item that thousands of people use.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Please if you are unable to contribute, share our campaign so that we can gain visibility for our idea.
  • For every 100 orders placed, we will make a donation towards an environmentally-conscious charity.

The Impact
 
As you know, plastic is a very common material, used in many everyday items. Unfortunately, since plastic is a material which is made to last, it will take hundreds of years to biodegrade. Plastic is also a toxic material, so whilst it breaks down it contributes to air pollution, leaching toxins such as bisphenol-A (BPA) into the atmosphere. That's where we come in. story:
We are the Velasquez family originally from El Salvador residing in the USA for several years.

We are initiating this campaign to plant one million trees in areas that sustain rivers and streams.

Work with school children to change the culture, start with kids entering first grade and draw a parallel with the trees that we will be planting and their personal lives.  Plant a tree, cultivate a life.

Our focus is on plating species of trees that will have green foliage year round and that in few years they will yield some type of economic benefit to the community.

Why this Project?

It is important to teach young millennials that things don’t happen by magic that we need to work hard to protect the environment. 

We have had several meetings with local people and teachers and they are onboard with the idea, and would like to start this year.  The targeted area when the project will start in the North areas of La Union El Salvador.

Your support will be much appreciated, the planet will thank you and so the children for who’s culture we are trying to influence.

Cordially,

Team: MI FUTURO HOY (my future begins today)

story:
Infection is floating in the air from residual pollution from industry, construction sites and garbage; but at least it can be trapped to make the air indoors safe for all of us.

There is today a greater amount of infectious particulate matter in the air due to garbage and waste material from our industrialised and dense population concentration. Add to this the fact that the particulate matter is now “OILY” in character from exhaust fumes of engines in the form of vehicles, generators, cooking; it sticks to everything where it gets deposited. Just imagine what will do the insides of your lungs once it finds its way in there?

It only gets worse in small apartments and offices where the cross ventilation is rather poor.  Natural breeze and circulation brings in the pollution but then it remains trapped. Without exhaust fans there is rarely any cross ventilation.

Our Solution

A unique piece of furniture that looks like a side table but which is really a Dust trapper wih a built-in lamp and Aroma diffuser(optional)/Camphorater for safe, clean anti-allergic room space specially designed for people with allergic tendencies, children and patients with lung and sinus problems to counter the heavy air pollution that we face nowadays.

Available Models

  • Snooze
  • Zen
  • Colonel

It will keep the area in a room around the sleeping/working individual relatively free of excess dust, act as a lamp and fit into any decor. 


Features

  • Dust Trapper  Air Purifier with Camphorator
  • Hand made in India 
  • Easy to clean & Low Maintenance
  • Inbuilt Bedside Lamp/Diffuser

Specifications

  • Capacity: 400 square feet in 4 hours.
  • Effectively traps Airborne allergen particles, Toxic molds, Pollens, Kitchen soot, Dust Particles and Mites, Particles generated from Diesel use.
  • Operates on 220V/110V AC Power Source.

How to use

  • Plug-in.
  • Switch on. Complete dusting, sweeping, brooming of your space.
  • Run for 3-4 hours.
  • Re[eat after 24 hours.
  • Leave the space around it free for the movement of air ( about 6-8 cms/3 inches minimum)

Using the unit.

1) These units are designed to be used when dusting, sweeping and brooming your home/office. Put it on and let it run for 3-4 hours. 

Note: Brooming only removes the bigger visible particles and unfortunately also lifts & spreads the fine thin dust into the air-space which stays back hanging in the air while you are breathing it in, thinking your room has been cleaned. Later within 24 hours it has settles back on things all around you. By disturbing it you only make it easy for the dust to enter your breathing system. Trap it before it hurts you. Where cross-ventilation is lacking, the importance of the unit grows exponentially. After that if used with care the unit should last you for a long time.


2) FILTER PADS and their Maintenance

Very important. Keep an eye on the filter pad. If it looks dirty clean it as per instructions

Remove the filter by opening the top, then wash it and replace it along the same lines back into place.


3) For disinfecting the room, pure camphor or any camphorated balm, petroleum jelly based can be used and for fragrance, any essential oil, oil based perfume will do too.


Terms of Business

The product is supplied in good faith. All the components have been sourced in good faith from regular established manufacturing houses/ traders. We promise prompt redressal of complaints due to any defect in working if and when reported within 2 weeks. 

Manufacturing and Distribution

Our office, R&D facility and manufacturing is based in Delhi, India. We have access to raw material including wood, stainless steel rods, filters and high-quality exhaust fans from our quality vendors. The product will be manufactured by experienced local artisans, electricians and carpenters. 

Shipping

*Free Shipping Across India.

We use local shipping courier to ship the product all over India. In case of International shipping, then product will be properly packed and delivered via courier service like DHL/FEDEX/Bluedart/Others.

Safe Air Purifier is fully assembled and ready to use when shipped from our manufacturing facility. It will be packed in a high-quality damage-proof box . We make sure that Safe Air reaches you in perfect condition. 


Team



Why do we need your support?

We now need your help to take this product to very household.
Of course, there is an alternative. The alternative is to always wear a mouth-nose mask and never remove it even or a few minutes!

What we will do with your support?

Funds will be utilised in three activities:
1) Establishing a quality manufacturing hub using local craftsmen.
2) Printing and distribution of educational material to highlight the dangers of pollution and wastage.
3) Establish counselling centres and help lines through local language helpers.

FAQ

How long will it take for Safe Air to be delivered?

-We expect to finish delivering Safe Air to our supporters by the end of September 2016. We will distribute our products from Delhi, India.

We need extra filters. How will that work? How long can the filter last?

We will provide with extra filters and with washing and reuse the original pack should last you a long time. More can be ordered from us. Sent by post easily.

Do you deliver beyond India?

Yes, we can. All we need is just a little extra shipping cost. Please message us at namastesafeair@gmail.com directly if you want to order outside the India.

I like the design, the video demonstration, and everything, but can Safe Air really work great?

We have spent months, day in and day out, in our lab to carefully design, model, and test Safe Air. You will not find any similar product that has the same set of functions as Safe Air. You will witness the effect of our product not only by numbers or data, but also from the breath that you take every second in your office or at home. If you do not like our product, we will be happy to refund 100% of the cost.

What about Ionisers and Ozone?

IONISERS only help the dust to settle down. This is not required in Safe-Air.

Ozone is used for disinfection. Too much ozone is hazardous to health. Camphorating is better.

THE ANSWER IS IN REMOVING THE OFFENDING PARTICULATE MATTER!



Contact Us

If you got any feedback or business proposals then feel free to write to us at namastesafeair@gmail.com

Contact Us
If you got any feedback or business proposals then feel free to write to us at namastesafeair@gmail.com

story:
The Sunderbans

The Sundarbans mangrove forest, one of the largest such forests in the world (140,000 ha), lies on the delta of the Ganges, Brahmaputra and Meghna rivers on the Bay of Bengal. It is adjacent to the border of India’s Sundarbans World Heritage site inscribed in 1987. The site is intersected by a complex network of tidal waterways, mudflats and small islands of salt-tolerant mangrove forests, and presents an excellent example of ongoing ecological processes. The area is known for its wide range of fauna, including 260 bird species, the Bengal tiger and other threatened species such as the estuarine crocodile and the Indian python. 

The Sundarbans is very vulnerable to a variety of anthropogenic activity, including intensive boating and fishing, dredging, tourism and port activities, operation of mechanized boats, excavation of sand from the riverbed, and the establishment of coal power plants.There are a number of endangered species in the Sundarbans, including two river dolphins and an endemic bird, the masked finfoot, which are even more at risk because of these environmental threats. The current threats to the ecosystem could also affect the dwindling number of Royal Bengal Tigers.

Saving the Sundaris.

Sundari. Local name of the dominant plant species, Heritiera fomes, of the family Sterculiaceae, in the Sundarbans, the mangrove forests of the southern districts. The species is distributed up to about 70 per cent of the forest. The name Sundarbans is supposed to be derived from the name of the plant, Sundari.

We as a non-profit organisation are trying our level best to prevent the deforestation happening one tree at a time. We are looking for benefactors to support our aforestation by backing us and helping us spread awareness.

The Impact

Forests cover about 30 percent of the planet's land mass, but humans are cutting them down, clearing these essential habitats on a massive scale. The rate of deforestation of the Sunderbans is around 8% till date. This has lead to the following immediate threats.

  • Affect the dwindling number of Royal Bengal Tigers.
  • Irregular Rains and Monsoons. 
  • Increase in Salinity levels.
  • Loss of land mass.
  • Increase in arsenic levels for drinking water.

Tigers, Crocodiles and Humans- Our Challenges

We as a non-profit organisation are trying our level best to prevent the deforestation happening one tree at a time.

  • The aforestation is often done near human inhabited areas, which result in saplings dying due to human interference.
  • The primary reason for this drive is to build semi bio degradable sapling covers to protect it from human interference.
  • We are always in short supply of the resources, be it manpower, be it flexible bamboo stents.
  • Other major worry is that of the tigers, though dwindling in numbers are often seen close to localities.

Spread the word.

  • The Sunderbans is the second largest mangrove after The Amazon. 
  • A simple word of mouth campaign is all that is required.

story:
The Santa Giulia wood in Palazzo San Gervasio, Southern Italy, is an oasis of a thousand hectares.

 

Various animal species (wolves, wild boars, badgers, otters, fallow deer, porcupines), birds (woodcock, woodpecker, thrush, hawks, eagle owl, owl, great tit, snipe, buzzard) live here making the area a true natural reserve. 

Moreover, there are numerous water sources, some with pylons built by shepherds around 1700 with the aim to provide fresh water to drink, do the laundry and water their animals.

The wood has been also used for the ancient transhumance of cattle, so there are caves that served as shelter for both humans and animals.

There is a beautiful lake (Lake Santa Giulia - or Lake Frontetusio), built in 1978 in order to make the area a tourist destination.

The Santa Giulia wood is also characterized by a numerous amount of pedestrian paths, which allow the visitor to reach almost any area. The changing morphology of the terrain through the wood makes it look always different.

 

 

In 1997, the municipality of Palazzo San Gervasio built a campsite, which was unfortunately never used and, once abandoned, was ruined by vandals.

Poachers are exterminating the fauna, some people illegally cut trees, some others unlawfully discharge construction waste of all kinds.

Politics has abandoned the forest, the lake, the campsite in recent years, turning a fantastic place in a simply useless site.

 

So, in 2016, after almost 20 years, following a redevelopment of the house inside the campsite, and the lighting around the lake made by the municipality, we decided to start - privately through our association - a re-evaluation program for the entire forest, in order to make it accessible to everyone, and transform the forest into a protected oasis.

 

The association Alma Palatium, is a tourism promotion association, with the aim of enhancing the territory, with a focus on naturalistic and historical areas. It is made up of young people living in Basilicata, who want to see the place where they were born becoming a healthier and better place, making the whole world know the history and nature of Basilicata.

 

We started our battle, freeing ducks, geese, swans and fishes to the lake, to make it more "alive"; we cleaned the camping area, rebuilt the electrical system and the fence, built benches and tables to be used for picnics and outdoor days.

 

 

 

 

We have also organized ecological days to clean the forest from waste, picnic days, for families; we hired an acrobatic park and opened the camp-site for campers and scouts throughout Italy. We started to create signs to visit the forest without getting lost.

 

But all we have done so far is not enough, and we do not have the necessary resources to make the whole area a paradise. Unfortunately, the Italian bureaucracy is slow and convoluted, and getting funds is almost impossible.

 

 

WHAT DO WE WANT TO DO?

 

FOREST

 

 

We want to see the forest clean, usable by everyone and make it an example for everyone, educating children to respect nature;

we intend to buy animals (fallow deer and deer), free them and defend them from poaching by means of gps locators and monitoring wild life in the park with an electric car.

We’d like to create boards to illustrate the various animals and plants that live in the area.

Organize ecological excursions, educating visitors to the importance of nature.

Restructure the ancient fountains and the caves used for transhumance.

Keep the roads clean and in good condition.

 

LAKE

 

we want to continue the repopulation of the fish, which are captured by the fishermen (without license),

keep the lake clean,

introduce shuttle bikes, for bicycle rides on the water.

build a small floating island in the middle of the lake, to allow swans and ducks to reproduce because, due to their proximity to humans, they can not find a suitable place to build a nest.

Close the road that goes around the lake and buy wheelchairs for disabled people, so that everyone can enjoy the peace of this place.

 

 

CAMPSITE

 

 

 we want to complete the work as it was planned twenty years ago:

completely restore the lighting system and the electrical connections for the pitches;

create an acrobatic park, which can also be used by disabled people with modified wheelchairs, to give them the emotion of experiencing nature and sporting activity.

Buy masonry barbecues, to avoid lighting fires;

Create a "house of butterflies and fireflies", a large greenhouse where to breed butterflies and fireflies that, due to pollution, are disappearing; it will be possible to visit it and admire the beauty of these insects, very useful for the ecosystem.

Buy mountain bikes to organize walks in the forest by bike, avoiding further pollution.

 

In this way, we will increase jobs, in an area where unemployment rose to 40%, and from which young people run away in search of a better future.

 

In two years, without money, we have already achieved remarkable results. But we need funds because we can not make these very important investments. If you believe that our cause is right, if you believe the world is in the hands of the youngs, help us. We will be happy to host you whenever you want, and update you every time on our progress. We want to stay here, work and improve this place, making it more beautiful, cleaner and healthier, respecting it and loving it as we have always done.
story_txt:
The Santa Giulia wood in Palazzo San Gervasio, Southern Italy, is an oasis of a thousand hectares.
 
Various animal species (wolves, wild boars, badgers, otters, fallow deer, porcupines), birds (woodcock, woodpecker, thrush, hawks, eagle owl, owl, great tit, snipe, buzzard) live here making the area a true natural reserve. 

Moreover, there are numerous water sources, some with pylons built by shepherds around 1700 with the aim to provide fresh water to drink, do the laundry and water their animals.

The wood has been also used for the ancient transhumance of cattle, so there are caves that served as shelter for both humans and animals.


There is a beautiful lake (Lake Santa Giulia - or Lake Frontetusio), built in 1978 in order to make the area a tourist destination.

The Santa Giulia wood is also characterized by a numerous amount of pedestrian paths, which allow the visitor to reach almost any area. The changing morphology of the terrain through the wood makes it look always different.
 

 
In 1997, the municipality of Palazzo San Gervasio built a campsite, which was unfortunately never used and, once abandoned, was ruined by vandals.
Poachers are exterminating the fauna, some people illegally cut trees, some others unlawfully discharge construction waste of all kinds.
Politics has abandoned the forest, the lake, the campsite in recent years, turning a fantastic place in a simply useless site.
 
So, in 2016, after almost 20 years, following a redevelopment of the house inside the campsite, and the lighting around the lake made by the municipality, we decided to start - privately through our association - a re-evaluation program for the entire forest, in order to make it accessible to everyone, and transform the forest into a protected oasis.
 
The association Alma Palatium, is a tourism promotion association, with the aim of enhancing the territory, with a focus on naturalistic and historical areas. It is made up of young people living in Basilicata, who want to see the place where they were born becoming a healthier and better place, making the whole world know the history and nature of Basilicata.
 
We started our battle, freeing ducks, geese, swans and fishes to the lake, to make it more "alive"; we cleaned the camping area, rebuilt the electrical system and the fence, built benches and tables to be used for picnics and outdoor days.
 

 

 

 
We have also organized ecological days to clean the forest from waste, picnic days, for families; we hired an acrobatic park and opened the camp-site for campers and scouts throughout Italy. We started to create signs to visit the forest without getting lost.
 
But all we have done so far is not enough, and we do not have the necessary resources to make the whole area a paradise. Unfortunately, the Italian bureaucracy is slow and convoluted, and getting funds is almost impossible.
 
 
WHAT DO WE WANT TO DO?
 
FOREST
 

 
We want to see the forest clean, usable by everyone and make it an example for everyone, educating children to respect nature;
we intend to buy animals (fallow deer and deer), free them and defend them from poaching by means of gps locators and monitoring wild life in the park with an electric car.
We’d like to create boards to illustrate the various animals and plants that live in the area.
Organize ecological excursions, educating visitors to the importance of nature.
Restructure the ancient fountains and the caves used for transhumance.
Keep the roads clean and in good condition.
 
LAKE
 

we want to continue the repopulation of the fish, which are captured by the fishermen (without license),
keep the lake clean,
introduce shuttle bikes, for bicycle rides on the water.
build a small floating island in the middle of the lake, to allow swans and ducks to reproduce because, due to their proximity to humans, they can not find a suitable place to build a nest.
Close the road that goes around the lake and buy wheelchairs for disabled people, so that everyone can enjoy the peace of this place.
 

 
CAMPSITE
 
 
 we want to complete the work as it was planned twenty years ago:
completely restore the lighting system and the electrical connections for the pitches;
create an acrobatic park, which can also be used by disabled people with modified wheelchairs, to give them the emotion of experiencing nature and sporting activity.
Buy masonry barbecues, to avoid lighting fires;
Create a "house of butterflies and fireflies", a large greenhouse where to breed butterflies and fireflies that, due to pollution, are disappearing; it will be possible to visit it and admire the beauty of these insects, very useful for the ecosystem.
Buy mountain bikes to organize walks in the forest by bike, avoiding further pollution.
 
In this way, we will increase jobs, in an area where unemployment rose to 40%, and from which young people run away in search of a better future.
 
In two years, without money, we have already achieved remarkable results. But we need funds because we can not make these very important investments. If you believe that our cause is right, if you believe the world is in the hands of the youngs, help us. We will be happy to host you whenever you want, and update you every time on our progress. We want to stay here, work and improve this place, making it more beautiful, cleaner and healthier, respecting it and loving it as we have always done.

story:
Short Summary

 

Buy one of only 200 raffle tickets for only $25. 

You have a 1 in 200 chance of winning this awesome ebike. 

We will ship the GoCycle at no charge to winner anywhere in the US. 

Retail value of ebike is $2800.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The Sustainability League hopes to raise $5000 with this raffle. 

$2800 for the e-bike and $2200 for our operation costs. 

All of our staff is volunteer, so funds go to projects or providing education.

 

The Impact

 

You may be familiar with the UN IPCC report on climate change.  Climate change must be our #1 priority for our planet to survive. 

This project is our first and will have a tiny impact, but we hope it leads to more and larger projects.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

We will be raffling this awesome e-bike regardless of the number of tickets sold.  But we hope to sell all 200.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Please share this campaign with as many people as possible.

Check us out on Twitter--@leaguesustain

                            Facebook--@thesustainabilityleague

And on our webpage at thesustainabilityleague.org

story:
In July I will volunteer for Raleigh International on a development program in Costa Rica. This time I am going to be a Team Leader.

Raleigh works with communities that have specifically requested their help. It also aims to inspire young people in UK, Costa Rica and overseas to become active citizens who are passionate about long term community development.

This will allow them to continue to bring about positive change in the developing communities where they work. You can check out their amazing work here

Any contribution from you will make a real difference to the lives of people in developing countries, so please dig deep!

 

Thanks for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Oil & Gas Business vs. the Adriatic Sea? 

Or, money for a few vs. nature and health for everyone?

- Experience warm, crystal clear seas with a myriad of beaches and thousands of islands to explore

- Discover incredibly rich history and archaeology

- See amazing fauna and natural wonders 

- Savour exquisite gastronomy using delicious ingredients from both the sea and the countryside

- Find all of that along a beautiful coast that is, islands included, about 6000 km long

All that and much more is the Croatian coast, and no wonder this beautiful part of our planet has become a top tourist destination. But all of that seems to mean little to  Croatia's own government and their plan to concede more than 90% of Adriatic Sea for very long time to international companies for oil and natural gas exploitation.

It is not difficult to imagine what would happen to all this beauty if, in the semi-closed sea such as Adriatic is, just one oil rig goes "mad". Maybe that is why the Croatian government and its media never really entertained any public discussion about this outrageous plan. All that we could hear from them was that "There is no way a disaster can happen" and that "everything will be conducted according to the highest environmental standards"... whatever that means.

Some of the people, those who didn´t want to see a doomsday scenario such as the Gulf of Mexico disaster repeating itself in the Adriatic started to protest. In the beginning, it was very difficult, since an unofficial media ban was imposed while the protestors were publicly accused of being "exceedingly emotional" and repeatedly labelled as "progress haters". But they persisted, and many more joined in the struggle for a clean Adriatic sea. This battle, with all its ups and downs, continues to this very day.  

In the "Battle for the Adriatic", you will find a detailed story, get to know all the protagonists, learn where and how it started and follow the chronological development of events up until the most recent.

It is a book about the mighty Adriatic Sea, and how some people wished to endanger it for some small profits. This book is also about how sometimes politics becomes media, and the ways media can manipulate public information. Last but not least, it is about people who opposed these projects, and how what they do has shaped this ongoing struggle.

In the form of an eBook the "Battle for the Adriatic" will be released on the 1st of March 2016.

By funding this campaign,  you can support the plan to print and promote "Battle for Adriatic" in a paper version before summer 2016.

For this purpose, I started a website www,croatiancoast.org,

Read my last article about the issue:

http://croatiancoast.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=20:new-government&catid=18:nature&Itemid=101

Read my article about "drilling in the Adriatic sea" from autumn 2015:

http://www.total-croatia-news.com/business/953-...




What We Need & What You Get

  • With your help, this book will be printed and accompanied with some very nice photos of Adriatic and its shores. 
  • The plan is to come out with e-book version on the 1st of March 2016. Depending on funding sources, the paper version will follow.
  •  The battle for Adriatic sea is actual, so timing is essential. We want to spread the news as soon as possible. 
  • Depending on the perk you choose, you will receive the e-book version of "Battle for Adriatic" or the printed and signed one while our main sponsors get to enjoy some time on the coast of Adriatic sea. 
Where will funds go?

Editing: $1500

Book design $1500

Marketing, traveling, distribution and promotion costs (incl. IndieGogo fees): $7,000

Printing: $10,000 

Any extra money from this campaign and the later income from selling the book I intend to invest in a struggle to keep the Adriatic Sea clean. My final goal is to embed a ban on any Oil&Gas research and exploration inside the Croatian constitution. I won´t stop until that goal is reached. 


The Impact

The aim of this campaign is to gather funds so I can print "Battle for the Adriatic" in as much as possible copies.  Your contribution will help to do so, and also to promote the book in different places during the summer of 2016.

Risks & Challenges

There is a risk of exposing oil industries and government manipulations, but being kept silent is an even greatest risk and is not an option if we want to keep the Adriatic Sea clean. 

Even if I don't meet my campaign goals, I will continue in this effort until the book is ready and distributed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute,  that doesn't mean you can't help:

  •  Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Spread the word about defending the Adriatic Sea
