story:
We are looking raising £2.5 million to buy the island of Tanera Mor and to build a Culture Centre there which will provide courses on a range of skills, languages, arts and crafts which are in danger of being lost forever.

The types of courses we want to run would cover subjects like; 

  • Farming and Crofting techniques

  • Traditional boat building & other woodworking techniques

  • Metal working and smithing

  • Weaving and cloth making

  • Language & customs

  • Permaculture

Backers will receive a small plot of land and a few other perks including unlimited access to course materials, and one lucky backer will win a 99 year lease on one of the cottages on the island.

The island is currently for sale at an asking price of over £2 million. This includes 700 acres of land, 9 cottages and a Post Office. The Post Office is quite rare as it can issue it's own stamps, and regularly produces some beautifully designed commemorative stamp collections which are sold off and help provide an income to the island.  An archive of the stamp collections can be seen here http://www.summer-isles.com/stamp-archive.asp. 

Key objectives in brief

  • Purchase the Isle of TaneraMor

  • Restore the ruined buildings to provide additional accommodation 

  • Weatherproof the 'Herring Station' 

  • Continue the tree planting programme across the island

  • Modernise the islands energy supplies to be fully renewable and sustainable

  • Build an education infrastructure for traditional arts, crafts and techniques

In more detail...The nine cottages on the Isle are rented out during the holiday season (April-September) and can be used as a base for a relaxing holiday.

Courses are run on the island to teach people all manner of skills and crafts and we would like to expand the courses offered.


There are several ruins of cottages on the island which could be restored in the style of a traditional 'Crofters' cottage. The two room design consisting of a bedroom and a living space is not large but would allow the occupants to sample traditional accommodation first hand. A roof covered with turf in the traditional manner gives excellent insulation and protection against storms. These would make ideal accommodation for one or two people who are looking for a tranquil escape, or for them to take part in one of the courses run on the island .

The old 'Herring Station' would have a roof fitted to make it into a large covered area from which we could run a Boat Building Academy, like this one in Lyme Regis (http://www.boatbuildingacademy.com/). Teaching people how to build traditional wooden crafts is an important way to keep the traditions alive as well as teaching them valuable skills. We will run short and long-term courses with recognized qualifications at the end. 

We want to glaze part of the roof and use the space underneath as a greenhouse and grow non-hardy plants such as tomatoes and peppers. 

There are many other ideas we have to turn the island into a cultural education center and they will take time and money to implement them.

About me

My name is Paul Wyman and for many years I have had a passion to live in the Scottish Isles. When I saw Tanera Mor was for sale I spent a lot of time daydreaming about what I could do if I owned it, but short of winning the lottery there would be no way to realize my dreams. My other passion is gardening and vegetable growing and to become self sufficient by growing all my own food.  I have run the Gardeners Calendar website as a resource to help people learn to grow their own food. My only opportunity to realize these dreams would be to 'crowdfund' the money to buy Tanera Mor and then combine my passions.


What do you get out of this?

  • All backers will be entered into a draw to win a 99 year, rent free lease on a cottage

  • Your own plot of land

  • Your name on a postage stamp collection

  • Entry into the postage stamp design competition

  • Regular updates about Tanera Mor and the project as a whole

  • A financial breakdown of how the monies raised are being spent.

  • Unlimited access to an online educational materials including videos and lesson plans

All backers will be entered into a draw to win a rent free lease of 99 years on one of the cottages on the island. Full details to be released later.

For a donation of £25 you will get to own a small part of the island, and when I say small I mean 1 foot by 1 foot square. You will get a deed of ownership for the plot with its exact location as an Ordnance Survey grid ref.  There will be  no limit to the amount to the number of plots you buy, and you are free to sell your plot or to bequeath it to a relative. There will be instructions on the deed of how to change ownership. 

  • Owning the land will not allow you to build upon it, or to erect a boundary of any form preventing other people to traverse the land. This complies with the Land Reform (Scotland) Act 2003. 

  • Will I become a Lord/Laird or Lady by owning the land? No, to get a Scottish title you need to pay £75,000 to £100,000 and I believe there are only two available currently. See http://baronytitles.com for more information.

You will get your name published on a postage stamp collection. The Post Office on Tanera Mor is one of the few in the United Kingdom which is allowed to create their own official postage stamps. It would be a nice thank you to everyone who backs this project if they were immortalized  in the form of a postage stamp collection. The fine details need to be worked out such as the design etc. We will aim to get the name of each backer added in the collection and then sold to stamp collectors around the world.

For a few lucky contributors there will be the opportunity to design your own stamp and have it included in the collection. The competition will be designed and run once the island is purchased.

There is a plan to install a high definition camera overlooking the plots of land and it will be controlled via a webpage so you can see what the weather is like at anytime, and you can watch the 'aurora borealis' on clear nights.

What if we don't reach the full £2.5 million?

Whilst we would like to buy the Isle as a whole Tanera Mor is being sold off in three lots priced at £430,000, £700,000 and £820,000 so we can buy part of it if we don't reach the full figure.

Please help us reach our goal by forwarding the campaign link to as many people as possible. 

Thank you

You will get your name published on a postage stamp collection. The Post Office on Tanera Mor is one of the few in the United Kingdom which is allowed to create their own official postage stamps. It would be a nice thank you to everyone who backs this project if they were immortalized  in the form of a postage stamp collection. The fine details need to be worked out such as the design etc. We will aim to get the name of each backer added in the collection and then sold to stamp collectors around the world.For a few lucky contributors there will be the opportunity to design your own stamp and have it included in the collection. The competition will be designed and run once the island is purchased.There is a plan to install a high definition camera overlooking the plots of land and it will be controlled via a webpage so you can see what the weather is like at anytime, and you can watch the 'aurora borealis' on clear nights.What if we don't reach the full £2.5 million?Whilst we would like to buy the Isle as a whole Tanera Mor is being sold off in three lots priced at £430,000, £700,000 and £820,000 so we can buy part of it if we don't reach the full figure.Please help us reach our goal by forwarding the campaign link to as many people as possible. Thank you

story:
The Louisiana Environmental Action Network (LEAN), a 33 year old community-based nonprofit, is building the LEAN Community Archive and Empowerment Center to preserve and honor the unique history of Louisiana’s community evolution. Like Selma, Alabama, was to the Civil Rights movement, Louisiana is to the environmental Justice movement. It is time to honor our past, celebrate our progress and inform our future. Please support us in creating this powerful resource!

Did you know that over a dozen communities have been completely displaced by the industrialization of their environment in South Louisiana alone?

LEAN has been witness to these struggles for over 30 years and carries the memories and lessons of these communities and the heroes within them. Without a place to be preserved and honored, these histories, heroes and the lessons they learned will be lost. 

Did you know that many of these now erased communities began as Freedmen Settlements alongside the plantations where they were formerly enslaved? 

This history illustrates the progression of plantation to chemical plant and the journey of African Americans from slave to sharecropper to victim of environmental injustice and ultimately environmental refugee. At their heart, environmental challenges are often racial justice challenges. LEAN has worked to address this injustice for over three decades, and we have come a long way; but you wouldn't believe the stories we have to tell.

Did you know that the “environmental movement” in Louisiana has primarily been led by women?

It is true: mothers protecting their children and the wives of plant workers have been the driving force behind Louisiana’s environmental progress, not your typical environmentalist. LEAN was started by and is still driven by women; in many ways, the environmental movement is a women’s movement. 

Did you know that the term “Cancer Alley” was first coined by union workers, not environmentalists, during the longest lock-out in US history?

LEAN was instrumental in ending that lock-out by building broad support between environmental interests and worker health and safety concerns. Some of LEAN’s founding members were union workers and LEAN continues to innovate cross sector problem solving between nontraditional allies to resolve the unique environmental challenges in Louisiana.  

These are just a few of the topics held in LEAN and Louisiana's history. In the current climate of such extreme divisions, the issues that LEAN has explored for over thirty years are more relevant than ever. A publicly accessible center that illustrates issues of racial justice, female empowerment and finding solutions amongst traditionally opposing view points... we could not have planned a more relevant resource if we tried! 

For over 30 years the Louisiana Environmental Action Network (LEAN) has empowered underserved communities to address challenges they face that threaten their health, safety and quality of life. Much of this history goes untold and yet it speaks to the very heart of our society and democracy. And yes, many of these struggles have led to the complete displacement of communities. Many of the heroes have passed and their stories have gone untold. Meanwhile, we continue to repeat these conflicts at an increasing rate. It is up to us to honor these trailblazers and bring their hard-fought lessons into today’s conversation, where it is so desperately needed. 

The LEAN Community Archive and Empowerment Center will include a multi-media archive of environmental justice videos, photos and oral histories; a library and reading room; hall of heroes; as well as community exhibit and meeting space. All these resources will be available to the general public and create an unprecedented educational experience exploring critical facets of Louisiana’s history that have gone underrepresented for far too long.

But LEAN’s center is not just about the past. 

LEAN has spent years empowering communities as well as being a resource for researchers, journalists, artists, educators and students. LEAN expects to host all these groups and more in this groundbreaking center. As a community-based nonprofit, LEAN is creating this resource through the vision and guidance of the communities it has served. The finished space will continue to be a tool for these communities.  

 

HOW MUCH DO WE NEED?

We've got a history of doing a lot with a little!

LEAN needs $150k to make this dream a reality. This amount includes the physical creation of the space as well as the technology and multi-media work necessary to create an engaging and educational center. This work includes the creation of:

  • Environmental Justice Media Room, containing hundreds of hours of videos, thousands of pictures as well as oral histories
  • Library and Reading Room with hundreds of books, articles and maps profiling these unique community histories
  • Meeting and Exhibit space where community groups, students and the general public can meet to learn, connect, educate and empower
  • Hall of Heroes honoring the individuals who have been champions for their communities and changed the history of our state 
  • Digital Archive and Website that creates the multi-media backbone of the archive and makes it accessible online anywhere
  • Secure storage and digitization of all this important material!

 

WHAT DO YOU GET?

We appreciate your support and happy to show it!

Every dollar counts and we appreciate every donation, nothing is too small or too large. And remember, your donation may be tax deductible! Please consult your tax professional. 

  • For a donation of $75 or more you will receive a LEAN t-shirt in the color and size of your choice.
  • For $100 or more you will receive a copy of Jon Bowermasters award winning film: SoLa: Louisiana Water Stories!
  • For $250 or more you will receive a copy of Strangers in Their Own Land by Arlie Russell Hochschild! 
  • For $1000 or more you'll have your name included on our wall of community champions proudly displayed in the finished space. 

 

WHY?

This history and the lessons it illustrates are needed now more than ever!

LEAN empowers individuals, organizations, students, researchers, writers, journalists, artists, educators, etc. and they are starving for a resource like this! When LEAN started over 30 years ago, no one knew we would last this long. There is no other organization that has been a witness to this history and these heroes for so long. Our experience is unique and gives us the responsibility to create this resource so that all these heroes and histories live on. 

The triumphs and tragedies of Louisiana's Environmental Justice history are stories of conflicts and successes between Republican and Democrat, rich and poor, black and white. These stories illustrate the depths to which our society can fall and the opportunities that can be found in what feels like unresolvable conflict. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This is an expensive endeavor and we know not everyone has money to spare. We believe the creation of this resource is important, so even if you can not make a donation please let someone else know about our campaign. Post and share on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and go old school: tell someone about us in person!

Don't forget to use the share tools on this page!

story:
Like paper to create origami, we have created furniture with the folds of a single sheet of steel. We are joining the circular economy way of designing and producing, by creating strong sustainable pieces of furniture that can be manufactured locally. A tribute to the practicality of a simple, intelligent design. 

All of the MAGARU pieces are made of steel. A strong, sustainable material folded into the best simple shapes in order to avoid weak points. Designed to be adaptable, thanks to its delicate lines and minimal design. Each piece is available in 5 different colours.

 

 

 

Still is considered one of the most sustainable materials, is 100% recyclable and 75% of the steel produced in Spain is already recycled. 

 

 
 
 
(aquí falta el pdf actualizado)
 
 
 
 
We like to support independent manufacturers and save the planet of unnecessary shipping. Also our designs can be made from anywhere with the right facilities and it is more efficient financially, so everyone wins. This is why, as we grow, we will make sure we find other partners around the world, so we can support your local economy as well as ours.
 
 
 
 
 

We are a group of designers and makers that got chatting about the fact that we couldn't afford the pieces we were making for our clients. We love what we do and the way we do it, this is why we wanted to start a new brand that becomes a realistic alternative for people like us: Quality furniture that we don't need to replace, made with a sustainable material and affordable to most people. We have done this thanks to an efficient design and optimising resources that reduce the manufacturing costs.

 
 
 
All the MAGARU pieces are manufactured using laser cut and bending the steel. Back in our workshop we give the final touches, like softening sharp edges or removing any imperfections. This allows us to quality check each piece before sending it to paint.
 
 
 
We have used all the pieces in our offices and homes. We have tested them in extreme circunstances to make sure you can enjoy each MAGARU piece safely.
 
 
 
No adminten gifs y no consigo que aparezcan estos videos.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vTOdVdI-ijo
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uVUpgKWIXDc
 

 

No he intentado subirlo porque probablemente pase lo mismo
 
 

No joints, no weak points

Perfect for your garden, outdoor furniture

No assembly, ready to use 

Circular economy: Strong, recyclable material 

Easy to clean  

With pads to protect your floor

Simply beautiful design, inspired by Origami

 

 

We are a group of furniture designers and makers that fell in love with MAGARU  as soon as Jaime told us his idea. We decided to make it happen and continue following that path, using design to solve problems and always keeping our values on the way.

We are so fortunate that, even before everything started, we were surrounded by great people, that are also amazing professionals, artists and friends.

 
 

Our end goal is for MAGARU to be accessible to all homes, so that we can increase the quality and sustainability in an average household.

We are going to do this following our philosophy of “less is more”: It doesn't need expensive materials to be high quality,  it doesn't need to look rustic to be circular economy and it doesn’t need to be complex to be an elaborate design.

In order to do all this we need to manufacture our first collection and find people that like MAGARU. But that’s just the beginning. 

The revenue we achieve from your contribution will be re-invested in the following: 

  • We are going to find a workshop in Madrid for the Magaru team.
  • We will invest more time to create the second collection listening to your needs.
  • We are going to be more efficient everyday, so that it can be reflected in the price.

Also one of our challenges is to find manufacturing partners internationally, bringing the production to the countries where we receive more demand.  We made our designs simple so that it would be easier and better for the environment (and actually cheaper) to manufacture locally.

story:
Vanishing Woodland

The British Isles used to be extensively covered in woodland but due to human activity through the centuries, woodland has become alarmingly scarce. Most of what remains is sterile commercial plantation. Recent years have seen Cambridgeshire deforested until now it is the least wooded county in England. But now,

A small parcel of natural oak woodland has become available.

  • We aim to obtain the parcel of woodland to protect it from development forever under legal covenant.
  • The wood is made up of Mature Oaks and Ash and provides habitat for some rare and exciting woodland flowers like bluebells, primrose and wood anemone.
  • We will reach out to local schools and make the site available as a teaching resource.
  • In return for your contribution, you can claim a number of cool perks, from camping rights, naming a tree or even naming the whole wood!

The Impact

You will be part of our team of backers that is taking a parcel of English woodland out of the market forever. We will ensure, by legal means, that the site and its wildlife is protected from development for ever.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our appeal on social media - it would be a great help!

story:
Our organization was born with the mission to end lack of lighting and energy since 2010 throughout Peru, with clean energy (non-polluting) and taking advantage that we are located in the area so-called "solar strip of land" that’s why, we have been working, having several facilities under our experience. 

The members of the Nikosun® team, we are convinced a creative economy (also called orange), is of vital application to project a new economy, it started successfully countries like Uruguay and now Colombia, This brother state - with the benefit today has one of its main promoters - such as the President of the Republic, Mr. Iván Duque Márquez; In fact, a mix with a circular economy is important for locations such as those in the scope of the project, which is included when recycling (exchanging) the batteries are used for our equipment.

 

 

We know that our goal is ambitious, but against "big problems, bigger solutions" and we know that you can read us, and if your interest is living in a fairer world for all, you can contribute  
one bulb: $3.00, two bulbs:$6.00, three bulbs $9.00; with this project to be able to come true...the beneficiaries are the guardians of the amazon ... remember it!

If you agree to help, in fact we offer you the possibility of knowing part of the project area, the alternatives is to participate in these facilities or you can stay by the river and visit a reserved area with professional guides, appreciating the best of the Amazon in Peruvian territory.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

As we mentioned, more than 100,000 families in this region currently have lack of access to electricity, our plan is to cover only 1% of them, it's equivalent to say 1,000 families, this represents an investment of US $ 130,000; In case we can not reach this campaign goal, we will only illuminate as far as we can, in the case we can pass -even- this goal, we seriously think about projecting to illuminate the rural world: Andean, African, Caribbean islands and many communities that are currently suffering the impact and effects of climate change...you will remember being part of the nikosun team for this purpose you will be registered with us, with a pole, with a (personalized) team for your needs, in case you are a donor for several teams, in addition to your personalized team, you will have your name printed on a community plaque.

 

I will tell you some events today in Peruvian Amazons and Andes...
At dawn they should get up and take a quick snack to go in search of cereals they will have to grind for their food (often ours), observe their animals and milk some cow (when there is one), sow and harvest (when time allows, because of the effects of climate change, drought worsened), in times of rain, these are stronger than before causing flooding and overflowing rivers ... many of these jobs must be carried out by children who arrive home and do not have access to energy should light a candle or fuel lamp to see the faces a few minutes before going to sleep, who grow up without having the opportunity to read / to get educated etc .... This is one of the main reasons why night education still has not have much relevance in some cities of Peru ... they do not have access to energy and lighting.
We know of this reality to have done earlier facilities for our work, perhaps the most extensive was to install small vaccine conservatives, starting this decade ... until that time if some residents itched a poisonous insect and / or reptile, it would hardly be saved at not having a vaccine will save your life.

 

Risks & Challenges

We know of the obstacles that may arise, but the important thing is that we have a team of first level installers, the same can be increased if you decide to come to the amazon to meet this reality and support us with the projected installation for these 10,000 teams; or the number of facilities we can reach.

Expertise And Experience:

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Life taught us a lot and we understand even if you sympathize with this happening in Peru and you can not contribute at this precise moment but we are sure you can share this link with the social networks you use like Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn and you can help us  reach our goal ... with this you will also be part of our team to give light to the amazons.

I will tell you some events today in Peruvian Amazons and Andes...At dawn they should get up and take a quick snack to go in search of cereals they will have to grind for their food (often ours), observe their animals and milk some cow (when there is one), sow and harvest (when time allows, because of the effects of climate change, drought worsened), in times of rain, these are stronger than before causing flooding and overflowing rivers ... many of these jobs must be carried out by children who arrive home and do not have access to energy should light a candle or fuel lamp to see the faces a few minutes before going to sleep, who grow up without having the opportunity to read / to get educated etc .... This is one of the main reasons why night education still has not have much relevance in some cities of Peru ... they do not have access to energy and lighting.We know of this reality to have done earlier facilities for our work, perhaps the most extensive was to install small vaccine conservatives, starting this decade ... until that time if some residents itched a poisonous insect and / or reptile, it would hardly be saved at not having a vaccine will save your life.

 
Risks & Challenges

We know of the obstacles that may arise, but the important thing is that we have a team of first level installers, the same can be increased if you decide to come to the amazon to meet this reality and support us with the projected installation for these 10,000 teams; or the number of facilities we can reach.
Expertise And Experience:

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Life taught us a lot and we understand even if you sympathize with this happening in Peru and you can not contribute at this precise moment but we are sure you can share this link with the social networks you use like Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn and you can help us  reach our goal ... with this you will also be part of our team to give light to the amazons.Namaste- blessings to you- Dios contigo- بركاته لك- benedizioni per te- Segen für dich- siunauksia sinulle- Bénédictions a vous- bênçãos para você- благословения для вас- zegeningen voor jou- օրհնություններ ձեզ համար- благаслаўлення вам- blagoslov za vas- благословии за вас- ពរជ័យសម្រាប់អ្នក- benediccions per a tu- požehnání pro vás- 祝福你- 당신을위한 축복- velsignelser for dig- požehnanie pre vás- benoj por vi- õnnistused teile- zuretzat baikortasunak- beannachdan dhut- bendithion i chi- ευλογίες για σας- pōmaikaʻi nou- ברכות בשבילך- आपके लिए आशीर्वाद- áldás az Ön számára- beannachtaí ar do shon- blessanir fyrir þig- あなたのための祝福- сіз үшін игілік- ji bo we pîroz- beneficia ad vos- svētības jums- palaiminimas tau- Blessuren fir Iech- благослови за вас- berkat untuk anda- tberik għalik- та нарын төлөөх адислалууд- velsignelser for deg- برکت برای شما- błogosławieństwa dla ciebie- binecuvântări pentru tine- благослов за вас- välsignelser för dig- พรสำหรับคุณ- senin için nimet- благословення для вас- phước lành cho bạn- izibusiso kuweSPONSORS:

story:
The inception of Project Eco Earth can be traced back to when we were walking through one of the famous nature trails of Uttarakhand, India. We identified the problem of how those areas are not at all able to manage the plastic being generated by the tourists. Almost all the plastic waste is either disposed of in drains or is burnt away. We went on to other trails and found large heaps of plastics being dumped in every corner of the mountains.

 

The issues revolving around plastic waste have long been acknowledged. However, the efforts made to combat it have been minimal. While the rates of plastic consumption are rising alarmingly, developments in its waste management have not picked up. It is well known that once introduced into the environment, plastic is capable of staying in the system for over 500 years. Before degrading entirely, plastic disintegrates into tiny particles that have hazardous impacts. According to UN estimates India generates about 25,940  tons of plastic waste per day (TPD) if we talk particularly in the tourism circuits of Uttarakhand the number. Even when statistics state that India recycles 10% of its plastic, a major chunk of plastic waste in the oceans comes from India. Tourism is one of the fastest growing industries in our country. More tourists equal more waste, and more waste inevitably translates into a larger environmental footprint. This is not just a problem for the areas where establishing an efficient waste management system is challenging, like small islands or remote, sparsely populated areas. Even major tourist sites fail to pay heed to this alarming issue.

 

This plastic waste is capable of traveling hundreds of kilometers, getting lodged into the ecosystem, leeching out chemicals that affect every possible life form. Many studies have investigated the potential uptake of hydrophobic contaminants emerging from mismanaged plastic waste, which then get bioaccumulated in the food chain. Plastic is made using toxic additives like BPA, BPS, and Phthalates which can easily dissolve out into whatever material is kept inside it. Scientists have studied and illustrated how this can serious health defects like thyroid, mental breakdown, bad stomach, cell disruptions, DNA mutation and even higher stages of cancer. The harmful chemicals like PCBs, DDT, and PAH, which get absorbed in the plastic debris that floats in the sea water, have a varied and harmful range of chronic effects like endocrine disorders. The plastic that flows out in water bodies gets ingested by marine life forms exposing them to dangers of either poisoning or choking. Besides this, waste dump sites attract animals which feed on the easily available food waste and in the process, ingest the plastic interspersed with it.

 

A lot of single-use plastic is thrown in the tourism circuits and due to lack of resources and ideas on how to deal with it, therefore, it either ends up in the rivers, chokes nallahs, litter around the trails or just lies somewhere in the corner of the mountains. Project Eco Earth is an environment-friendly solution to tackle the plastic problem around the globe by introducing easy to handle portable and efficient machines to up-cycle plastic and develop products which can be used for a long duration. As previously stated, we are going to develop a set of four machines namely Shredder, Extrusion, Injector, and Compressor. The shredded plastic flakes go into the extrusion machine to create threads of plastic which directly can be used to make door handles, vases, baskets, etc. Similarly, the injector gives out the melted plastic directly inside small molds to make small products like wall tiles. The compressor is a device which comes in the picture when we need to create big products like chairs, buckets, sheets, bricks, etc.

The main Goals and Objectives of this project, therefore, are -

• Reduce Plastic in the urban and rural landfills, mainly starting with tourist hotspots

• Create sustainable material from the plastic waste collected

• Promote DIY machines to set micro entrepreneurs.

• Create employment

The Machines are uniquely designed by our team throughout the globe to fit in a small workspace in order to be easy to handle, maintain and deliver the most efficient outcomes, before starting with the machine handling it should be very clear of what type of plastic we are going to deal with and whether it is pre segregated or not so that we can keep the products categorically as every category of plastic melts at a different temperature and if not understood properly can cause serious damage to the machine as well as will degrade the quality of the outcome.

The Shredder is designed in such a way that it can shred even the hardest plastic with a motor of 3Hp and 70 RPM, it goes slow and steady and gives equal pressure at every blade to a perfect same sized flakes of plastic the pain is to get used to segregate plastic categorically and use only one at a time the idea is to keep all the categories segregated so that in future the products can again be recycled and keep up the vicious circle.

Now these flakes enters the Extrusion machine where these shredded plastic flakes takes a new shape all together the machine is basically a heating tube with a 1.5 Hp motor connected at 60-70 RPM .once the temperature reaches the melting point of a particular category of plastic ,the flakes of the same categories goes inside the machine and keeps throwing a thread of the same material which either can be rolled in a thread form, or cut continuously at an interval to get pallets of the category which can be used as a secondary virgin material and molded into other shapes and forms . This machine is also capable of creating rod-like the structure of various shapes and castes you want to and have a nozzle to decide what shape coming out of the tube and of course the dimension of it.

These pallets now can be used to put into the third machine i.e. Injection machine which is small similar heating tube machine as that of the Extrusion but doesn’t have a motor (its manual) and also is standing vertical, pointing downwards which once preheated to a certain temperature it intakes the pallets into its semi funnel fitted in the rod and goes straight into the tube, a mould is already fixed in the nozzle and is waiting to be injected, the melted plastic then pushed and pooped into the cast to take desired shapes. This machine can process only a limited quantity and that is the reason why we can only make small products out of this machine and for big products we use a compressor.

The Compressor creates products like baskets, tubs, vases, big tiles etc. The machine is a uniquely finished design which is fitted with an oven at the top of it with a small circular hole at the floor of the oven and a solid 5mm steel sheet at the ceiling inside, once a cast of product filled with flakes/ pallets enters into the oven chamber its is pushed from below wising a mechanical jack manually and given the shape provided the oven was preheated and was set to a temperature already.

All the machines are equipped with temperature controllers where heating takes place and speed regulator where the motor runs sometimes both using PID controllers and latest temperature regulators, in the shredder there exists a controller device which sometimes allows the motor to automatically reverse the shredding if stuck with a thick plastic piece.

NOTE:The Concept is based on www.preciousplastic.com designs

story:
Alternative Energy on The Crann Og Eco Farm.


Here at the Crann Og eco-farm we are committed to living in a sustainable way and providing a beautiful environment for people to get a taste of the Green way of life.

Part of that commitment is the use of solar and wind power to meet our energy needs.  We have vacuum tube solar panels that supply much of our guests' hot water needs and until recently a 1.5 kw wind turbine provided as much as half our electricity.

In the last twelve months the West of Ireland has been lashed by some incredibly ferocious storms and our windmill was seriously damaged.  Blades were shattered and the generating hub/turbine was destroyed.  When we came to do the assessment of what was needed we also discovered that the storage batteries, probably the biggest cost in the whole system, also need to be replaced  We are looking to repair the windmill and upgrade the battery storage. We need all the help we can get!

What We Need & What You Get.

To complete the proposed repair we need €6000:
  1. New upgraded batteries for storage - €3000
  2. Replace entire generator/turbine nacelle - €2500 
  3. Replace damaged Windmill Blades - €500
Perks for donors will include; deep heart felt gratitude, mentions on our website, blog and project articles, reduced rates for accommodation and workshops held at Crann Og Eco-Farm and invitations to be guests of honour at the end of project party and switching on ceremony.

The Impact.

Contributing to our project will mean much more than just repairing the wind turbine hardware.

One of our key goals here at Crann Og is to educate people about the benefits of sustainable energy production, to inform them of the practicalities of wind farming and work to reduce our dependence on centralised, fossil fuel based electricity supply.  Repair of the wind turbine will give us a real-life teaching tool on which to base weekend workshops as well as educational material for all visitors to our eco-friendly accommodation.

The use of solar and wind power also allows us to keep prices low for our accommodation and workshop hosting spaces; making our beautiful location as accessible as possible to as many people as possible.

In the process of reinstalling the turbine, batteries and associated hardware we will make use of local suppliers and tradespeople, we welcome visitors (and volunteers) at all stages of the project making this a truly community building project.

What else you could do...

If you are unable to contribute financially to the project then there are lots of other ways you could help.  First, you can help spread the word about our project and our need for assistance; maybe you know an environmental group that may have bigger resources that could help us, maybe you could just share our project as widely as you can, on all your social media profiles.  The more people who know the better!  Secondly, you might have practical skills around electrical installation and off-grid power solutions, if you do and fancy a trip to the beautiful West of Ireland contact us through our website and we can make arrangements for you to help out with the practical side.  Finally send us your positive wishes and support through our Facebook page and website.

story:
El nacimiento de una pasión documental

La tina producciones es un colectivo audiovisual nacido en la universidad de Medellín, entusiasmados por la conservación y el proceso tan gratificante de un producto audiovisual como es un documental. Nuestra idea proviene de viajes realizados al norte de nuestro país y dándonos cuenta de la belleza que posee, la labor de la conservación y la unión de culturas autóctonas con la fauna de la región. Pretendemos contar la historia del cumplimiento de un objetivo como es mostrar la conservación natural y dar nuestra pequeña ayuda mostrando la belleza y el trabajo ecológico por medio de un documental.
Es importante representar el mundo con ojos críticos y verdaderos ante el desconocimiento colectivo que tanto abunda, queremos que el documental a conseguir sea más que una pieza audiovisual; pretendemos que sea un inicio a una labor que deje huella porque el mundo se puede cambiar más que con fuerza, con belleza.


Idea 
Realizar un documental que concientice y contraponga la labor de Conservación Internacional con lo que ocurre en la Guajira y las tortugas marinas.
The idea

Make a documentary that raises awareness and opposes the work of International Conservation with what  happens in the Guajira and with the sea turtles.

Tema

Las tortugas marinas con la labor de la conservación internacional y la comunidad indígena.Las tortugas como un instrumento fundamental en la naturaleza. Las tortugas como fuerza narrativa,vital y marina.

Subject

The relationship between the in community, the international organization and the marine turtles.

Motivación

Una motivación es más un porque, podríamos decir que nos motiva salir de la nota y realizar un proyecto, pero es un proyecto ambicioso con el que queramos dejar atrás la estética visual televisiva que se ve en un mercado cercano e imponer con el tema y la narrativa, una estética seria que sea capaz de contar más de lo que un texto dice, tal como libro, contar sobre lo bello que es conservar, lo duro que es llevar a un animal a una vida mejor y el porque la especie humana es tan dura y compleja pero a la vez tan compresiva.


Motivation

Our motivation is produce a documentary beyond the note, we are conscious that this is a real ambition project but we are looking to do something different local market. We are tired of the quality of the products from the television and we are people who wants change the way to make a documentary, our instrument will be the serious beauty treatment, capable of counting more than a text says, like a book. To tell on how beautiful it is to preserve. How hard is take an animal to a better life and the reason why the human been is so hard and complex but simultaneously compressive.  

Sinopsis

En el punto geográfico más al norte del país, se dio y se sigue dando una evolución socio-cultural, el choque se dio entre Conservation International y la comunidad Wayúu , la motivación del primero fue lo que era la alimentación de los segundos, las sa’wai o tortugas marinas.

Debido a que las tortugas eran la fuente de alimentación de la comunidad indígena de este sector, se llegó al punto crítico de la existencia de esta especie animal, he ahí la aparición de Conservation International, la cual decide intervenir en el quinto país más biodiverso en el mundo, con la finalidad de salvar esta especie de tortugas.

Eclosión,mostrará, no como se dio ese proceso de evolución cultural, sino como es actualmente la situación en el territorio, a través de los ojos y perspectiva de la comunidad Wayúu, también desde la visión de Corporation International 

Synopsis:

In the geographical point more to the north of the country, it happened and sociocultural evolution keeps on giving, the shock happened between Conservation International and the community Wayúu,the motivation of the first one was what was the feeding, of the second ones, the sa'wai or marine turtles. 

Because the turtles were the power supply of the community indigenous to this sector, it went over to the critical point ofthe existence of this animal species, is there the appearance of ConservationInternational, which decides to intervene in the most bidiversity fifth country in the world, for the purpose of saving this turtles species. 

Eclosión, it will show, not how this process of cultural evolution happened, but as it is at present the situation in the territory, theeyes and perspective of the community Wayúu, also from the vision of Corporation

Conflicto 

Las tortugas son parte de una fauna y flora del lugar la cual se veía afectada por una comunidad indígena también propia del lugar, ¿ Es más importante conservar la fauna o las comunidades del lugar? ¿ qué labor se tiene por parte de conservación internacional? ¿El rol qué cumplen las tortugas en peligro dentro de esta comunidad?

The Problem

The turtles are an important part of a local fauna which was turning out to be affectedby an indigenous community also proper of the place:  the questions are: Is it more important to preserve the wildlife or the local communities?  The roll that the turtles fulfillin danger inside this community.

Dispositivo narrativo

Eclosión: paralelo entre el nacimiento de una tortuga y el nacer de una nueva comunidad.

Narrative Device:

Eclosión: Parallel between of  a turtle and the birth of a new community. 

Objetivos:

  • Mostrar la importancia del habitat de las tortugas marinas.
  • Resaltar el trabajo de la comunidad Wayúu para contribuir en la conservación de la especie.
  • Reconocer el trabajo de la comunidad y el progreso y cambio de vida que han tenido en relación con esto

Targets

•To announce the importance of the habitat of the marine turtles.

•To highlight the work of the Wayúu community on having contributed to the conservation of this species.

•To recognize the work of the community and the progress and changes have brought for its.


Eclosión como misión

Para la consecución de nuestra tarea necesitamos un presupuesto elevado pero obtenible que se repartirá de la siguiente manera:

Nuestras recompensas consisten en 

Presenta más detalles:

  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.
  • Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!
  • Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.

El punto de quiebre

Eclosión es valioso como documental, es una propuesta ambiciosa realizada por jóvenes que creen que las cosas pueden cambiar, aventurándose en un proyecto sin precedentes que esperamos nos permita dar el paso de una realización académica a una realización colectiva que sea importante, para nosotros, para ustedes y aún más importante, para la fauna que cada vez disminuye en un mundo como el nuestro.


El devenir

Los riegos son parte fundamental del proyecto, embarcarse en una aventura para conseguir un objetivo como este es difícil, pretendemos contar la realidad, sea cual sea, sin importar las consecuencias. Lo que sobra son ánimos y ganas de contar una historia, una historia sobre el mar, las tortugas que quiere contar mucho más que eso. 


Ayuda a un amigo tortuga

Comparte nuestras redes sociales y esta recaudación para ayudarnos a completar nuestro objetivo, te damos mil gracias y buena suerte.

Nuestra idea proviene de viajes realizados al norte de nuestro país y dándonos cuenta de la belleza que posee, la labor de la conservación y la unión de culturas autóctonas con la fauna de la región. Pretendemos contar la historia del cumplimiento de un objetivo como es mostrar la conservación natural y dar nuestra pequeña ayuda mostrando la belleza y el trabajo ecológico por medio de un documental.
Es importante representar el mundo con ojos críticos y verdaderos ante el desconocimiento colectivo que tanto abunda, queremos que el documental a conseguir sea más que una pieza audiovisual; pretendemos que sea un inicio a una labor que deje huella porque el mundo se puede cambiar más que con fuerza, con belleza.




Idea 
Realizar un documental que concientice y contraponga la labor de Conservación Internacional con lo que ocurre en la Guajira y las tortugas marinas.

The idea


Make a documentary that raises awareness and opposes the work of International Conservation with what  happens in the Guajira and with the sea turtles.

Tema

Las tortugas marinas con la labor de la conservación internacional y la comunidad indígena.Las tortugas como un instrumento fundamental en la naturaleza. Las tortugas como fuerza narrativa,vital y marina.
Subject
The relationship between the in community, the international organization and the marine turtles.
Motivación

Una motivación es más un porque, podríamos decir que nos motiva salir de la nota y realizar un proyecto, pero es un proyecto ambicioso con el que queramos dejar atrás la estética visual televisiva que se ve en un mercado cercano e imponer con el tema y la narrativa, una estética seria que sea capaz de contar más de lo que un texto dice, tal como libro, contar sobre lo bello que es conservar, lo duro que es llevar a un animal a una vida mejor y el porque la especie humana es tan dura y compleja pero a la vez tan compresiva.

Motivation
Our motivation is produce a documentary beyond the note, we are conscious that this is a real ambition project but we are looking to do something different local market. We are tired of the quality of the products from the television and we are people who wants change the way to make a documentary, our instrument will be the serious beauty treatment, capable of counting more than a text says, like a book. To tell on how beautiful it is to preserve. How hard is take an animal to a better life and the reason why the human been is so hard and complex but simultaneously compressive.  
Sinopsis
En el punto geográfico más al norte del país, se dio y se sigue dando una evolución socio-cultural, el choque se dio entre Conservation International y la comunidad Wayúu , la motivación del primero fue lo que era la alimentación de los segundos, las sa’wai o tortugas marinas.
Debido a que las tortugas eran la fuente de alimentación de la comunidad indígena de este sector, se llegó al punto crítico de la existencia de esta especie animal, he ahí la aparición de Conservation International, la cual decide intervenir en el quinto país más biodiverso en el mundo, con la finalidad de salvar esta especie de tortugas.


Eclosión,mostrará, no como se dio ese proceso de
evolución cultural, sino como es actualmente la situación en el territorio, a
través de los ojos y perspectiva de la comunidad Wayúu, también desde la visión
de Corporation International 
Synopsis:
In the geographical point more to the north of the country, it happened and sociocultural evolution keeps on giving, the shock happened between Conservation International and the community Wayúu,the motivation of the first one was what was the feeding, of the second ones, the sa'wai or marine turtles. 
Because the turtles were the power supply of the community indigenous to this sector, it went over to the critical point ofthe existence of this animal species, is there the appearance of ConservationInternational, which decides to intervene in the most bidiversity fifth country in the world, for the purpose of saving this turtles species. 
Eclosión, it will show, not how this process of cultural evolution happened, but as it is at present the situation in the territory, theeyes and perspective of the community Wayúu, also from the vision of Corporation
Conflicto 
Las tortugas son parte de una fauna y flora del lugar la cual se veía afectada por una comunidad indígena también propia del lugar, ¿ Es más importante conservar la fauna o las comunidades del lugar? ¿ qué labor se tiene por parte de conservación internacional? ¿El rol qué cumplen las tortugas en peligro dentro de esta comunidad?
The Problem
The turtles are an important part of a local fauna which was turning out to be affectedby an indigenous community also proper of the place:  the questions are: Is it more important to preserve the wildlife or the local communities?  The roll that the turtles fulfillin danger inside this community.
Dispositivo narrativo
Eclosión: paralelo entre el nacimiento de una tortuga y el nacer de una nueva comunidad.
Narrative Device:
Eclosión: Parallel between of  a turtle and the birth of a new community. 
Objetivos:


Mostrar la importancia del habitat de las tortugas marinas.
Resaltar el trabajo de la comunidad Wayúu para contribuir en la conservación de la especie.
Reconocer el trabajo de la comunidad y el progreso y cambio de vida que han tenido en relación con esto


Targets

•To announce the importance of the habitat of the marine turtles.

•To highlight the work of the Wayúu community on having contributed to the conservation of this species.
•To recognize the work of the community and the progress and changes have brought for its.

   Eclosión como misión
Para la consecución de nuestra tarea necesitamos un presupuesto elevado pero obtenible que se repartirá de la siguiente manera:



Nuestras recompensas consisten en  Presenta  más detalles:  explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.   Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!  Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.    El punto de quiebre
Eclosión es valioso como documental, es una propuesta ambiciosa realizada por jóvenes que creen que las cosas pueden cambiar, aventurándose en un proyecto sin precedentes que esperamos nos permita dar el paso de una realización académica a una realización colectiva que sea importante, para nosotros, para ustedes y aún más importante, para la fauna que cada vez disminuye en un mundo como el nuestro. 
    El devenir
Los riegos son parte fundamental del proyecto, embarcarse en una aventura para conseguir un objetivo como este es difícil, pretendemos contar la realidad, sea cual sea, sin importar las consecuencias. Lo que sobra son ánimos y ganas de contar una historia, una historia sobre el mar, las tortugas que quiere contar mucho más que eso.  
    Ayuda a un amigo tortuga Comparte nuestras redes sociales y esta recaudación para ayudarnos a completar nuestro objetivo, te damos mil gracias y buena suerte.

story:
The Sh*t Show Summary

We are a team of climbers and adventures and poop pun fanatics, passionate about protecting our favorite mountain destinations. In our combined years of being in wild places around the world, we have been stunned and disappointed by how poorly our poopoo is being managed in these sacred sites. 

Seeing these mountains of crap around our beloved peaks has made us ask what we can do about it (besides being personally equipped pooper scoopers). And the solution we came up with? Starting a non-profit dedicated to solving these waste management problems in the great outdoors: DO GOOD SHIT. 

We teamed up with Toilet Tech Solutions and their leading Poop Professor, Geoff Hill (the guy has a PhD in this crap). He filled us in on all of his toilet technology and his idea of where a good place to launch this project would be: Torres del Paine National Park, Chile. 

By supporting this project, you will be contributing to the installation of three tech toilets within the park. Help us make sure that this magical destination keeps its shit together, instead of having it strewn along its winding trails. 

The Need For Toilets & Paper 

Torres del Paine National Park receives over 250,000 visitors per year, with an annual increase in visitation of almost 10%. And all of those visitors, they don't just take pretty pictures and hike around. They POOP. A LOT. Which makes the need for toilet infrastructure an obvious and timely issue. 

The Torres del Paine Legacy Fund already has a chunk of this project funded. However, we currently still face a $10,000 funding gap. 

*The paper breakdown $$$ : 

Toilet stalls (with recycled plastic T&G lumber) : $6,300

Structural floors : $1,500

Decomposing vaults : $2,200

Total: $10,000

-Our goal is to get this project funded and the toilets installed as soon as the weather window opens in late November/early December 2019 (Southern Hemisphere guys). Our team will be traveling down to perform the installation in cooperation with Dr. Geoff Hill and volunteers. 

*Donations to this campaign will go to our partner non-profit, Lewis & Clark College, which consistently ranks as one of the nations top colleges in terms of environmental responsibility and sustainability by the Sierra Club and the Princeton Review. Lewis & Clark will spend 100% of the proceeds on the project costs described above.*

The Toilet Tech

We will be installing Toilet Tech Solutions' genius waste-diverting toilets. Basically, these backcountry poop units divert urine away from solid waste (we're the only mammals that actually do these businesses in the same place) so that it can be efficiently broken down by native soil invertebrates and bacteria. 

These toilets demand no pumping of smelly vaults, no nasty port-a-potties, no slinging barrels, none of that icky - just a simple annual maintenance of about 2 hours. 

TTS has already installed 160 toilets in 9 different countries/states at more than 1,000,000 toilet uses per year. These projects are already out there working. And we want to take it down to Torres.

See an explanation of the toilet technology here: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bxZ6LjDuKKw

Shit Risks 

We know that cleaning up this shit won't be easy. Luckily, the TTS/DGS/Legacy Fund is on top of it. Some foreseeable issues and solutions: 

*Site assessment and installation planning: these initial stages have been underway for nearly 3 years now. Obstacles including compliance and permitting, toilet use loads, waste disposal strategy, soil and site analysis have been examined and overcome. 

*Logistics: high mountain installations are labor intensive and weather dependent. That's why we are waiting for the weather to clear in Nov/Dec. There are a lot of variables here including shipping delays and toilet transport hiccups. However, the toilets have already been ordered for manufacture and we are prepared to be on the ground coordinating all of these logistics. 

*Proper implementation: site preparation, excavation, construction, unit installation. The founder of TTS himself, Geoff Hill, will be accompanying the DGS team down to make sure that this implementation process goes smoothly. He's installed toilets as high up as 10,000' at Mount Rainier's Camp Muir. He knows what he is doing and will be able to adequately train our team for endless installations to come. 

We've got our sh*t dialed - help us make this project a reality! 

Other Ways To Join The Turd Team 

If you can't contribute the campaign right now, that doesn't mean that you can't be a part of the turd team! 

-Shout the sh*t! Share this campaign, the video, the story, the message, DO GOOD SHIT! 

-Follow along on the poop path as DGS installs toilets for years to come.

-Become a Team Toilet Technician. Once the toilets are installed, they will need annual maintenance. We want to send you to these sites to help us keep things in motion.

campaign_city: Torres Del Paine National Park, Chile

story:
Nourish to Flourish

Flourish Foods started as a tiny idea way back in December 2017 - I'd come home from living in the US where buying in bulk from hoppers was fairly standard for dry foods, and I was trying really hard to reduce our waste even further.  We had an under-1 year old and already did as much as possible with reuseables and non-consumables, yet had this content battle with plastic food packaging.  

I asked on Facebook on 31st December 2017 "is there such a thing as a food weigh house anymore?"

I expected that as I live in a big, progressive, city, this would absolutely exist and amending our shopping habits slightly would be such an easy win for us ... the response was less than resounding.

 

23 weeks ago I began this journey with a baby, a full-time job and not enough free time to sleep never mind build a brand, but I started working on it anyway - and now, here we are at the final junction before opening and the response from people in Manchester has been overwhelming!

It's the final hurdle and I can't think of any better way to cross the finish line than alongside, and in collaboration with, all the wonderful people who have followed Flourish on this journey.

 

Plastic Activist and why so Drastic?

Plastic is a useful material, we can't deny it.  It's fairly cheap to mass produce, it's durable and it's accessible.  It is unlikely we will ever do away with all plastics, however, single use plastics, pitched as "disposable" are literally changing our planet, and not for the better.  Plastics have infiltrated rock formations (http://www.sciencemag.org/news/2014/06/rocks-ma...), appeared in the food chain (https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2017/f...) and of course the now all too familiar narrative of trash in our oceans.  

In March this year the devastating news came to Manchester, here, in our beautiful city, we're home to the Riverbed that has the largest number of plastic particles; at 517,000 plastic particles per square meter the River Tame was found to have double the number of micro plastics of any other previously recorded waterway, higher than the beaches off South Korea (https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/gr...).  Something in our city has to change.

The global statistics are frightening;

  • 15 million tonnes of plastic were produced in 1964, by 2014 this figure had risen to 311 million tonnes a figure set to double in the next 20 years.  Single use plastic packaging made up 26% of this figure - that's about 81 million tonnes in 2014; (https://newplasticseconomy.org/assets/doc/Ellen...);
  • Greenpeace estimate that 12.7 million tonnes of plastic end up in the ocean each year (https://www.greenpeace.org.uk/what-we-do/oceans...);
  • The UN "State of Plastics" report notes that 

    "The most common single-use plastics found in the environment are, in order of magnitude, cigarette butts, plastic drinking bottles, plastic bottle caps, food wrappers, plastic grocery bags, plastic lids, straws and stirrers, other types of plastic bags, and foam take-away containers. These are the waste products of a throwaway culture that treats plastic as a disposable material rather than a valuable resource to be harnessed"  (https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500...) and goes onto suggest that 50% of plastic WASTE generated in 2015 was packaging (https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500...).

It's really important we start to realise that there is no "thrown away" for plastics, and single use plastics are causing a global epidemic where in 2009 there was a measured 6 x more plastic in the North Pacific Subtropical Gyre than Plankton (https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/environm...).  

Plastics do not corrode, or breakdown, they only photodegrade, which means they break down into smaller and smaller pieces (which we now know as micro plastics) but never back to their base components in the same way that metal does for example.  Although a plastic bottle can be recycled, it can never be a plastic bottle again in the same way that a glass bottle can be a glass bottle again, as plastic degrades each time it is recycled.  Refuse first; reduce, reuse and recycle second.

We have an opportunity here in Manchester to show that, once again, we're a city of ideas, we're a city of change, we're a city of innovation, of community and we don't shy away from new ideas and new ways of doing things.  Lets do it for our city, for our waterways and for our world.

What We Need & What You Get

Up to now I have self-funded Flourish including up front rent, marketing, training programmes, website builds, samples and mailboxes.  I have used time off work, and reduced hours which have impacted my salary to get us to where we are now.  But, it isn't enough to get us open.

Our opening figure is low, £6,600.  If we reach our goal we will actually receive £6,270 as Indiegogo charges a 5% fee of monies raised.  

Of that £6,270 we will also be charged a 0.30p transaction fee every time a card is used to fund us PLUS 3% of the amount pledged on that card by Stripe (so for a £10.00 pledge we will receive £9.40, a £20 pledge we will receive £19.10, a £40.00 we will receive £38.50 and so on before loosing 5% to Indigogo).  We will also need to pay VAT on any funding pledges that carry a physical reward and we will have to pay a one time fee of £25.00 to have pledges transferred to us from Indiegogo.  After fees, and charges we should be left with circa. £6,000.

The campaign will pay for:

  • Till System 
  • Scales 
  • Mobile Handwash System 
  • Initial Orders 
  • Stock Storage 
  • Shop Fittings 

If we smash the target then we will buy in the following as levels allow:

  • Terracycle boxes - We will have basic Teracycle anyway but the mixed stream Terracycle boxes are quite expensive but we will buy them in for the launch if funding allows.  These boxes will allow you to bring your hard to recycle items from home and recycle them with us to raise money for local charities;
  • Nutrimilk Machine - This is the machine that will allow us to make nut and oat milks freshly while you wait.  It also makes nut butter in small quantities;
  • Nut Butter Machine - the large self-serve but butter grinders are very expensive and usually require importing so if we totally smash the target we will work towards getting one of these in at Flourish too.

The Perks

I know everyone has been dying to know what the perks are and we made a decision to keep things simple - we flirted with a complex campaign, with many levels of, and types of reward; but, every time we costed it , it came out the same - we'd need a lot more in the funding pot to buy the rewards, to give to you, to thank you for funding us, which meant charging you more for a bag, or a jar, or whatever - we thought you'd just prefer a useful perk that cost less - so we decided to give out something we can do for free, that benefits you, and will never be available again.  Because we also know that some of our non-food items are popular we will be running a pre-order system for them, which will be launched separately to the crowdfunding campaign.

£6+ - Donation Station

You can donate any amount to support Flourish without taking any reward, to show our love and devotion for you we'll make a splash about you and your contribution on our Extra Credit page on the website!

£12 - First Contact

10% off your first shop store wide and a huge shout out on our Extra Credit page on the site.

£25.00 - Refill Revolution

10% off your first 2 shops with us and loadsalove on our Extra Credit website

£40.00 - Nourish to Flourish

10% off store wide for 1 WHOLE MONTH (whooooop!) and all your helpful shenanighans included on our Extra Credit webpage.

 

£70.00 - Swinging 70s

15% off store wide for 1 month and a groovy entry on our Extra Credit webpage!

£115 - Flourish Fan

10% off store wide for 6 months and an epic mention on the Extra Credit page on the website.

£300 - Flourish Friends

10% discount store wide for 1 year and a glowing mention on our Extra Credit webpage (pinky swear!)

£400.00 - Flourish Family

15% discount store wide for 1 year and a massive family hug on the Extra Credit webpage

£1,000.00 - Flourish Founder

10% discount for life, your logo or name displayed in store, your logo on our main web page, right to use our logo for publicity, and of course, your name / logo / glowing recommendation as a philanthropist extraordinaire on our Extra Credit webpage!

The Impact of your Contribution

We're running a Fixed-Funding campaign; what that essentially means is that we either reach our goal and get funded, or, we don't.  We've chosen this approach to the campaign to protect you, our customers, as, if we don't reach the goal we can't feasibly open and stock Flourish anyway.  We're aiming for the smallest amount possible to get started, and anything less just wouldn't cut the mustard (seeds).  If we fail, then everyone who has pledged to get us open will be refunded in full.  It's riskier for us, but I feel more comfortable knowing that you are protected. 

You contribution will have a direct, and measurable, impact on plastic use within the Greater Manchester area.  We will be tracking and publishing the volume of plastic saved on our website in (almost) real time so not only will you be able to see what we have created and saved together as a whole, but what your specific purchases contribute to that figure whenever you shop.  

Annie Leonard, Executive Director of Greenpeace USA, claimed this month (June 2018) that,

"Recycling alone will never stem the flow of plastics into our oceans; we have to get to the source of the problem and slow down the production of all this plastic waste. Think about it: if your home was flooding because you had left the faucet on, your first step wouldn’t be to start mopping. You’d first cut the flooding off at its source – the faucet. In many ways, our plastics problem is no different"

Your contribution helps close that faucet here in Manchester, it turns off the tap.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge up until now has been appropriate space; space that would allow us to be authentic to ourselves, space that is reasonably priced and flexible to a start-up and space that would allow to build small and work from there (from tiny acorns).  We are so pleased to have been accepted into the Afflecks family and can't wait to get open now!

Our beautiful little unit is cosy, so, we can't stock everything we initially intended to and this will be a challenge as the reason supermarkets are so popular is because it allows busy people to do one shop, under one roof.  We are going to need to stack as much as we can, as high as we can but we're going to do everything we can to make it work in this space.   

A further risk at the moment is time, to open by 1st August we need to get everything moving as quickly as possible!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everyone isn't in a position to support us financially but can still be really passionate supporters of the Flourish vision! We love all of our Flourishers and there are loads of ways, other than funding, you can help the campaign succeed;

  • Like and Share the campaign on social media ... be friends with us on Facebook, join our Twitter flock and add to our Instagram Album! Share what we're offering all over with the #fundFlourish tag so we can see all your wonderful digital waves;
  • Make small changes yourself, where ever you can and share them with us on social media, we love seeing everyone's steps towards a plastic free world;
  • Refuse plastics when you're out and about wherever possible;
  • Join in the discussion on our Facebook page - we love hearing people's views;
  • Pledge to shop with us when we open! It's free to do and helps our campaign reach :)

And that's all there is to it.
