The UN "State of Plastics" report notes that "The most common single-use plastics found in the environment are, in order of magnitude, cigarette butts, plastic drinking bottles, plastic bottle caps, food wrappers, plastic grocery bags, plastic lids, straws and stirrers, other types of plastic bags, and foam take-away containers. These are the waste products of a throwaway culture that treats plastic as a disposable material rather than a valuable resource to be harnessed"  (https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500...) and goes onto suggest that 50% of plastic WASTE generated in 2015 was packaging (https://wedocs.unep.org/bitstream/handle/20.500...).



It's really important we start to realise that there is no "thrown away" for plastics, and single use plastics are causing a global epidemic where in 2009 there was a measured 6 x more plastic in the North Pacific Subtropical Gyre than Plankton (https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/environm...).  
Plastics do not corrode, or breakdown, they only photodegrade, which means they break down into smaller and smaller pieces (which we now know as micro plastics) but never back to their base components in the same way that metal does for example.  Although a plastic bottle can be recycled, it can never be a plastic bottle again in the same way that a glass bottle can be a glass bottle again, as plastic degrades each time it is recycled.  Refuse first; reduce, reuse and recycle second.

We have an opportunity here in Manchester to show that, once again, we're a city of ideas, we're a city of change, we're a city of innovation, of community and we don't shy away from new ideas and new ways of doing things.  Lets do it for our city, for our waterways and for our world.


What We Need & What You Get
Up to now I have self-funded Flourish including up front rent, marketing, training programmes, website builds, samples and mailboxes.  I have used time off work, and reduced hours which have impacted my salary to get us to where we are now.  But, it isn't enough to get us open.

Our opening figure is low, £6,600.  If we reach our goal we will actually receive £6,270 as Indiegogo charges a 5% fee of monies raised.  
Of that £6,270 we will also be charged a 0.30p transaction fee every time a card is used to fund us PLUS 3% of the amount pledged on that card by Stripe (so for a £10.00 pledge we will receive £9.40, a £20 pledge we will receive £19.10, a £40.00 we will receive £38.50 and so on before loosing 5% to Indigogo).  We will also need to pay VAT on any funding pledges that carry a physical reward and we will have to pay a one time fee of £25.00 to have pledges transferred to us from Indiegogo.  After fees, and charges we should be left with circa. £6,000.
The campaign will pay for:

Till System 
Scales 
Mobile Handwash System 
Initial Orders 
Stock Storage 
Shop Fittings 

If we smash the target then we will buy in the following as levels allow:

Terracycle boxes - We will have basic Teracycle anyway but the mixed stream Terracycle boxes are quite expensive but we will buy them in for the launch if funding allows.  These boxes will allow you to bring your hard to recycle items from home and recycle them with us to raise money for local charities;
Nutrimilk Machine - This is the machine that will allow us to make nut and oat milks freshly while you wait.  It also makes nut butter in small quantities;
Nut Butter Machine - the large self-serve but butter grinders are very expensive and usually require importing so if we totally smash the target we will work towards getting one of these in at Flourish too.

The Perks
I know everyone has been dying to know what the perks are and we made a decision to keep things simple - we flirted with a complex campaign, with many levels of, and types of reward; but, every time we costed it , it came out the same - we'd need a lot more in the funding pot to buy the rewards, to give to you, to thank you for funding us, which meant charging you more for a bag, or a jar, or whatever - we thought you'd just prefer a useful perk that cost less - so we decided to give out something we can do for free, that benefits you, and will never be available again.  Because we also know that some of our non-food items are popular we will be running a pre-order system for them, which will be launched separately to the crowdfunding campaign.
£6+ - Donation Station
You can donate any amount to support Flourish without taking any reward, to show our love and devotion for you we'll make a splash about you and your contribution on our Extra Credit page on the website!

£12 - First Contact
10% off your first shop store wide and a huge shout out on our Extra Credit page on the site.

£25.00 - Refill Revolution
10% off your first 2 shops with us and loadsalove on our Extra Credit website

£40.00 - Nourish to Flourish
10% off store wide for 1 WHOLE MONTH (whooooop!) and all your helpful shenanighans included on our Extra Credit webpage.
 
£70.00 - Swinging 70s
15% off store wide for 1 month and a groovy entry on our Extra Credit webpage!

£115 - Flourish Fan
10% off store wide for 6 months and an epic mention on the Extra Credit page on the website.

£300 - Flourish Friends
10% discount store wide for 1 year and a glowing mention on our Extra Credit webpage (pinky swear!)

£400.00 - Flourish Family
15% discount store wide for 1 year and a massive family hug on the Extra Credit webpage

£1,000.00 - Flourish Founder
10% discount for life, your logo or name displayed in store, your logo on our main web page, right to use our logo for publicity, and of course, your name / logo / glowing recommendation as a philanthropist extraordinaire on our Extra Credit webpage!

The Impact of your Contribution
We're running a Fixed-Funding campaign; what that essentially means is that we either reach our goal and get funded, or, we don't.  We've chosen this approach to the campaign to protect you, our customers, as, if we don't reach the goal we can't feasibly open and stock Flourish anyway.  We're aiming for the smallest amount possible to get started, and anything less just wouldn't cut the mustard (seeds).  If we fail, then everyone who has pledged to get us open will be refunded in full.  It's riskier for us, but I feel more comfortable knowing that you are protected. 
You contribution will have a direct, and measurable, impact on plastic use within the Greater Manchester area.  We will be tracking and publishing the volume of plastic saved on our website in (almost) real time so not only will you be able to see what we have created and saved together as a whole, but what your specific purchases contribute to that figure whenever you shop.  
Annie Leonard, Executive Director of Greenpeace USA, claimed this month (June 2018) that,
"Recycling alone will never stem the flow of plastics into our oceans; we have to get to the source of the problem and slow down the production of all this plastic waste. Think about it: if your home was flooding because you had left the faucet on, your first step wouldn’t be to start mopping. You’d first cut the flooding off at its source – the faucet. In many ways, our plastics problem is no different"
Your contribution helps close that faucet here in Manchester, it turns off the tap.

Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge up until now has been appropriate space; space that would allow us to be authentic to ourselves, space that is reasonably priced and flexible to a start-up and space that would allow to build small and work from there (from tiny acorns).  We are so pleased to have been accepted into the Afflecks family and can't wait to get open now!
Our beautiful little unit is cosy, so, we can't stock everything we initially intended to and this will be a challenge as the reason supermarkets are so popular is because it allows busy people to do one shop, under one roof.  We are going to need to stack as much as we can, as high as we can but we're going to do everything we can to make it work in this space.   
A further risk at the moment is time, to open by 1st August we need to get everything moving as quickly as possible!

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that everyone isn't in a position to support us financially but can still be really passionate supporters of the Flourish vision! We love all of our Flourishers and there are loads of ways, other than funding, you can help the campaign succeed;

Like and Share the campaign on social media ... be friends with us on Facebook, join our Twitter flock and add to our Instagram Album! Share what we're offering all over with the #fundFlourish tag so we can see all your wonderful digital waves;
Make small changes yourself, where ever you can and share them with us on social media, we love seeing everyone's steps towards a plastic free world;
Refuse plastics when you're out and about wherever possible;
Join in the discussion on our Facebook page - we love hearing people's views;
Pledge to shop with us when we open! It's free to do and helps our campaign reach :)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
تنويه: تفاصيل المشروع باللغة العربية بعد الانجليزية

Hello All

We Ahmed Alaa, Mahmoud Habashy, Mohamed Hossany, and Ola Adel, are senior students at Zewail City of Science and Technology, Egypt's National Project for Scientific Renaissance. We are majoring in Environmental Engineering.

We had won the Hult Prize National Round here in Egypt and we are going to attend a 6-week accelerator, representing Egypt as a Finalist of Hult Prize Awards Program. We will be the first Egyptian team who has this opportunity to attend the annual accelerator held by Hult Prize. We will have a chance to work on our innovative ideas tackling the challenge of Harnessing the Power of Renewable Energy. After the accelerator, the best 6 teams will have a chance to present at the Global Finals of the program, present their solutions at the UN. The accelerator will be held at Ashridge, United Kingdom from July 22nd till September 1st, 2018.

90 million kilograms of animal waste/manure are produced every day in Egypt and large numbers of deaths occur due to the improper management of animal waste. The primary source of animal waste results from farmers who own livestock, so we believe that our project will greatly impact the farmer’s life and the energy sector, by turning the slurry, a liquid-like material that produces from a biogas unit and farmers find a difficulty in dealing with, into a cheaper and healthier fertilizer for plants.

Attending the accelerator will help us to better implement our idea and back to Egypt with enough knowledge and skills to change the community into a better way, hoping to save the poor farmers and their families’ lives, who suffer from diseases that could be due to the pathogens present in the waste. So, we think our journey won’t complete without your kind contributions and help.

Hult International Business School will be responsible for our accommodation and food during our visit there. But, we have to cover our visa and flight tickets, so we are raising funds to secure them. We were successfully able to collect $1200 so far, and $3300 is left. As we need $4500 in total for the whole team.

Your shares, donations and help will really paint the world around us. So, with your support, we will be able to continue our dream. At the end, thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened.  Happiness never decreases by being shared.

Attached below are our invitations letters.

The Hult Prize was established in 2010 by Bertil Hult and is an annual, year-long competition that crowd-sources ideas from MBA and college students after challenging them to solve a pressing social issue around topics such as food security, water access, energy, and education.

To know more about Hult Prize, you can visit: http://www.hultprize.org/

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

احنا اربع طلبة بندرس هندسة بيئية في سنة خامسة في جامعة زويل للعلوم و التكنولوجيا، مشروع مصر القومي للنهضة العلمية.  احنا أحمد علاء، محمود حبشي، محمد حسيني، علا عادل , اعضاء الفريق اللي اشتركنا في مسابقة HULT Prize 2017 اللي مدرسة هالت العالمية للأعمال  بتنظمها كل سنة.

 الHULT Prize هي مسابقة سنوية بتشجع الشباب و الطلبة انهم يوفروا حلول لمشاكل تابعة لل17 هدف من اهداف التنمية المستدامة للأمم المتحدة  زي تأمين الغذاء و المياه للجميع. السنة دي HULT Prize طرحت مشكلة الطاقة و سألت الشباب انهم يتقدموا بحلول ليها تأثير ايجابي لتوفير الطاقة و حلول ليها فرصة انها تأثر على حياة عشرة مليون شخص.

احنا كسبنا المرحلة الاولى و طلعنا الاول على مستوى الجمهورية و اتأهلنا للمرحلة التانية اللي هي مسابقة دولية هيشارك فيها 44 فريق من حول العالم.
الخطوة اللي جاية هي التدريب اللي هيقام في اشريدج في المملكة المتحدة بداية من يوليو 22 الى سبتمبر 1.
التدريب هيساعدنا اننا نقدر نطور و نطبق فكرتنا اللي هتساعد في تحسين المجتمع. احنا اخدنا مادة بتطلع من وحدات الغاز الحيوي و حولناها لسماد رخيص و صحي و مفيد للفلاح و النباتات. تقريبا 90 مليون كيلو من فضلات الحيوانات بتُصدر في مصر يوميا و مفيش معاملة صحية ليها. احنا تدخلنا في السلسلة دي و قدرنا  نساهم في عدم انتشار الامراض و الموت بسبب فضلات الحيوانات. من ناحية الطاقة، فا قطاع الأسمدة الكيماوية يصنّف التاني بعد قطاع الكهرباء كا اكتر قطاع بيستهلك غاز طبيعي.  على العكس, فكرتنا بتوفر سماد عضوي مبيستهلكش اي عاز طبيعي نهائي.

في اخر التدريب ال٤٤ فريق هيتصفوا لاخر ٦ فرق و دول هما اللي هيسافروا نيو يورك يوم 15/9 عشان يشاركوا في الGlobal Finals . و دي  هي المسابقة الاخيرة اللي الأمم المتحدة منظماها.

مدرسة هالت العالمية للأعمال (HULT International Business School) هتدعمنا بتكاليف الإقامة و الاكل خلال فترة الزيارة لكن حجز تذاكر الطيران وإجراءات الفيزا علينا. و عشان كدا احنا بنجمع تبرعات عشان نقدر نسدد سعرالتذكرة والفيزا بحيث ان مجموع اللي هندفعه 4500 دولار قدرنا اننا نوفر منهم 1200 دولار بس لسه فاضلنا 3300 دولار علشان نقدر نكمل بحثنا.

من غيركم رحلتنا مش هتكمل. محتاجين مساعدتكم عشان نقدر نكمل حلمنا. دي هتكون اول سنة مصر تشارك في المسابقة دي. لو رحنا هنقدر نطرح فكرتنا قدام عقول كتيرة مميزة هتساعدنا اننا نطبق فكرتنا على ارض الواقع. احنا عايزين نروح عشان نوري للعالم كله ان مصر تستطيع.

للمزيد من المعلومات، يرجى زيارة الموقع الرسميhttp://www.hultprize.org/

story:
INTRODUCTION:

We are the team of permaculture Forest Garden, Environmental Education Center Gberefu, Badagry Lagos State. We promote environmental education through courses, seminars, action learning workshops, consultations and counselling.

AIM:

To promote Environmental Education and Environmental protection in Nigeria using Permaculture ethics and principles.

OBJECTIVES:

To organize permaculture seminars, courses, action learning workshops, conferences, consultations and exchange programs for people and development organizations.

To organize counselling for farmers.

To arrange training for children and vocational training institution for youths and women.

OUR STRENGHT:

We already have 5years experience working on the project, so we have a better knowledge of the environment, resources, strength, weakness, opportunities and threats.

1: the unique features of the land with its slanty form descending towards the swamp and Badagry lagoon displaying an edge effect.

2: we already have trees and shrubs grown over the last 5 years.

3: We have passionate volunteers working to ensure the success of the project.

4: The project is situated on Gberefu peninsular popularly known as “Point of no return”, a tourist attraction site.

5: The land in which the project is situated is in between the sea and the Lagoon.

WEAKNESSES:

1: Our structures are dilapidated.

2: We do not have security.

3: The project is not yet sustainable.

OPPORTUNITIES:

1: We may get support from tourist visiting the peninsular.

2: We may get contract from the State Government or Federal Government of Nigeria. if we get the project right as a model for sustainability.

3: we will live in abundance as a community if we get it right.

THREATS:

If we don’t get the proper and timely support, other investors have come threatening to dominate the peninsular. If they succeed the natural greens will give way to the so called “developments” and the peninsular will become vulnerable.

If we get proper and timely support:

1:- The project will bring people close to nature, to value and appreciate nature and so people will learn to better protect their environment.

2:- Deforestation will reduce and tree planting will increase.

3:- People will learn organic farming systems.

4:- People will learn to adapt renewable resources and services.

5:- Poverty rates will reduce as people start applying permaculture ethics and principles.

6:- Violence will reduce as people learn to live in harmony with nature through permaculture ethics and conflict resolution programs.

7:- Domestic flora and fauna will start to immigrate to contribute to our ecosystem structure and significantly improve the micro climate conditions.

 

PROJECT PLAN AND TIMELINE

From 15th March 2018, construction and rehabilitation will begin. By 30th March, construction will be fully completed.

  • Our volunteers will start arriving in the beginning of April.
  • We shall again kick start our weekend seminars/workshops and film shows (ecological).
  • In May/June, planting, water gardening and water management.
  • June-July: Water catchment, purification and storage.
  • August-September: liquid organic fertilizers and tree planting programs, gardening.
  • October-November: Seminars on conflict resolution, peace initiatives, community building.
  • December-January: Evaluation and Celebrations.
  • February-March: We shall study patterns, application of patterns then we shall round up with innovative skill acquisition programs.

 

PARTNERS:

Global Eco-village Network (GEN), Permaculture Association UK, Fecra Culture Centre Egypt, Catong Eco-village Gambia, Service Civil International(SCI), Voluntary Work camp Association of Nigeria., Ghana Permaculture Institute, Better World Cameroon and Amenawon Solar School Ikeja Lagos State.

 

BUDGET;

Renovation of the Multifunctional house.

Roof: roofing sheets and woods                                                               N150,000

Ceiling: ceiling materials and tyrods                                                       N50,000

Painting: buckets of oil paints                                                                   N10,000

Total:                                    (N210,000)

 

Farm house: red bricks at N150 (EACH)

2000 bricks                                                                                                       N300,000

Roofing and ceiling                                                                                          N150,000

Cement                                                                                                                N17,500

Total                                      (N.467,500)

 

Sleeping hut

2000 red bricks                                                                                  N300,000

Roofing plus ceiling                                                                           N150,000

Bags of cement                                                                                   N17,500

Total                                      (N467,500)

Seminar Hut:

30000 red bricks                                                                                N450,000

Roofing plus Ceiling                                                                            N200,000

Bags of cements                                                                                  N35,000

Total                                      (N685,000)

 

Fencing:

200 galvanized pipes at N5000 each                                                       N500,000

Bags of cements                                                                                              N175,000

Galvanized wire                                                                                                N500,000

Total                                      (N1,175,000)

 

Energy:

2 Solar panel 1000watt each                                                        N900,000

Inverter                                                                                                N150,000

2 Solar Batteries                                                                               N120,000

2 charge controllers                                                                        N20,000

Installation Price                                                                               N150,000

Solar bulbs                                                                                          N20,000

Total                                      (N1,380,000)

 

Water:

Three 200watt panel                                                                      N240,000

Submersible Solar water pump                                                  N300,000

Total                                      (N540,000)

 

Administration and Management:

Internet access

  1. 2 Android phones                                                                                   N50,000
  2. 2 Laptops                                                                                                  N160,000
  3. 2 modems                                                                                                 N20,000

Recharging of modems for 12 months                                                     N60,000

Phone Airtime recharge                                                                                N18,000

Total                                      N308,000

4 permanent staffs salary for 12 months at N50,000 each

=N200,000.

N200,000×12

Total                           2,400,000.

 

MOBILITY:

story_txt:
INTRODUCTION:We are the team of permaculture Forest Garden, Environmental Education Center Gberefu, Badagry Lagos State. We promote environmental education through courses, seminars, action learning workshops, consultations and counselling.AIM: To promote Environmental Education and Environmental protection in Nigeria using Permaculture ethics and principles.OBJECTIVES:To organize permaculture seminars, courses, action learning workshops, conferences, consultations and exchange programs for people and development organizations.To organize counselling for farmers.To arrange training for children and vocational training institution for youths and women.OUR STRENGHT:We already have 5years experience working on the project, so we have a better knowledge of the environment, resources, strength, weakness, opportunities and threats.1: the unique features of the land with its slanty form descending towards the swamp and Badagry lagoon displaying an edge effect.2: we already have trees and shrubs grown over the last 5 years.3: We have passionate volunteers working to ensure the success of the project.4: The project is situated on Gberefu peninsular popularly known as “Point of no return”, a tourist attraction site.5: The land in which the project is situated is in between the sea and the Lagoon.WEAKNESSES:1: Our structures are dilapidated.2: We do not have security.3: The project is not yet sustainable.OPPORTUNITIES:1: We may get support from tourist visiting the peninsular.2: We may get contract from the State Government or Federal Government of Nigeria. if we get the project right as a model for sustainability.3: we will live in abundance as a community if we get it right.THREATS:If we don’t get the proper and timely support, other investors have come threatening to dominate the peninsular. If they succeed the natural greens will give way to the so called “developments” and the peninsular will become vulnerable.If we get proper and timely support:1:- The project will bring people close to nature, to value and appreciate nature and so people will learn to better protect their environment.2:- Deforestation will reduce and tree planting will increase.3:- People will learn organic farming systems.4:- People will learn to adapt renewable resources and services.5:- Poverty rates will reduce as people start applying permaculture ethics and principles.6:- Violence will reduce as people learn to live in harmony with nature through permaculture ethics and conflict resolution programs.7:- Domestic flora and fauna will start to immigrate to contribute to our ecosystem structure and significantly improve the micro climate conditions. PROJECT PLAN AND TIMELINEFrom 15th March 2018, construction and rehabilitation will begin. By 30th March, construction will be fully completed.
Our volunteers will start arriving in the beginning of April.

We shall again kick start our weekend seminars/workshops and film shows (ecological).
In May/June, planting, water gardening and water management.

June-July: Water catchment, purification and storage.

August-September: liquid organic fertilizers and tree planting programs, gardening.

October-November: Seminars on conflict resolution, peace initiatives, community building.

December-January: Evaluation and Celebrations.

February-March: We shall study patterns, application of patterns then we shall round up with innovative skill acquisition programs.
 PARTNERS:Global Eco-village Network (GEN), Permaculture Association UK, Fecra Culture Centre Egypt, Catong Eco-village Gambia, Service Civil International(SCI), Voluntary Work camp Association of Nigeria., Ghana Permaculture Institute, Better World Cameroon and Amenawon Solar School Ikeja Lagos State. BUDGET;Renovation of the Multifunctional house.Roof: roofing sheets and story:
Story

Here is a bit about me (Mat) and a bit more about The project:

  •  My name is Mat, I'm French with IT engineer background. I have been a traveller and divemaster for about 10 years now. I use to manage a dive center in Borneo (Malaysia) and work in close collaboration with a conservation camp next door (TRACC), where I learned a lot about corals and marine life. After Borneo, I discovered Palawan and I have been living in El Nido for 4 years already. After enjoying nature's gifts and treasures for so many years, it is time for me to give back and start doing something bigger than me. 
  • I recently went on a road trip toward the northern tip of Palawan and east coast of the island and discovered a completely untouched area. "Sibaltan" is pristine and quiet. So close from the famous and crowed El Nido, yet completely unspoiled by tourism. And as I drove to a beach that I saw from the road, I met someone offering to show me an available land. Two busy days later we signed a contract and I now have a fantastic empty canvas to build a conservation project in Paradise: SYMBIOSIS.

 

Context and Location

  • Palawan has been elected most beautiful island in the world three years in a row.
  • The famous Bacuit bay (El Nido) drives more and more tourists every year into the Northern Province.
  • However, there is still so much to discover and explore… and so much to protect and restore.
  • Sibaltan is on the East coast of Palawan directly opposite side from El Nido (less than one hour drive on concrete road) and offers the most amazing sunrises, diving, island hopping, treks...
  • So close to the booming city of El Nido, yet absolutely untouched and unspoiled.
  • It has many islands to explore, a much richer marine life (Dugong, turtles, sharks, whales…etc) and yet very few tourists ever wonder there.
  • Nature is still predominant and the area radiates with a feeling of quietness.
  • As El Nido is getting overcrowded, Tourism will only grow bigger in Sibaltan, and its essential to start protecting this pristine area as soon as possible.

 

List Environmental Issues of the Area

  • Local fishermen still practice bomb fishing in some areas with disastrous impact on the magnificent reefs and the marine life.
  • Anchoring from island hopping also destroys coral on wide areas.
  • Cyanide fishing has been observed and must be stopped.
  • Turtle egg poaching is common
  • Sharks are being sold on the market, babies mostly (hammerhead and black tips).
  • Turtles are being caught and smuggled to Vietnam and China
  • Sea cows (Dugong) are getting fewer as human activity disturb their habits.
  • Horseshoe Crabs are being hunted for pharmaceutical purpose and rapidly declining.
  • Plastic wastes are everywhere and need collecting and recycling.

 

What we CAN do:

  • Restore the bombed reef
  • Push towards a more responsible fishing
  • Educate locals and kids to the value of an healthy dive site
  • Protect and nurse turtle eggs
  • Protect Horseshoe crabs and coconut crabs
  • Collect and recycle plastics
  • Setup mooring boy for island hopping and diving boats
  • Educate locals and lead campaigns about waste management and re-use policy
  • Collect data for the scientists to measure the health of the sea and its evolution.
  • Learn from the local how to live in an always better symbiosis with nature and the use of its amazing gifts.
  • Limit our own impact on the environment

 

 

I need YOU:

  • Setting up our camp requires funds.
  • You might have the knowledge we lack in specific fields like farming, permaculure, eco-construction, carpentry,...etc And we want you to experiment and share!
  • We have secured the land on the beach already but now we need to build the eco-village that will welcome our volunteers from all over the world.
  • We need machines that can turn plastic into bricks.
  • We need material for our first volunteers (already coming next month!) to start building bungalows, kitchen, power house....etc
  • We need solar panels to power our village with clean energy (no electricity yet in the area).
  • We need a boat, compressor and diving equipment to send our eco-divers collect and transplant broken corals!
  •  Every donation counts! Smaller donation will be rewarded by freebees while bigger contributors will get free Eco-diving holidays at Symbiosis.
  •  Whether we reach our financial objective or not, we will push through and build this eco-community step by step. Eco-brick by eco-brick!

 

Impact

Saving and protecting our planet is saving ourselves!

Our oceans are dying and it’s more than time to react and initiate the change!

Help us!

And if you can’t donate, come spend your holiday with us and share our project to all your friends.

 

 

Risks and Challenges

The main risks for us are from local poachers and dynamite fishermen who are destroying the environment for easy profit and see us as a threat to their dirty business.

Environmental activists are often bullied and even killed. It has been happening in Central America for years. And now it starts here in Asia as, not later than a month ago, an officer from the local government got shot and killed by illegal wood traders when he was trying to confront them.

Only education and money can beat these practices.

story:
I'm an archaeologist and cultural scientist from Poland. At present I live in Berlin, Germany, where I work for one of the archaeological companies and plan to start Geoinformation and Environmental Earth Science course this year.

I took part in a number of archeological projects in Germany, Poland, Russia, Lebanon Colorado, US and I would like to start my own research in Alaska between 20th of July and 15th of August.

 

My plan, primarily, is to gather information regarding early settlement in America. The tribes that migrated from Asia and resettled in the New World more than twelve thousand years ago.

I also got a chance to participate in Walakpa Archaeological Salvage thanks to an archaeologist Anne Jansen.

 

The second part of my project is dedicated to people currently living in Alaska. I’m going to make a photo journal and conduct a survey regarding their everyday life in the extreme environmental conditions and present their opinion on climate changes as well as their plans for future.

 

What I need to complete this mission? The most expensive is the ticket, this is approximately 1,400€. The total cost of the expedition including all the equipment is estimated at 3,000 €.

I intend to spend around 700€ on printing photographs, educational materials and organization of exhibitions in Berlin and Warsaw in October- November 2017.

 

My project takes place in Barrow, North Alaska, however, the majority of the time I am going to stay 20 km Southwest of Barrow in Walakpa , this is where the Archaeological Salvage Project takes place. The conditions at the archeological site are very rough and we have to stay in tents in the extreme weather conditions.

 

In my free time I’m going to conduct my own research, collecting samples and evidence of early settlement in the area and changes that happened during thousands of years. Additionally, I would like to interview local people and ask them how they experience global warming and what are their views for future. Do we really have to be afraid of it? 

 

As I will need to stay for a couple of weeks in a tent I need to buy special thermo active clothing to avoid hypothermic shock. Furthermore, because of the lack of electricity and Internet at the excavation site I now need to plan my research step by step and try to be prepare for every possibility.

 

You could help in many ways; I just need to know that my project is important not only for me but also for others. Just keep finger crossed for me!

https://iceandtime.net

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

EVA (Electric Visionary Aircrafts) is developing the first world electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft. We designed this aircraft to open a third dimension in cities and remove traffic stress and CO2 from our lives.

Recently we realized by talking to firefighters that our technology could save many people trapped in wildfires. For decades the number of lives taken by wildfires has not decreased, every year thousands of people die trapped in their homes, on the roads or trapped because they wanted to rescue and protect other people.

We cannot get used to that!

This is why we have decided to launch a special project to operate our technology where it will save lives. This week more than 40 people died in California, what if we could have sent several aircraft to rescue them. 

By contributing to this campaign you will help to rescue people, you will no more look at news on TV commenting wildfires and counting victims, you will be part of the fight to rescue people! 

We need 500,000 to provide 2 test aircraft to organizations such as Calfire in California or Securite Civile in France. 

Our strategy is simple:

1. Identify

2. Protect

3. Rescue

We first locate people trapped or confirm their presence with our Valkyr. A unique unmanned Vertical Take Off and Landing (VTOL) aircraft which can be carried on firefighters trucks or leave from a firefighters base. We send X01 aircraft, our larger VTOL to protect the evacuation area with water or fire retardants. Finally one or several X01 in rotation land vertically to lift people and remove them from immediate danger. 

The Valkyr is right now being built, it will fly December 21. A full carbon structure, 26 engines for a better maneuverability and redundancy (we can lose up to 30 percent of our engines and will still fly), folding wings, dual batteries, advanced cooling system. The same technology applies to the X01.

 

EVA brings the best aerospace engineers and electric engineers to this project.

story:
The Blue Frontier Campaign and 50 founding partners will mobilize a diverse constituency to ensure we have a healthy ocean and clean water for our and future generations. 

Let’s float ideas and anchor solutions that work!

About the Event

The March for the Ocean in Washington, DC and sister marches from coast to coast will feature key policymakers, activists, business leaders, and scientists. Among the speakers:

  • Sylvia Earle, Mission Blue
  • Jean-Michael Cousteau, Ocean Futures Society
  • Bill McKibben, 350.org
  • Xiuhtezcalt Martinez, Earth Guardians
  • Wyland the marine artist, and many more!

We are a diverse and inclusive movement. Our growing chorus of supporters include students and youth activists, surfers, divers, fishermen and women, small businesses, major aquariums, deep-sea explorers, celebrities - really anyone who gets so much from our ocean, lakes, rivers and sacred waters that they want to give something back.

As Dr. Earle says, “No water, no life. No blue, no green.”

Check out our website at www.marchforocean.com

Our Fundraising Goals

  1. Funding for Travel & Participation for Ocean Lovers like YOU: 
    • We need to raise $10,000 to cover event expenses and subsidize travel costs for underrepresented and distressed individuals who survived the impacts of devastating coastal hurricanes in Texas, Florida, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands and who wish to help lead the March for the Ocean. We're extremely appreciative for anything you are able to contribute!
  2. Further Blue Frontier Campaign’s mission: 
    • We want to provide resources, seminars, and tools to Ocean Lovers like you so that, together, we can make a difference including through media, grassroots mobilization and voter education.

Want to be part of this new wave of resistance?

March for the Ocean will raise awareness of the importance of World Oceans Day, and World Oceans Day weekend, World Oceans Month, and National Ocean Month!

Why We’re Mobilizing the Next Generation to Speak Up for Ocean Conservation

There is a new wave of resistance rising on the horizon. 

The Trump Administration and Congress are busy turning back a generation of gains for our ocean including shrinking or eliminating marine sanctuaries and monuments in order to expand offshore oil drilling while denying the impact of fossil-fueled climate change. These poor decisions are harming jobs, livelihoods, communities and the environment.

What’s on the chopping block? More than 425 million acres of land, water, and coastline including marine sanctuaries and national marine monuments. Our current administration and Congress are pushing to sell our cultural heritage by moving forward with a proposal that could potentially open up 95 million acres in the Gulf of Mexico to new drilling as well as areas in the Atlantic, Pacific and Arctic Ocean.

An oil spill could spell disaster as we saw with the Deepwater Horizon blowout catastrophe of 2010. Sign our petition and say ‘NO!” to offshore drilling. 

A poll by Marine Conservation Institute in August 2017, found that out of the 86,000 public comments submitted to the Department of Commerce on the fate of America’s blue parks,  99 percent were in favor of protecting them!

With widespread support, now is the perfect time for a March for the Ocean on June 9th, 2018! Blue Frontier Campaign along with a growing number of partners including Mission Blue, 350.org, Ocean Futures Society, the National Aquarium, PADI and Earth Guardians are effectively leading the wave. We’re building an inclusive and diverse coalition, and unifying around World Oceans Day weekend to send a message to Congress, this Administration and the WORLD that, “THE OCEANS ARE RISING AND SO ARE WE!”

Join the New Wave of Resistance

Given the current political climate, Blue Frontier Campaign, invites you to join and support its mission to build the solutions-driven citizen engagement needed to protect our ocean and coastal communities, both human and wild.

Join us on World Oceans Day weekend: Saturday, June 9th, 2018.

From Myrtle Beach, South Carolina to Honolulu, Hawaii, our March for the Ocean project will provide much-needed education resources and grassroots advocacy training to new and existing ocean and climate citizen-activists.

Dive into our article and find out why thousands of ocean lovers will march on June 9th. 

Your Dollars Empower the M4O #MarchForTheOcean Movement. Help Us Make A Splash in Your Community! Share & Spread the Word about M4O!

  1. Donate today! 
  2. Tell your friends, family, and colleagues about #M4O and the opportunity to support the March for the Ocean. Visit: www.marchforocean.com 
  3. Share this campaign on social media including Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!
  4. Stay connected. Follow our March for Ocean Facebook Page and M4O Twitter handle to stay up-to-date on our project.
  5. Sign our petition. 

 

For our Ocean,

David Helvarg
Executive Director
Blue Frontier Campaign
Chair, M4O Steering Committee

The Trump Administration and Congress are busy turning back a generation of gains for our ocean including shrinking or eliminating marine sanctuaries and monuments in order to expand offshore oil drilling while denying the impact of fossil-fueled climate change. These poor decisions are harming jobs, livelihoods, communities and the environment.
What’s on the chopping block? More than 425 million acres of land, water, and coastline including marine sanctuaries and national marine monuments. Our current administration and Congress are pushing to sell our cultural heritage by moving forward with a proposal that could potentially open up 95 million acres in the Gulf of Mexico to new drilling as well as areas in the Atlantic, Pacific and Arctic Ocean.
An oil spill could spell disaster as we saw with the Deepwater Horizon blowout catastrophe of 2010. Sign our petition and say ‘NO!” to offshore drilling. 
A poll by Marine Conservation Institute in August 2017, found that out of the 86,000 public comments submitted to the Department of Commerce on the fate of America’s blue parks,  99 percent were in favor of protecting them!
With widespread support, now is the perfect time for a March for the Ocean on June 9th, 2018! Blue Frontier Campaign along with a growing number of partners including Mission Blue, 350.org, Ocean Futures Society, the National Aquarium, PADI and Earth Guardians are effectively leading the wave. We’re building an inclusive and diverse coalition, and unifying around World Oceans Day weekend to send a message to Congress, this Administration and the WORLD that, “THE OCEANS ARE RISING AND SO ARE WE!”

Join the New Wave of Resistance
Given the current political climate, Blue Frontier Campaign, invites you to join and support its mission to build the solutions-driven citizen engagement needed to protect our ocean and coastal communities, both human and wild.
Join us on World Oceans Day weekend: Saturday, June 9th, 2018.
From Myrtle Beach, South Carolina to Honolulu, Hawaii, our March for the Ocean project will provide much-needed education resources and grassroots advocacy training to new and existing ocean and climate citizen-activists.
Dive into our article and find out why thousands of ocean lovers will march on June 9th. 


Your Dollars Empower the M4O #MarchForTheOcean Movement. Help Us Make A Splash in Your Community! Share & Spread the Word about M4O!


Donate today! 

Tell your friends, family, and colleagues about #M4O and the opportunity to support the March for the Ocean. Visit: www.marchforocean.com 

Share this campaign on social media including Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!

Stay connected. Follow our March for Ocean Facebook Page and M4O Twitter handle to stay up-to-date on our project.
Sign our petition. 

 
For our Ocean,

David HelvargExecutive DirectorBlue Frontier CampaignChair, M4O Steering Committee

story: >

Believe it or not, you have a bee to thank for every one in three bites of food you eat.


Honey bees—wild and domestic—perform about 80 percent of all pollination worldwide. A single bee colony can pollinate 300 million flowers each day. Grains are primarily pollinated by the wind, but fruits, nuts and vegetables are pollinated by bees. Seventy out of the top 100 human food crops—which supply about 90 percent of the world’s nutrition—are pollinated by bees.
The bottom line is that we know humans are largely responsible for the two most prominent causes: pesticides and habitat loss.

Common sense actions can restore and protect the world’s bees. Here’s a strong start:

  • Ban the most dangerous pesticides.
  • Protect pollinator health by preserving wild habitat.
  • Restore ecological agriculture...

... and at the last two points, Seed bombs jump in. 

Our Seed bombs, full with honey plants seeds, will provide a lot of food for the bees and take care of biodiversity of nature and preserve wild habitat. 
So, if you are aware of the importance of bees to mankind, then you'll help us, right?

You can help us & the bees with a donation or by making your own seed bombs.All the donations will be spend on & for the bees, as well for recognition of Seed Bombs.

Thank you!

story:
I got involved in this campaign because I care about life, our planet, nature and our rivers. When I had a personal crisis, Mother Earth helped me heal myself and now is my turn to give her a retribution. If we do not take action now at an environmental, social, and legal level, we will have a shortage of drinking water and living rivers in 10 years. Join and share!

Estoy haciendo esta campaña porque me importa la vida, nuestro planeta, la naturaleza y nuestros ríos. Cuando tuve una crisis personal, la Madre Tierra me ayudó a sanarme a mí misma y ahora es mi turno de darle una retribución. Si no tomamos acción ahora  a un nivel ambiental, social y legal, tendremos escasez de agua potable y de ríos vivos en 10 años. ¡Únete y comparte!

 

THE PROBLEM 

El problema

 

More than 50% of the world´s rivers are polluted such as: Salween, Danubio, Plata River, Bravo River, Ganges, Nilo, Indo, Murray-Darling, Mekong, Yangtze, Matanza River, Cuyahoga, Buriganga, Marilao, Sarno River, Citarum, Mississipi River, Doce River, Yellow, Passaic River. Across the world our rivers are dying, because of human waste, plastic trash and factory runoff that are common sources for pollutants found within rivers. Pollution of rivers has profound implications on aquatic and land-based wild life and people who depend on the rivers for food. Adversely, the pollution is affecting their health.

Más del 50% de los ríos del mundo están contaminados como: Salween, Danubio, Río de la Plata, Río Bravo, Ganges, Nilo, Indo, Murray-Darling, Mekong, Yangtze, Río Matanza, Cuyahoga, Buriganga, Marilao, Río Sarno , Citarum, Río Mississipi, Río Doce, Amarillo, Río Passaic. Alrededor del mundo, los ríos están muriendo, debido a los desechos humanos, la basura plástica y el residuo de la fábricas que son fuentes comunes de contaminantes que se encuentran en los ríos. La contaminación de los ríos tiene profundas implicaciones en la vida silvestre y acuática, y en las personas que dependen de ellos para obtener alimentos. De manera adversa, la contaminación está afectando su salud.

 

  • More than 80% of wastewater generated by society returns to the ecosystem without having been treated or reused.
  • 1.8 million people use water from polluted rivers for consumption, so they have the risk of contracting serious diseases.
  • 2 million tons of waste are thrown every day in the rivers of our planet.
  • If things do not change, we will have 40% less water for human consumption and only 20% of Living Rivers by 2030.

 

  • Más del 80% de las aguas residuales generadas por la sociedad regresa al ecosistema sin haber sido tratada o reutilizada.  
  • 1.8 millones de personas usan el agua de ríos contaminados para consumo por lo que corren el riesgo de contraer enfermedades graves.
  • Más del 50% de los ríos en el mundo están contaminados por desechos humanos, basura sobre todo plásticos y residuos industriales.
  • 2 millones de toneladas de desperdicios se tiran cada día en los ríos de nuestro planeta.
  • Si las cosas no cambian, tendremos 40% menos de agua para consumo humano y sólo el 20% de Ríos Vivos para el 2030.

 

MY MISSION

Mi misión


- To promote River Rights in the world.
- To start international clean-up and rescue campaigns.
- To create international alliances between groups and organizations.
- To honor the legacy of the ancestral traditions that have given voice to Mother Earth and Rivers. 

- Promover los Derechos de los Ríos en el mundo.
- Comenzar campañas internacionales de limpieza y rescate.
- Crear alianzas internacionales entre grupos y organizaciones.
- Honrar el legado de las tradiciones ancestrales que han dado voz a la Madre Tierra y a los Ríos.

 

AND I NEED YOUR HELP TO COLLECT USD $6000. Your donations are going to:

 

-My participation in international Forums during the rest of the year such as The Symposium for the Rights of Nature in Ecuador to invite international organizations to protect the rivers in the world (travel expenses: USD $850). 

-My participation in the meetings with international organizations such as the Earth Law Center in the USA to create an strategy to promote the Rights of the Rivers in the world (travel expenses: USD $650).

-An international campaign for the Rights or Rivers, using different platforms on the internet and press, for example: Avaaz and Change.org (expenses of strategy, graphic design and materials: USD $800). Deadline: December 21.

-Email campaign for local and international organizations to invite them to protect the Rivers in the western hemisphere and to sign the campaign for the Rights of Rivers (expenses of creation, strategy and email platform: USD $300). Deadline: December 21.

-2 Facebook campaigns paid (expenses of graphic design, community manager, and the payment for Facebook for 4 months: USD $550). Deadline: April 2019.

-Tools and Materials for the River clean-up and rescue campaigns. The plan is to begin with the Atoyac River in Mexico, the Ganga River in India as part of the historic event: Kiva Kumbha Mela 2019 and in the USA (300 volunteers: USD $1200). Deadline: February 2019.

-To cover expenses during these months to keep working full time on this campaign which is transcendental for Life, Peace, the Earth, and the Rivers in the world (transportation, office expenses, food: USD $1200).

- Fees for transactions and the crowdfunding platform - 5% for the platform + 3% transaction fees + 30 additional cents per transaction, you can find this on Indiegogo guidelines (USD $450 approx.)

 

Y NECESITO SU AYUDA PARA RECAUDAR USD $ 6000. Sus donaciones serán para:


-Mi participación en Foros Internacionales durante el resto del año como el Simposio por los Derechos de la Naturaleza en Ecuador  para invitar a organizaciones internacionales a proteger los ríos en el mundo (gastos de viaje USD $ 850).

-Mi participación en las reuniones con organizaciones internacionales como Earth Law Center en EUA para crear una estrategia para promover los Derechos de los ríos en el mundo (gastos de viaje USD $ 650).

-Una campaña internacional por los Derechos de los Ríos, utilizando diferentes plataformas en Internet y prensa, por ejemplo: Avaaz y Change.org (gastos en la creación de la estrategia, diseño gráfico y materiales USD $ 800). Fecha límite: 21 de Diciembre.

-Campaña de envío masivo de correos electrónicos para las organizaciones locales e internacionales para invitarlos a proteger los ríos en el continente americano y para firmar la campaña por los derechos de los ríos (gastos de creación, estrategia y plataforma de correo electrónico USD $ 300). Fecha límite: 21 de Diciembre.

-2 campañas de Facebook pagadas (gastos de diseño gráfico y el pago de Facebook por 4 meses USD $ 550). Fecha límite: Abril de 2019.

-Herramientas y Materiales para las campañas de limpieza y rescate. El plan es comenzar con el Río Atoyac en México, el Río Ganga en la India, como parte del histórico evento: Kiva Kumbha Mela 2019  y los Estados Unidos (300 voluntarios USD $ 1200). Fecha límite: Febrero de 2019.

-Para cubrir los gastos durante estos meses para seguir trabajando a tiempo completo en este propósito que es trascendental para la vida, la paz, la tierra y los ríos en el mundo (transporte, gastos de oficina, alimentación USD $ 1200).

-Comisiones por las transacciones y  por la plataforma de financiamiento colectivo - 5% para la plataforma + 3% de tarifas de transacción + 30 centavos adicionales por transacción, pueden encontrar esto en los lineamientos de Indiegogo (USD $ 450 aprox.)

 


 

BIG GOALS

Grandes Metas

 

With my team I want to:

1. Reach 10 million people with our different campaigns.

2. Provide the space for meetings, agreements and initiatives among indigenous leaders, and international organizations for the protection of the rivers in the world.

3. Give the "UN Harmony with Nature" program the signatures and backup materials to declare the River Rights. I´m an intermediary with UN.

Deadline - April 2019

 

Con mi equipo deseo:

1. Llegar a 10 millones de personas con nuestras diferentes campañas.

2. Proporcionar el espacio para reuniones, acuerdos e iniciativas entre los líderes indígenas y las organizaciones internacionales para la protección de los ríos en el mundo.

3. Entregar a la ONU Harmony with Nature Program las firmas y materiales de respaldo para declarar los Derechos de los Ríos. Yo soy enlace con la ONU.

Fecha límite - Abril 2019

 

Information and updating / Información y actualizaciones

www.facebook.com/derechosdelamadretierra

www.facebook.com/LacasadelaIxtli

 

WHO AM I?

¿Quién soy?

 

My name is Claudia Brindis. I´m a publicist, graphic designer, yoga teacher, emotional therapist, life coach, and facilitator of courses and workshops on human development. I have directed the collective of La casa de la Ixtli for several years to the awakening of consciousness. I work and collaborate for companies, schools, and both national and international organizations such as the Harmony with Nature Program of the United Nations, Rights of Mother Earth Mexico, Living Rivers, and Pachamama Alliance.

And my mission is to work on the Rights of Nature, Rights of Rivers, and the protection of life.

Mi nombre es Claudia Brindis. Soy publicista, diseñadora gráfica, maestra de yoga, terapeuta emocional, coach de vida y facilitadora de cursos y talleres en desarrollo humano. He dirigido el colectivo de La casa de la Ixtli durante varios años dedicado al despertar de conciencia. Trabajo y colaboro con empresas, escuelas y organizaciones nacionales e internacionales, como el Programa Armonía con la Naturaleza de las Naciones Unidas, Derechos de la Madre Tierra México, Ríos Vivos y la Alianza Pachamama.

Y mi misión es trabajar en los Derechos de la Naturaleza, los Derechos de los Ríos y la protección de la vida.

 

MY TEAM

Mi Equipo

 

Herlinda the person who always helps me to make the best strategy for action. Francisco contributes with his knowledge for planning, designing and producing materials. Hilario collaborates using social media and the web site.

Herlinda la persona quien siempre me ayuda a hacer la mejor estrategia para la acción. Francisco que contribuye con su conocimiento para planificar, diseñar y producir materiales. Hilario que colabora usando las redes sociales y el sitio web.

 

HOW CAN YOU TAKE PART?

¿Cómo puedes formar parte?

 

Donate and participate as a volunteer. And if you can´t, no worries! Become a guardian of Mother Earth and join me for the Protection of the Rivers by taking action in your country. You can make a difference!!!

Dona y participa como voluntari@. Y si no puedes, ¡no te preocupes! Conviértete en guardián@ de la Madre Tierra y únete a mí por la Protección de los Ríos tomando acción en tu país. ¡¡¡Tú puede hacer la diferencia!!!

 

MANY THANKS FOR YOUR DONATIONS, sharing this campaign, and enabling us to make this happen! 

¡MUCHAS GRACIAS POR TUS DONACIONES, compartir esta campaña, y apoyarnos para hacer que esto suceda!

 

 

Claudia Brindis

Profile on UN Harmony with Nature page / Perfil en página de ONU Armonía con la Naturaleza

 

Special thanks to Quirio for the CD´s to support this campaign / Agradecimiento especial a Quirio por los CD´s para apoyar esta campaña.

story:
Medicinal Farm Evacuation

PCC Palm Oil factory is dumping their waste on our medicinal farm land in Abenase, Ghana.
Now, we need to evacuate all our trees and nursery out of the land to conserve our plants and species. 

We need to evacuate all our plants to a new farm land because the Palm Oil factory is terminating our lease agreement to dump their factory waste on our medicinal plants and trees. 


Loading and evacuation of nursery plants out of the farm

To save our trees we have planned a large operation to uproot over 1000 trees in a very sensitive transplanting situation in the middle of the dry season drought. Not only do we need to find a new home for these transplanted trees, but we will also have to move over 10,000 nursery plants on the site to a new location. We will also have to abandon thousands of plantain trees which we cannot take with us.

We will have to abandon our plantain trees, as we cannot bring them with us.

Our climbing vine medicine plants which we will need to abandon

This operation will be expensive and falls beyond our planned budget. To win time are also hiring lawyers to fight for compensation for the installations on the land. We have hundreds of meters of water piping in the land for our irrigation, a borehole well, pumping systems and water storage systems which were all an expensive investment for our small company. We are also looking for compensation for our farm house on the land, used by our employees at the farm. 

Our farm house at Abenase, Ghana

Edwin at last year's installation of our grid electricity pole

Our generator is running the irrigation pumps now after PCC cut off our grid electricity

PCC Palm Oil does not want to give us any compensation for their actions. We are a small farming company of only 10 employees and they are an international multibillion dollar company who wish to crush our medicinal farm with no mercy. They purchased the public electrical transformer which also feeds our pumps and have cut off our electricity which we need for irrigation. We have a generator to keep our pumps functional, but this shows how they want to kill our plants with no consideration to their value. 

"We will continue to provide all our customers with our best services as we turn around this bad situation into a winning one"  -Ralf

 

Your help means a lot so we're giving our best deals to help with this operation.

Here is how we'll be using the funds:

€7,000 Campaign Goal

€2,000 Legal Fees

€2,000 Evacuations Transport

€2,000 New Farm Land

€500 Re-potting, watering supplies, and transplanting materials

€500 Miscellaneous unforeseeables 

 

Our Perks for our contributors are our best deals yet. Check them on the side bar, and if you don't see what you like, ask us and we will make the deal you want!

If we do not reach our goal, all the funds collected will still help towards helping us fight for our rights and move our farm plants and nursery to a new land

 

The Impact

Our medicinal farm is unique in the world. It contains medicinal plant genetics from around the world. From South East Asia, to the Amazon, and the Congo Basin, we have collected rare medicinal plants and are breeding them to provide them back to you, our community. We will need all your help in this fight against Big Palm Oil to keep our plants alive as a seed bank, a conservation project, and as a community benefit for all. 

Bulk African Trade has two other plots of land, deep in the rainforest where we plant more of our medicinal plants. But this is the only plot of land with road access, we need a new land with road access as our main farm to move supplies and materials in and out. Those of you who know us, know we provide you with the best products available, and we have excellent customer support of something doesn't go right, as sometimes happens when working with live plants. 

We also work with ground breaking technology, recording our farm activities and plants on the immutable ledger of the blockchain with earth.archive project. This is a one-of-its-kind project which records and conserves records of conservation and sustainability project like ours. 

We are not an NGO, we are Social Entrepreneurs working to better our company and those involved with it.  

 

Risks & Challenges

We have our lawyer fighting against the injustice of the Palm Oil company dumping their kaolin waste on our farm and their intention to make our land a dump site.

We carry the risk that our legal fees will not give us rights to the land. In this case we are fighting a two sided fight. We're also evacuating our plants to a new land. We will need to funds to purchase a new land and move our operations there instead of suffering the mal-intentioned behavior of PCC Organic Oils Palm Company.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot buy any of our products to help out. We can also use your help by spreading the word and sharing our cause. We are fighting against Big Palm Oil and it will not be easy. The more people are on our side, then the better chances we have to getting our medicinal plants our alive. 

If you simply just want to send us donations, we will gladly accept your help.
story_txt:
Medicinal Farm Evacuation
PCC Palm Oil factory is dumping their waste on our medicinal farm land in Abenase, Ghana.Now, we need to evacuate all our trees and nursery out of the land to conserve our plants and species. 
We need to evacuate all our plants to a new farm land because the Palm Oil factory is terminating our lease agreement to dump their factory waste on our medicinal plants and trees. Loading and evacuation of nursery plants out of the farmTo save our trees we have planned a large operation to uproot over 1000 trees in a very sensitive transplanting situation in the middle of the dry season drought. Not only do we need to find a new home for these transplanted trees, but we will also have to move over 10,000 nursery plants on the site to a new location. We will also have to abandon thousands of plantain trees which we cannot take with us.
We will have to abandon our plantain trees, as we cannot bring them with us.Our climbing vine medicine plants which we will need to abandonThis operation will be expensive and falls beyond our planned budget. story:
Summary

We are Damla and Fred. Damla is an agricultural engineer from Turkey, Fred an aerospace engineer from Germany. Our ways crossed in 2011 in Torino - Italy during our Erasmus exchange semester. We wanted to do something about the situation our world is in but didn't really know how to do this. It was during this time when the idea for our farm/living-model was born.

Even though life on our planet, especially our life as humans is in a problematic condition, when looking at the consequences and tendencies of our actions, there are ways towards a bright future. These ways require changes within the whole society - our consciousness. Such a change cannot be done overnight.

The purpose of our project is to show ways and enable change towards a sustainable life. This includes the normal life and lifestyle, agriculture, and conservation/restoration of nature.

We are motivated by our will to make a change, by our love for nature, and by the belief that we are the creators of our own destiny.

 

You can read all about our project on our website

www.waytopecu.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need financial support to be able to buy farmland and to finance the initial work on the land, which includes water collection and -storage systems, simple housing, a workshop, tools, and equipment. If funding exceeds the initial requirements, it will help to develop the project to full size in a shorter time and therefore enable us to support our surroundings earlier. A detailed and frequently updated cost analysis is shown on our website:

To be more specific, our estimated costs, broken down to development levels, are:

0) Purchase farmland: 35,000$

I) Initial work: 51,000$ --> Overall 86,000$

II) Full autonomy: 65,000$ --> Overall 151,000$

III) Full size: 121,000$ --> Overall 272,000$

 

The main goal for us is to raise funds high enough to initiate the levels 0) and I). 

Our project will start in any case and independent of the funding. However, without it, we have to collect money for at least 10 more years before we can start.

This means YOU can help us make a change NOW.

 

Risks & Challenges

What qualifies us to successfully build-up this project? - Damla knows the scientific and practical side of farming and processing plants. On top of this, we are educating ourselves in the field of natural farming/permaculture for more than six years. Fred is proficient in the topic of renewable energies and already developing parts of the later needed technology (e.g. wind turbine, distiller, ...). Apart from this, we are developing the entire farm concept as detailed and realistic as possible, to have a guideline throughout its construction. The results can be seen on our website.

 

Natural farming:

Is there a risk that it doesn't work? - There is no risk that it doesn't work. However, it can take some years until a system of natural farming is established, especially if the soil quality must be improved/revived in the beginning. We expect a time of 2-5 years (up to 10-15 years for trees/orchard).

Will the harvest be comparable to chemical farming? - The harvest of natural farming is, in fact, comparable and can exceed the harvest of chemical farming while only using a fraction of the invested energy.

 

Commercial strategies - earning money:

How will we avoid going bankrupt? - We will not stand on only one leg. Our plan is to earn money with three main strategies (growing and processing of medicinal herbs, bamboo, and hemp), and optional side strategies that are not fixed yet (small series production of sustainable technology, e.g. wind turbines; educational tourism; café/part-time-restaurant/exchange-library; ...). If one strategy temporarily fails, we will be able to compensate.

How can you grow hemp in Turkey? - Growing industrial hemp under strict and monitored conditions is legal in several states of the Turkish Republic. However, we are sure that this will be a bureaucratic challenge - one that we are ready to take.

 

Where does the money go?

We will open a whole new section on our webpage that follows the development of the project. It will display all project-related expenses. This is not only assurance for everybody who funds us but it will also serve as a guideline for others who are in the planning of a comparable project.

 

You don't want to contribute by credit card?

Please write us a message on our website, or an e-mail, we can help out with PayPal and Bank Transaction.

Our e-mail address: manchunga@yandex.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You would like to help us without involving money? - Here is what you can do:

1) Go through the "farm concept" on our website. Maybe you are proficient/have experience with natural farming, water collection systems, wastewater plants, alternative construction methods....   - Our knowledge is not perfect! Help us extending and detailing the concept.

2) You can help us with the translation of our website into the Turkish and German language. Since we both are still engaged in full-time jobs, it is difficult to find time for the development of the project AND time-consuming jobs like the translation of the whole website.

3) If you like our project, please share, tell your friends about it, or leave a comment.

story:
Lass uns einen Wald Kaufen!

Imagine a place where we have enough space to do whatever we want! Build a tipi or a shack, or a farm or a chicken house, or a festival or simply go for a long walk!

  • My name's Justine Electra and I've been making music for all my life. Ever since I moved up country when I was 19 in Australia, I fell in love with the forest. I had a dream of living in a forest ever since, but to be honest I'm kind of scared of the many threatening species alive and well in Australian forests. Germany is in comparison a place with very few threatening species'. However, it's rural areas are full of monoculture farms, and I want a place where my family and friends can go to without being sprayed by pesticides or radiowaves. So why not buy a forest - a big oxygen tent that guards us from the monocultures all around! And we can be its guardians!
  • This campaign is quite simple: everyone who wants to own a forest donates 100€ to this campaign. When we buy it each owner will have full rights to come on whenever they want, as long as they want, all the time... FOREVER!!! 
We will basically have something akin to Biesenthal Festival gelaende but full of trees. If some people aren't into doing loud things like the occasional  hippy Camp-Tipsy-like festival (with adjoining techno floor and naked bar of course!), well, on 7 hectares I'm sure they can find a quiet place to chill :-) For me a festival is one of many things I'd do in a forest. I would primarily like to raise chickens, have a goat and a big garden, and practice living off-grid in the summer, eventually in winter too. Art retreats, sweatlodges, tree-houses, yoga retreats etc etc could also be done here. Just use your imagination! 
Here is a link to a potential forest. I think 7 hectares would be a good size, but a holiday-forest (erholungs-grundstuck) would also be lovely. I know a lot of people want something to build a house on, but I really like the idea of temporary housing. Tipis, treehouses, shacks - they are all environmentally very low-impact. I have nothing against a log cabin, but I'm not sure if that would be permitted in the forest.
http://kleinanzeigen.ebay.de/anzeigen/s-anzeige/7-hektar-wald-bei-bad-freienwalde/320771867-207-7726?ref=search

Was wir brauchen und was wir kriegen!

  • Each person donates 100€
  • If we get at least 30,000€ together then we will have a good chance to buy our very own forest or holiday-forest (erholungs grundstuck) somewhere over near the Polish border.
  • The owners will have full rights and responsibilities regarding their usage, visitation and care of the forested land. 
  • If we don't buy a forest then the donations will be refunded of course!
General guidelines:
  1. Do whatever you want without annoying anyone else.
  2. Don't log the forest for commercial purposes.
  3. Majority rules. If there's an issue it will be voted on and the majority will decide the outcome.
  4. The owners and their friends and family are welcome. Any guests who can't prove an invitation will be asked politely to leave. This is to rule out the possibility of crime in the forest, and theft.
  5. You may build whatever you can get away with. A 3-story mansion is not really recommended as this is land without a building permit. It has no gas or electricity either, so we would have to bring generators if we needed energy. I have no idea about water. We will probably have to install rain tanks or something similar.
  6. You may play techno, but you may not blast techno from your car/truck while driving  randomly through the forest for more than a few hours annoying everyone.
  7. The donation is exactly that, and if we buy the land, it will be considered non-refundable.
  8. You can't sell your share, but you can vouch for people to become members (cost of 100€) who will be voted on (I suppose).
  9. You can grow/breed whatever you like (within reason). If it's marijiuana or any illegal crops or something weird like tarantulas we'll have to vote on it.
  10. If drug use of an owner/guest becomes an addiction annoying to members of the community (eg causing theft or bizarre aggressive behaviour in the presence of minors), then it will be addressed and the user/member voted in or out.
  11. Play fair and have fun!

Ein schoenes umfeld fuer unsere Freunde und Familie

Save the world one forest at a time!

  • Let's tell the world leaders what we want by living where and how we want!
  • Let's have a home (or a home away from home) where we can regenerate our bodies and souls with nature, and spend time in the forest either alone, or with our friends and families! 
  • Or not! It's up to you what you want to do or participate in in Your/Our Forest 
  • Let's build a community based on freedom of movement and creativity and growth! On support, understanding and other age-old hippy/buddhist ideals!
  • Before buying the forest, we will have a lawyer draw up a contract with each donators name in it, proving ownership of the land.
  • This will be posted here on indiegogo to keep us owners updated on the developments in the buying.
  • We will vote on the finished contract. Majority rules.
  • Some people may have misgivings about buying land on the Polish border, due to car and house theft. Correct me if I'm wrong, but I think if we're in the middle of a forest then they will not find us. That kind of thing goes on more on main roads and established places.

Risks & Challenges

  • As a part of the "Dorfmitte Schlossgaertnerei" Project in Gerswalde, I have been getting a lot of inspiration and education about self-sufficiency and rural work.
  • I am currently living the life of a mother with 2 kids, and that makes me very down-to-earth and surprisingly reliable. I get up early and get shit done! 
  • My partner is a good handy man and is very capable, and we are a good team which will ensure the buying goes smoothly.
Some challenges may be:
  1. The forest we're looking at may be sold by the time we get the money together. If so then we will keep looking for up to a year and inform you of our potential buys. No-one will be forced to buy a new forest they don't want.
  2. We want a forest within 1 - 1,5 hours of Berlin. Preferably near public transport. This may take a while to find!
  3. Making big decisions and trusting eachother's opinions.
  • Other Ways You Can Help
Tell everyone you know about this! Buying a forest is open to young and old!
  • Share the campaign everywhere you can, and send it in an email (just copy and paste!) to everyone you know!
  • Tell your mum and dad, your brother, sister and your neighbours!

Meet you in the forest (or not!)

yours,

Justine Electra

story:
Short Summary

We are Students from Turkey. I'm 25, and my best friend Irem is 22 years old. I'm studying Japanese Language and Literature, Irem is studying International Relationships and Psychology both (double major) We met each other through our travel passion. Then we were on the road for all Summer. We did not have much money, So we travelled whole Turkey by hitchhiking and camping. Exploring the nature and people was amazing.

What We Need & What You Get

Our common and biggest dream is to travel world. We want to start with Europe. Why first Europe? I applied a competition which gives you an interrail ticket for free. And surprisingly, i won it! It was 30 days/7 flexi. So the first step was accomplished. But the rest? We are just students with no income. So we need your help about our dream.  Our Dreams can be True with your Supports.

During our travel, we're planning to share what we know about our culture, and also our knowledge ( like Japanese, sign language) with who we meet. We want to put into practice how should the world peace be. We want to show people the power of smiling.


Our Route

Istanbul - Budapest (2 days)
Budapest - Vienna (1-2 days)
Vienna- Prague (2 days)
Prague - Amsterdam (2-3 days)
Amsterdam  - Brugge (1-2days)
Brugge - Paris (2 days)
Paris- Barcelona (2 days)
Barcelona - Livorno (with ferry perhaps)  (1-2 days) 
Livorno - Florence (2 days)
Florence - Rome (2-3 days)
Rome - Ancona (1-2 days)
Ancona - Patras (1-2 Days)
Patras - Atina (2-3 days)
Atina - ?stanbul...
