story:
My name is Richard Francis. I fell in love with Maine when I was a student at Bowdoin College and later, in 1999, I moved there from my hometown, New York City. I bought land and built a house, doing most all of the work myself, with the exception of the foundation. I became an avid gardener and nature lover, always conscious of the need to preserve the environment. I designed the house keeping that in mind – it’s heated with wood; a passive hot water heater keeps us warm from March to November, and we grow most of our own fruits and vegetables.

A couple of years ago I decided to build an addition to the house and run an eco-friendly and pet friendly Bed & Breakfast. The work has now begun in earnest. I’m a free-lance musician and a composer and the extra income would allow me more time for music. Just as important, doing this would be a way to act on how I think about the Earth and our relationship to the planet.

The reason for this Indiegogo campaign is to enable me to complete the structural additions to allow this dream to come through.

The additions will consist of: 1) Three single or double-occupancy rooms 2) A two-level apartment for larger groups

3) A common room with a wood cook stove/oven.

4) A heated greenhouse where we can produce our own vegetables year round.

5) I oriented the house from the beginning with many roof surfaces facing South and West so we will install solar panels.

     The partially finished addition for the B&B is now temporarily resting on small cement pads. My next step is to put in steel reinforced cement posts create the permanent foundation. The existing septic system needs to be expanded, and I need to buy more lumber, roofing materials, insulation, plumbing and electrical supplies, and appliances.

          Here is an approximate breakdown of costs:

Foundation--about $3,000 (rent excavator at $250/day, and buy steel and cement)

Septic system--about $4,000  (hire someone to add more pipe and sand)

Insulation--about $2,000 (I install this myself)

Plumbing and Electrical---about $3,000 (piping, wiring, appliances, fixtures: I do the installation myself)

Lumber--about $4,500 (I do the work)

Roofing materials---about 3,000 (I do the work)

Drywall and Paint-- about $2,000 (I do the work)

Misc. such as nails, screws, drill bits, saw blades etc.---about $500

Solar Power: for $15,000 we can provide electricity to the entire building (I do the installation).

    For progress updates and pictures you can go to our Facebook Page.

story:
What's This All About?

Over the last several years I have realized that the systems we use in this world for energy, food, water, and housing are not going to be able to last very much longer. 

So, my partner Kim and I have decided to take action, to change my career and my life and to help replace the systems that no longer work for us.

I applied and have been accepted to the Earthship Academy starting April 14th, 2014 where I will be trained to build Earthships. 

Earthships are beautiful homes made from reused and repurposed materials that sustain their occupants. They create their own electricity, water, heating, cooling, sewage treatment, and even food. 

This academy is not only classroom work but hands-on learning where we will be building an actual home. To graduate I will need to attend the four week academy, do another 4 week build from start to finish, and then complete a personal graduate project. 

This campaign is to raise the funds needed for this program.

I have already begun gathering a team of people who are also interested in a sustainable world and are interested in doing something about it. After attending the academy and especially after graduating from the program I will have insights and connections that will help me build a career helping others build these wonderful and beautiful homes locally and around the world.

All of this is of upmost importance to us because we want to make sure that our little boy and all of the children have a world in which to live and enjoy. 

You see, we believe we have everything we need here already on this planet. We simply must use it properly. 

I am changing my career in order to help change the world. You can be a part of that if you wish.

Go here to learn more about Earthships and Earthship systems


What Needs to Happen & What You Get

Here are the costs for the academy:

  • $2500 ~Tuition
  • $600   ~Transportation from San Francisco to Taos, NM and back
  • $600   ~Housing while at the academy
  • $500   ~Tools and equipment for the hands-on building portion of the academy

The total is $4200 but, we already have invested in some of these expenses using our own savings. We also plan on gathering more money through selling some of our belongings we no longer need and possibly even having a pledge party with our local friends and community.

Whatever amount is raised above our goal will go to help pay for my next 4 week onsite build that I must do to graduate from the program.

If we do not reach the goal ALL money raised will go to pay for as much of the expenses as possible and we will make it happen somehow regardless.


How Earthships Impact The Planet


They Do Great Work Around The World


Don't Worry if You're Short on Cash

If you want to help out in some other way besides cash, that's no problem. You can help out by spreading the word about this campaign and Earthships in general.

  • Post this link on our social media timelines and get the word out:  http://igg.me/at/earthship-academy
  • Check out www.Earthship.com to learn more and let your friends know about how awesome they are.


For More Info Watch The Full Length Earthship Documentary


Help us help the world!

story:
The Tireless Project has worn out the used motor that Allegheny CleanWays obtained with our “new to us” boat. The old Evinrude 88spl that has kept our boat running is at the end of its life. It has served us well hauling tons of trash and hundreds of volunteers, starting and running strong for (almost) every cleanup we’ve asked it to do. But it is time to face the facts. She drinks twice as much fuel as a modern outboard and it makes her pilot nervous as she burps and hiccups her way through cleanups. Our need for reliability, though always important, has grown over the years as we have expanded our program to work with more people in new ways.

We are asking for $10,400 for the purchase of an outboard motor, installation, and the necessary accessories that the boat needs to make it function best. About $8400 is for the motor itself and the rest is to get it up and running in time for our 2014 Tireless Project season. Once the boat is functional, we’re offering boat rides, movies and other fun excursions on the river for our large donors. Take a lovely cruise in the City of Bridges with friends, share a romantic candlelit dinner with your sweetheart, or have the opportunity to watch a movie on the river if you donate $500 or more. Smaller donors will receive other great "perks" as a thank you for your contributions. In addition, all donors will be invited to a river party if we reach our goal of $10,400 for the new motor. If the campaign is not fully funded, all raised funds will go towards the cost of the boat motor while Allegheny CleanWays searches for more funds to cover the remaining costs.

We are now entering the eleventh year of giving our Tireless volunteers access to Allegheny County’s riverbanks for fun learning, exploration, and beautification. We’ve begun to work with more students and other volunteers and are always striving to expand the areas we clean. Due to the expansion of our programs, we feel that it is time to improve our ability to work safely and effectively in our county. Our goal at Allegheny CleanWays is to have the best equipment we can obtain. We work with the tools we have been provided and acknowledge that affordability is an issue. Over the last few years we have considered building our own custom diesel outboard, inboard motors, electric motors, but in the end, the most affordable, reliable, serviceable, economical environmentally sound option out there is the modern, fuel efficient, and serviceable gas outboard motor.

Allegheny CleanWays, an affiliate of Keep PA Beautiful and Keep America Beautiful, is a 501(c)3 with the mission to engage and empower people to eliminate litter and illegal dumping in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania. In 2004, Allegheny CleanWays became the lead partner and fiscal agent of the Tireless Project. It is a collaboration of local organizations committed to stewardship of the rivers and streams of Allegheny County. Our current partners include Allegheny Land Trust, Artful Trash Management/ RiverCubes.net, Friends of the Riverfront, Nine Mile Run Watershed Association, REI, Rivers of Steel National Heritage Area, Steel City Rowing, Student Conservation Association, Venture Outdoors, and the City of Pittsburgh.

The Tireless Project evolved from the discouraging observations of Nat Stone who paddled through the Pittsburgh area in 1999. He wrote the book On the Water about his experience and dubbed the Ohio the “River of Tires”. His disgust with the conditions of the rivers found a sympathetic audience in Mike Lambert of the Three Rivers Rowing Association, who worked with him to launch the Tireless Project in 2003 as a means of addressing the problem of tires and other debris along the riverbanks.The Tireless Project has been engaging volunteers in cleaning up the Allegheny, Monongahela, Ohio, and Youghiogheny Rivers in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, for more than 10 years.

Allegheny CleanWays hopes that you will be able to contribute to our campaign in some way that best suites you and your abilities. If you would like to donate in another form (non-financial), please contact us at info@alleghenycleanways.org for more information. We ask that you share this need with others in the hopes of completing our project and to be able to further our mission of cleaning the rivers in Allegheny County.

story:
A little introduction....


My background:

My name is Tinka Plese, I am from Croatia but I´ve been living in South America, more precisely Colombia, for the last 27 years. I have a masters degree on Natural Sciences. I came from Europe attracted by the beauty of this country, people and biodiversity of fauna and flora. 


Our Campaign:

The eco reserve was created in 2013 to make the difference, contributing in the conservation of wild flora and fauna in Medellin, Colombia by sensibilising people towards nature. Also, help economically to AIUNAU, an NGO dedicated to rescue, rehabilitate and liberate in the wild; sloths, anteaters and armadillos. 

Sloths are frequently extracted from their natural habitats and sell as pets to citizens who do not know how to take care of them; not being aware of the negative impact to the natural populations of wild fauna. Babies and juveniles are assaulted in their forest, taken away from their mother´s chest to be sell as living teddy bears. Most of them die in the trafficants hands or their new human companions hands, this, potentially caused because of the physical and emotional traumas generated during the kidnaping process. Some individuals that do not die during the intent and arrive to the AIUNAU´s rescue center are rehabbed and let free in the wild.

It is really important to know that these species aren´t only disappearing because of the traffic, but also because of the yearly fading of thousands of acres of tropical forests, taking silently, many species of wild fauna lives.

This is why, we create the eco-reserve “Whispers from the forest”, located near to Medellin, Colombia, where people not only shall feel in peace but will be accompanied by wild animals that live freely in here. It is a space where one can have intimacy, come upon the nature.

Close to the city, get to know you as a real human being surrounded with trees, clean and clear water, exuberant plants, birds, mammals, frogs, insects….
 

Our campaign’s magnitude: 

This campaign shall help financing AIUNAU, which works on the rescue, rehabilitation and liberation of wild fauna such sloths, anteaters and armadillos, also education towards saving and respecting the wild life.  

More details:

We need $US 15 000 that will help grow our eco reserve, allowing us to establish exiting places for public, for them to come and feel in contact with nature, such as: eco paths with places to rest and hide from the rain, pavilions for workshops, places within the forest for relaxation and meditation.

Where will the funds go if we don´t achieve our goal?

The entire fund will go to help maintaining the rescue and rehabilitation center for threatened animals of AIUNAU´s foundation.


Thank you folks, hope we can make the difference!!!!!

story:
Pristine rainforest… cascading waterfalls, monkeys playing, butterflies fluttering, cutter ants marching, birds creating music, ancient Maya ruins… welcome to the Maya Mountain Marine Corridor in southern Belize.

This is an urgent appeal for our fragile planet.

We talk of conserving the Earth, of reducing our carbon emissions, of “doing our bit” but what have you done today to make a difference? If the answer is “not enough”, don’t just sit there with a frown! You could be part of saving 1,110 acres of tropical rainforest in one of the most pristine parts of Mesoamerica. You could give endangered wildlife, such as jaguars and tapirs, a place to roam free from hunting. You could be part of reducing climate change by locking up hundreds of thousands of tons of carbon that may otherwise go up in smoke. And, because the coral reefs downstream rely on these forests to filter crystal clear water, by protecting the forest, you could help preserve the incredible Belize Barrier Reef. 

View over the Rio Grande: The ‘Seven Hills Range’ is visible in the background and in the foreground, you can see one of the ranger stations of the Toledo Institute for Development and Environment. The land we seek to purchase lies upstream from here, to the left of this image, and is likewise carpeted by lush forest.


Our Campaign

The Toledo Institute for Development and Environment (TIDE) is a non-profit  conservation organization based in Belize’s southernmost district, Toledo. We have the opportunity to purchase and protect 1,110 acres of tropical broadleaf forest and we are seeking your support.

The piece of rainforest in question lies by the banks of the Rio Grande in the heart of one of the world’s biodiversity havens, the Maya Mountain Marine Corridor in Toledo. The image below shows a view from the river with the land we wish to purchase on the left bank.

The Maya Mountain Marine Corridor stretches from the pristine old-growth rainforest of the Maya Mountains to the coral reefs of the Snake Cayes (Map 1). It is an unspoiled place that provides a glimpse into the past, a route back to a different world when forests blanketed Mesoamerica and the underwater theatre of the coral reef played out in all its natural glory.

The Maya Mountain Marine Corridor supports no less than 48 globally threatened or endangered species. At least 20 of these occur in the parcel of forest we seek to purchase, including jaguar, Baird’s tapir, Yucatan black howler monkey, keel-billed motmot and the Central American river turtle, known locally as ‘hicatee’.

Map 1: The Maya Mountain Marine Corridor is made up of the Port Honduras Marine Reserve and the watersheds of the six rivers that flow into it, including the Rio Grande.


The purchase of this land will help complete an important wildlife corridor that TIDE has been working on for 12 years (Map 2). The neighboring land parcels are already managed for conservation.

The sale price of the land is $300,000. Our longstanding partner, the Quebec Labrador Foundation, and its supporters have already secured $250,000. We therefore only need to raise a further $50,000 to purchase this remarkable piece of rainforest. We seek to raise at least 10% of that total with this campaign.

If we succeed, we will place the land under a permanent conservation agreement and manage it to make sure the forest is protected in reality and not just on paper.

If we fail to purchase the land, it will most likely be sold to a developer who will replace the ancient forest with a monoculture of banana or citrus with devastating consequences for the forest and harming the downstream aquatic and marine ecosystems.

Please donate to protect this amazing natural treasure.

Map 2: The 1,110-acre parcel of land that we seek to purchase (highlighted in red) will complete an important wildlife corridor by connecting conserved lands owned by TIDE (to the northeast, northwest and southwest) with conserved lands owned by a private eco-tourism resort (to the west). It also plays an important role in protecting the Rio Grande, which runs by the eastern and southern boundaries, and the Port Honduras Marine Reserve downstream.


What you could be part of protecting

Due to its remoteness, this 1,110-acre parcel of tropical rainforest has largely been spared from logging and hunting. Ancient trees still tower above the main forest canopy and wildlife is abundant.

The forest provides habitat to hundreds of species of mammals, birds, reptiles and amphibians. TIDE has captured images of some of its inhabitants using camera traps.

Big cats still thrive in the area because their prey – animals such as agoutis, peccaries, deer and armadillos – are still plentiful. A healthy puma like the one above is a sign of a healthy ecosystem.

The iconic jaguar is a symbol of stealth and deadly beauty. These big cats share the forest with three smaller cat species, the ocelot, the margay and the jaguarundi.

Weighing in at around 20 lbs, the ocelot is about ten times smaller than the jaguar.

Baird’s tapir is the national animal of Belize. The forest we invite you to conserve forms part of one of the last strongholds for this endangered animal.

Protecting the forest will also protect aquatic species, such as this critically endangered ‘hicatee’ turtle. The stretch of the Rio Grande that runs past the forest in question contains one of the world’s last populations. Forested riverbanks are necessary to maintain the deep river channel that hicatees require. In the picture above, TIDE ranger Louis Ishim (left) and terrestrial ecologist Elmar Requena pose with an adult female they are measuring to determine the status of the population.

Morelet’s crocodile is another Rio Grande resident. It is a conservation success story, having bounced back from near extinction.

As if you needed another reason to donate, there is another huge reason why this forest deserves protection – Belize is home to the world’s second longest barrier reef, the Belize Barrier Reef, home to thousands of amazing and colorful species, such as this nudibranch in the Port Honduras Marine Reserve.

Aerial view of the Port Honduras Marine Reserve

Corals depend on crystal clear waters. Sadly, this makes them extremely vulnerable to pollution from the land. When the forest is cleared, soils erode under the heavy tropical rains and plumes of muddy brown water extend out to sea for many miles, smothering corals and killing them.

But all is not lost. The Belize Barrier Reef is still healthy compared with most Caribbean reefs and one of the main reasons is that Belize still enjoys 62% forest cover. The Maya Mountain Marine Corridor has 90% forest cover and the Rio Grande has excellent water quality.

The river empties into the Port Honduras Marine Reserve, which boasts some of the healthiest coral gardens in the entire Belize Barrier Reef. Please help us to keep it this way. Please make a donation, large or small.

Clear blue waters at West Snake Caye in the Port Honduras Marine Reserve.

Soft corals and fishes at East Snake Caye in the Port Honduras Marine Reserve.


Purchase for permanence

This forest will not be bought and forgotten. Far from it! It will be actively monitored and protected by TIDE’s scientists and rangers, who will conduct regular monitoring to detect threats and patrols to prevent hunting, logging or other harm.

TIDE ranger Santiago Cucul investigates evidence of illegal logging.

TIDE ranger Andrew Williams on patrol on the Rio Grande.

 

And this campaign is not an isolated action. It forms part of a much wider program and conservation and sustainable development by the Toledo Institute for Development and Environment with just a few examples below.


Our annual Youth Conservation Competition sees young people give theatrical performances to build awareness and appreciation of Belize’s natural heritage.

Our award-winning “Freshwater Cup” soccer and environmental competition engages hundreds of children each year in planning and carrying out their own environmental projects, such as this tree-planting project by Big Falls School boys team.

One of the ways we involve communities is to train young people to assist with environmental monitoring. Here, a group studies for a bird identification exam.

Once qualified, we employ them to do various monitoring activities, such as coral reef health monitoring.

We train local fishers to switch to tour-guiding. Southern Belize boasts some of the best fly-fishing in the world and here Mr. Scully Garbutt, a tour guide trained by TIDE, releases a tarpon.


Who we are

The Toledo Institute for Development and Environment is a grassroots conservation organization made up of passionate Belizean and international personnel committed to protecting Toledo’s natural wonders and helping its people develop in harmony with nature.

We were founded in 1997 and have since grown into one of the most well respected NGOs in Belize. We have just over 30 permanent staff plus five to ten volunteers. We co-manage the Port Honduras Marine Reserve and Payne’s Creek National Park in partnership with the Government of Belize and manage over 20,000 acres of private lands that we hold in trust for the people of Belize and to which this latest land purchase will add an important piece.

The TIDE team (minus most of the field staff) in September 2013. Our executive director, Mrs. Celia Mahung, is in the middle in green. Yours truly is fourth from the left on the back row.


Once again, we ask you to join us in protecting the fragile ecosystems of the Earth by donating to the purchase of 1,110 acres of lush rainforest in the heart of the Maya Mountain Marine Corridor. This will complete an important wildlife corridor, provide a safe place for endangered species and help maintain healthy ecosystems in the marine reserve downstream. Please, do something that will take a minute but last for millennia!

 

For more information about TIDE, please visit www.tidebelize.org and find us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/TIDEBZE?ref=hl.

story:
Short Summary

The Campaign
We invite you to join us in doing our bit to keep our environment livable and sustainable while at the same time enjoying a healthy lifestyle. This mission is illustrated by our twin motto "Kind To Your Skin. Kind To Our Earth". 
As a start-up facing tough competition from the makers of Synthetic beauty products, we are asking for your support in the form of purchases of our Premium Certified Organic products at special prices only available as part of this campaign. While these products make wonderful Christmas gifts, 10% of the funds coming from you will go to a Conservation Charity of your choice. We also ask for your help in spreading this message of "Kind To Your Skin. Kind To Our Earth". Please read on for more details.

Who are we?                  

                                   

Deepthi Organics LLC, located in Kernersville, NC is a start-up that is certified under both USDA NOP and Ecocert organic standards. This is rare among end-product manufacturers, particularly among start-ups. We just recently launched six Premium Skin and Hair care products and are working on more for launch in the next few months. The Deepthi products come under the Verdana ('verde' = Green) brand name. 

We have been featured on:

                 

                    

                     


                     


                     

Our Mission

At Deepthi, we believe strongly that Luxury can be Green and Green can be Luxury. It is possible for us to strike a balance between a luxurious lifestyle and care for the environment. Just because a skin/hair product is of natural or organic origin it does not have to look, feel and smell like goo. And, they don't have to cost an arm and a leg. The technology, the processes and ingredients needed to create truly luxurious products that are completely natural and totally harmless to our environment while being affordable are all available.

Beauty Products and the Environment

The harm that we cause to our Earth by carelessness is not always as obvious as what the picture of the seals in distress depicts. The synthetic beauty products out there are all full of toxic chemicals like Petroleum derivatives, Parabens etc.,that are bad not just for our bodies but also to the Earth we call our home. To take a specific example, Cyclopentasiloxane, a very commonly used Silicone compound in Skin and Hair Conditioners is associated with 'persistent bio-accumulation in wildlife' in Canada's PBT list and 'tumor causing in animals' by a Dow Corning's report.

Another fact that is very commonly neglected is that many Organic standards ignore the delivery systems (bottles, caps, pumps etc.,). Even the so called 'Certified Organic' products from many manufacturers use components that are made of not only non-recyclable material but also produce fumes that harm the environment during their manufacture.

How are we different?

Every aspect of Deepthi's operations is conducted with its impact on the environment in mind. All the bottles, cap, pumps etc., that our products come in are recyclable. Even the shipping materials we use are either fully recyclable or bio-degradable.

The Verdana products have 

  • No Petroleum derivatives
  • No Silicones
  • No Parabens
  • No Mineral Oil
  • No Pthalates
  • No Sulphates
  • No Phosphates
  • No Formaldehydes
  • No Synthetic Preservatives
  • No Synthetic Fragrances
  • No GMO's
  • No Animal Testing
  • No Animal derived ingredients
  • No Compromise
Our products are manufactured under GMP guidelines  and are validated under CTFA/ FDA guidelines for Safety, Functionality and Performance.
And, these products have been very carefully priced to make as many converts as possible of the non-believers.
Current Status of the Project
The first phase of the project has been completed with the launch of our 6 Premium Skin and Hair care products. Organic Certifications under Ecocert as well as USDA NOP standards have been obtained. Efforts to spread the message and actively market the products are underway.
The second phase of the project involves 6 additional products ( Organic Aftershave, Toner, Face Serum etc.,). These products are under development, with the first ones undergoing validation tests. Future development work will include Green Home Care products.
The project has reached a stage where we need a little bit of push from behind to face the headwinds that are typical in an effort like this. 
Hence this campaign.
Our Products
1. Moroccan Beauty Oil                                         

                                 

Category:        Skin & Hair
Size:                  4 Fl Oz (120 ml)
Certification: Available in Ecocert as well as USDA Certified Organic versions.
Description:  
Organic Argan Oil infused with Organic scents (essential oils).
Benefits:
  • Very Light, Quick-absorbing, Non-Greasy
  • Leaves no oiliness behind
  • Multi-functional wonder for Skin and Hair - Ideal Nighttime treatment for Face and Neck to reduce roughness, wrinkles and fine lines; Softens Dry Elbows and Heels; Nourishes Scalp and Cuticles; Tames Frizz and Conditions Hair.
  • For Normal to Dry Skin and Hair types. Dermatologist tested.
Key Ingredients:
    Organic Argania Spinosa (Argan) Oil, Organic Citrus Sinensis (Sweet Orange) Peel Oil, Organic Melaleuca Quinquinervia (Niaouli) Oil
    2. Shine & Control Hair Oil                                                

                                   

    Category:        Hair
    Size:                  4 Fl Oz (120 ml)
    Certification: Ecocert Certified Natural & Organic

    Description:  
    A proprietary blend of Organic plant oils and botanical extracts with a fabulous light herbal scent. Brahmi and Gotu Kola extracts work in synergy with Argan oil to revitalize and nurture hair.

    Benefits:

      • Super Light; Absolutely Non-Greasy; Gets absorbed instantly. Wonderfully pleasant light herbal scent.
      • Nourishes Hair and Imparts Shine. Tames Frizz and Fly-aways. Keeps hair conditioned without the oiliness.
      • For Dry and Normal Hair Types. Dermatologist Tested.
    Key Ingredients:

    Organic Argania Spinosa (Argan) Oil, Organic Soybean Oil, Caprylic/Capric Triglycerides (derived from coconut), Organic Sweet Almond Oil, Organic Rosehip Seed Oil, Organic Sunflower Oil, Organic Sesame Oil, Organic Brahmi Extract, Organic Gotukola Extract, Organic Lavender Oil, Organic Green Myrtle Oil.

    3. Leave-in Conditioner Serum

                             

    Category:        Hair
    Size:                  1.7 Fl Oz (50 ml)
    Certification: Ecocert Certified Natural & Organic

    Description:  
    A Silicone-free, water-free formula with Argan oil as the central structure. It deeply nourishes hair while at the same time smoothing, softening and conditioning it.

    Benefits:

        • Non-Greasy Dry Emollience and Deep Conditioning in perfect balance.
        • Super Light. Leaves behind No Oiliness. Does not weigh hair down. Gets absorbed instantly. Pleasant light herbal scent.
        • Argan, Jojoba, Pracaxi, Coconut and Shea oils in a dry emollient formula.
        • For Dry and Normal Hair Types. Dermatologist Tested.
    Key Ingredients:

    Organic Argania Spinosa (Argan) Oil, Organic Jojoba Oil, Organic Coconut Oil, Organic Pracaxi Nut oil, Organic Shea Nut Oil, Organic Rosemary Extract, Organic Green Myrtle Oil, Organic Lavender Oil, Organic Bergamot Oil (free of phototoxic Bergaptene), Capric/Caprylic Triglyceride (derived from coconut), Dicaprylyl Carbonate (vegetable derived).

    4. Anti-Wrinkle Face Lotion
                                           

                                    

    Category:        Skin
    Size:                  4 Fl Oz (120 ml)
    Certification: Ecocert Certified Natural & Organic

    Description:  

    Luxury you will love. Naturally. And some serious skin hydration for stressed skin.

    With a wonderfully pleasant, light herbal scent, this product spreads smoothly on the skin and is absorbed instantly. The Verdana Anti-Wrinkle Face Lotion has been created for the most sensitive skin.

    Good for Day and Night use.

    Benefits:

        • Luxurious Lotion in almost Cream-like consistency. Spreads smoothly and is absorbed instantly.
        • Provides Serious Hydration for Stressed Skin. Helps against wrinkles and fine lines.
        • For all Skin types. Dermatologist Tested. Wonderfully Pleasant Light Herbal Scent.
    Key Ingredients:

     Organic Aloe Vera leaf juice, Organic Sunflower seed oil, Organic Myrtus communis leaf extract, Vegetable Glycerin, Capric/Caprylic Triglyceride (derived from coconut), Organic Shea nut butter, Borage seed extract, Organic Foraha/ Tamanu) fruit/seed oil, Carrot seed oil, Organic Calendula flower extract, Organic Neroli flower oil,  Pinus Pinaster extract, Palmarosa leaf oil, Organic Rose flower oil, Sandalwood oil, Organic Rosemary leaf extract.

    5. Anti-Wrinkle Face Creme

                      

    Category:        Skin
    Size:                  2 Fl Oz (60 ml)
    Certification: Ecocert Certified Natural & Organic

    Description:  

    Luxury you will love. Naturally. 

    With a wonderfully pleasant, light herbal scent, this product spreads smoothly on the skin and is absorbed instantly. The Verdana Anti-Wrinkle Face Creme has been created for the most sensitive skin.

    Good for Day and Night use.

    Benefits:

        • Pure Luxury
        • Specially formulated to help skin against wrinkles and fine lines by providing effective hydration, gentle exfoliation and anti-aging efficacy.
        • Having been formulated for Sensitive Skin, this product is good for all types of skin. Dermatologist tested.
    Key Ingredients:

     Organic Aloe Vera leaf juice, Organic Sunflower seed oil, Organic Alfalfa extract, Vegetable Glycerin, Capric/Caprylic Triglyceride (derived from coconut), Aspen Bark extract, Samphire extract, Olive Leaf extract, Organic Lavender oil, Chamomile flower extract, Organic Neroli flower oil, Organic Rose flower oil, Frankincense extract, Organic Rosemary leaf extract.

    6. Relaxing Creme Cleanser

                                  

    Category:        Skin
    Size:                  4 Fl Oz (120 ml)
    Certification: Ecocert Certified Natural & Organic

    Description:  

    Featuring only the purest and most effective Natural and Organic ingredients, our Skin Relaxing Creme Cleanser is a Premium Certified Organic Face Wash that has been specially created for skin that is suffering from the effects of environmental and hormonal stress.

    Benefits:

        • Unlike foaming cleansers, this gentle cream cleanser will not cause dryness.
        • Comes with a pleasant light herbal smell.
        • With Schisandra, Seabuckthorn, Chamomile and Frankincense extracts, this organic face wash has just the right combination to help skin fight off stress.
        • Specially formulated for Sensitive Skin, this product is good for all skin types.
    Key Ingredients:

     Organic Aloe Vera leaf juice, Organic Sunflower seed oil, Organic Alfalfa extract, Vegetable Glycerin, Organic Seabuckthorn extract, Schisandra fruit extract, Rhatany root extract, Caprylic/capric triglyceride (derived from coconut), Chamomile flower extract, Organic Neroli flower oil, Organic Rose flower oil, Frankincense extract, Organic Rosemary leaf extract.

    Please see the Gallery section of this campaign for Product Videos.

    What We Need & What You Get

    We have just started selling the first 6 products online and sales reps have been appointed for some states. The business is at a stage where funding is needed for that one extra push in the market as well as to bring the new exciting products that are getting ready.

    The funds sought will be used for spreading the message of environmental responsibility in the beauty care field as well as development of new products. This will include earth-friendly Pet Care and Home Care products.

    The Perks we offer are:

    - A full 10% of your funds will be donated to an environmental project (lawful, US based) of your choice. If you do not have a specific preference, the funds will be donated to WWF (World Wide Fund for Nature).

    - You get bundles of our premium Hair care/ Skin care products at close to wholesale price with Free Shipping to anywhere in the Continental USA.  These products make wonderful Christmas gifts.

    Details are shown below. 

    - Delivery will start as soon as the campaign has ended (in December 1st week) and will be completed by December 20, in time for Christmas.


                            


     




    The Impact

    This is a unique opportunity to combine the purchase of premium wellness products  that make wonderful Christmas gifts with doing your bit to safeguard our Earth. 

    And, in the process, you also help my project move forward with what we set out to promote in the first place - Sustainable Luxury.

    Risks & Challenges

    The two main risks in this project are:

    • The beauty market is very crowded. Only the fittest survive.
    • There are many manufacturers who claim that their products are organic without actually being certified or seriously following the rules. These fake organic products are a challenge for businesses like Deepthi.
    My decades of experience in the corporate world in the areas of Product Development and in managing major projects gives the strength and the fact that this business has been debt free so far give the flexibility in dealing with these challenges and carrying the mission forward. And, of course with your support, we will succeed.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We perfectly understand if you can't contribute monetarily. You can still help in the mission by spreading the word using the Indiegogo share tools or other social media like Facebook.

story:
Apóyame a participar como voluntario por cuatro meses en SiKanda

Me llamo Everardo Vergara, actualmente vivo en el Distrito Federal. Soy maestro en ingeniería ambiental de profesión.  Como muchos otros jóvenes, tengo el problema que no encuentro una oferta de trabajo que me entusiasme y los trabajos interesantes que se ofrecen es poco fácil ser contratado.  Sin embargo, en la vida real hay mucho trabajo por hacer. Mi objetivo es convertirme en un excelente profesionista que trabaje con comunidades marginadas para contribuir a mejorar su calidad de vida. Como parte de este recorrido quiero la oportunidad de participar en SiKanda para servir y aprender en lo que me apasiona.

Me interesa participar en los proyectos de SiKanda, porque: promueven la construcción de eco-casas, el lombri-compostaje y la agricultura urbana entre las familias que viven en los basureros y los barrios marginados para promover una mejor nutrición y nuevas formas de ingreso; a través del liderazgo ecológico y organización comunitaria.   Mis tareas en SiKanda se enfocarán en apoyar en la elaboración de propuestas, reportes, dar talleres a escuelas y comunidades, realizar tareas en agricultura urbana y en la planta de lombri-compostaje. 

Lo que necesito y lo que obtienes

Necesito de su apoyo económico para financiar mi estancia por cuatro meses en la ciudad de Oaxaca trabajando de voluntario en Sikanda con los pepenadores y las familias que viven en barrios marginales. Una forma de agradecerles su donación es correr mi primer medio maratón en la Ciudad de México el próximo 25 de agosto.

Mi presupuesto: El costo del transporte son $1000 pesos, en alimentos y hospedaje viviendo en Oaxaca son aproximadamente $2,750 pesos al mes. El costo total por los cuatro meses son 12,000.  De antemano muchas gracias por cualquier cantidad que sean capaces de cooperar.

Mis Recompensas: Llevo una dieta vegetariana desde hace más de siete años, durante este tiempo he aprendido a hacer nuevas recetas, estudiado sobre alimentos y hábitos saludables. Lo que puedo ofrecer es un manual de consejos para mejorar maravillosamente su salud así como ricas recetas vegetarianas. Hacer manualidades con material reciclado y enviárselos. En el medio maratón de la Ciudad de México que voy a participar les puedo mandar unas fotos o vídeo agradeciendo a los donantes. 

Porque "La salud es un tesoro de muchos más quilates que el oro mismo" es importante leer el manual de hábitos saludables y recetas de una dieta vegana, siendo esté manual la recompensa por donar $25 USD

  

Al donar $30 USD, además de las recompensas anteriores,  eliges una bonita artesanía hecha de material reciclable:   

  • 1 florero y 6 vasos de vidrio a partir de botellas de vidrio reutilizadas                                                
  • 3 par de aretes, 3 carteras, 2 pulseras y 1 collar 
  • Recibe una bolsa de mano hecha de materiales reciclables 

Por donar $ 75 USD recibes un documental hecho por  SiKanda sobre las vidas de las personas que viven en los vertederos (pepenadores), personas de grande lucha y dedicación, más el manual transformando mi basura en agricultura urbana. Además de las recompensas anteriores 

                                    

Otras formas de ayudar 

Pasa la voz, diles a tu familia, amigos, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos. Pon esto en tu facebook u otras redes sociales y muestra tu apoyo para trabajar con los pepenadores y familias que viven en los basureros. 

Juntos, podemos ir hacia un mundo más justo y equitativo 

__________________________________________________________________________________

Help me to collaborate as a volunteer for four months for SiKanda

My name is Everardo Vergara at this time I live in Mexico City. I studied master in Environmental Engineering. Like many other young adults, I struggle for finding a job offer that is attractive for me. And those few jobs that are interesting are hard to be hired by those employers. But in real life there is a lot of job to do. My objective is to become into an excellent professional who will work in poor communities for contributing to improve their living conditions. As part of this I want the chance of participating in the organization nonprofit call SiKanda, so I can serve and learn what I love as a profession.

I am interested in participating in the projects of SiKanda, because promote the construction of eco-houses, vermi-composting and urban agriculture among families that live in dump and in poor neighborhoods to promote better nutrition and new sources of income; trough environmental leardership and community organization.  My work at SiKanda will be focus in helping to design propositions, working on reports, give workshops to schools and communities, working in the urban agriculture program and in the worm composting plant.  

What I need & What You Get

I need your financial support for fund my stay during four months in Oaxaca City for working as a volunteer for SiKanda with the recyclers and the families that live in the poor neighborhoods. One way of thanking your donation is running my first half marathon in Mexico City the next August 25.

My Budget: The transportation cost is a $83, for the food and lodging is around $230, for month. The total for the 4 months is $1,000. I promise that I will do my best for working hard and learn the most I can from this experience. Thank you in advance.

My Perks:I have a vegetarian diet for over seven years. Throughout this time I have learned to make new recipes, and I had study about healthy habits. What I can offer is a brochure for improving in a drastic way your health and tasty vegetarian recipes. Also doing some handcrafts and sends it to you. In the half marathon of Mexico City; which I will take part of.  I can send to you some photos thanking the donors. 

More about SiKanda

SiKanda- Solidarity International Kanda A.C. is an independent, nongovernmental, nonprofit. "Kanda" means “Movement in Mixtec, an indigenous language spoken in Mexico. SiKanda wants to create a movement of solidarity and international cooperation. The organization had been working with the communities at risk in oaxaca (a mexican state) since 2008. Designing and implementing programs to fight poverty and promoting human and social rights. 

For more information check the website of the organization 

  • http://www.si-kanda.org/index.php?

Other ways to help

Spread the word tell your family, your friends, work partners, neighbors, Put this on facebook or other social networks and show your help to work  with the Pepenadores and the families who lives in slums. 

Together, We can go towards a fair and just world!
story_txt:
Apóyame a participar como voluntario por cuatro meses en SiKanda



Me llamo Everardo Vergara, actualmente vivo
en el Distrito Federal. Soy maestro en ingeniería ambiental de profesión.  Como muchos
otros jóvenes, tengo el
problema que no encuentro una oferta de trabajo que me entusiasme y los
trabajos interesantes que se ofrecen es poco fácil ser contratado.  Sin embargo, en la vida real hay mucho
trabajo por hacer. Mi objetivo es convertirme en un
excelente profesionista que trabaje con comunidades marginadas para contribuir
a mejorar su calidad de vida. Como parte de este recorrido quiero la
oportunidad de participar en SiKanda para servir y aprender en lo que me
apasiona. 
Me interesa participar en los proyectos de SiKanda, porque: promueven la construcción de eco-casas, el lombri-compostaje y la agricultura urbana entre las familias que viven en los basureros y los barrios marginados para promover una mejor nutrición y nuevas formas de ingreso; a través del liderazgo ecológico y organización comunitaria.   Mis tareas en SiKanda se enfocarán en
apoyar en la elaboración de propuestas, reportes, dar talleres a escuelas y comunidades,
realizar tareas en agricultura urbana y en la planta de lombri-compostaje. 
Lo que necesito y lo que obtienes
Necesito de su apoyo económico para
financiar mi estancia por cuatro meses en la ciudad de Oaxaca trabajando de voluntario
en Sikanda con los pepenadores y las familias que viven en barrios marginales. Una
forma de agradecerles su donación es correr mi primer medio maratón en la
Ciudad de México el próximo 25 de agosto. 
Mi presupuesto: El costo del transporte son $1000 pesos, en alimentos y hospedaje viviendo
en Oaxaca son aproximadamente $2,750 pesos al mes. El costo total por los
cuatro meses son 12,000.  De antemano
muchas gracias por cualquier cantidad que sean capaces de cooperar. 
Mis Recompensas:
Llevo una dieta vegetariana desde
hace más de siete años, durante este tiempo he aprendido a hacer nuevas recetas, estudiado sobre alimentos
y hábitos saludables. Lo que puedo ofrecer es un manual de consejos para
mejorar maravillosamente su salud así como ricas recetas vegetarianas. Hacer manualidades
con material reciclado y enviárselos. En el medio maratón de la Ciudad de
México que voy a participar les puedo mandar unas fotos o vídeo agradeciendo a
los donantes. 
Porque "La salud es un tesoro de muchos más quilates que el oro mismo" es importante leer el manual de hábitos saludables y recetas de una dieta vegana, siendo esté manual la recompensa por donar $25 USD
  
Al donar $30 USD, además de las recompensas anteriores,  eliges una bonita artesanía hecha de material reciclable:   


1 florero y 6 vasos de vidrio a partir de botellas de vidrio reutilizadas                                                

3 par de aretes, 3 carteras, 2 pulseras y 1 collar 
Recibe una bolsa de mano hecha de materiales reciclables 

Por donar $ 75 USD recibes un documental hecho por  SiKanda sobre las vidas de las personas que viven en los vertederos (pepenadores), personas de grande lucha y dedicación, más el manual transformando mi basura en agricultura urbana. Además de las recompensas anteriores 
                                    
Otras formas de ayudar 
Pasa la voz, diles a tu familia, amigos, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos. Pon esto en tu facebook u otras redes sociales y muestra tu apoyo para trabajar con los pepenadores y familias que viven en los basureros. 
Juntos, podemos ir hacia un mundo más justo y equitativo 
__________________________________________________________________________________

story:
Who We Are

NCSU's EcoCAR2 team is a multi-disciplinary team made up of students from North Carolina State University competing in EcoCAR2: Plugging into the Future.  The team is run like a small business, we design and build a vehicle, but also have to manage the team and market the vehicle.  More information about the team can be found at our website:

www.NCSUEcoCAR2.com

or on our Facebook page:

http://www.facebook.com/NCSUEcoCAR2

The competitions website is:

www.ecocar2.org

The NCSU EcoCAR 2 team is looking to raise enough money to fund a Mechanical Engineering Capstone Design class next semester.  This last semester the Senior Design class was a huge success.  Through the class we had a battery installation tool, engine bay mounts, and quieter exhaust system designed and built.  You can read more about the previous Senior Design class at our blog:

http://ncsuecocar2.com/Site/blog.html

This next semester we are looking to have Senior design classes work on the fuel system, the cooling system, suspension, and engine control.

We will have a news report about us on News 14 Carolina based out of Charlotte on December 16th.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to host a Senior Design class we need to raise $10,000.  This money goes to support the class who will need to purchase parts and services.  At the end of the semester there is a competition with the winning team receiving $100 per student, 2nd place winning $50, and 3rd winning $25.

This is a good oportunity for business's looking to get their name out in the community.  We are very active amongst the middle and high schools of North Carolina and attend a lot of green energy events that happen in the Raleigh area.  Sponsorship will also expose your company to industry leaders and government agencies like GM, ANL, Department of Energy, Freescale, dSPACE, The Mathworks, and others. 

We have several offerings to reward our supporters ranging from recongnition  on our website to actually being a judge at the final competition or having your logo placed upon the vehicle.

If we do not reach our goal of $10,000 there are two options we may follow depending on how close we are to reaching our goal.  If we are close to $10,000 we will cover the difference with our budget, but if the gap is too large the money will go into our budget and be used on components we need to finish the vehicle.

The Impact

From the EcoCAR2 website:

"The competition's mission is a vital one: offer an unparalleled hands-on, real-world experience to educate the next generation of automotive engineers. The competition challenges 15 universities across North America to reduce the environmental impact of a Chevrolet Malibu without compromising performance, safety and consumer acceptability."

This is the second AVTC or Advanced Vehicle Technology Competition that NC State University has participated in.  We are one of the smaller teams and any contribution will help.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are a NCSU student and our interested in joining the team feel free to contact us.  Otherwise please get the word out there about our program.

Thank you

story:
Hello, my name is Christian Wilson and every where I look, I dream about being like Indiana Jones and finding buried treasure. 

From the first time I went SCUBA diving, 20 some odd years ago, I have been fascinated with the thought of finding artifacts and buried treasure.  Whether it's some piece of jade necklace from the orient or gold coins from Spain or France, I want to discover something that's been lost at sea.


Now I live on the eastern shore of the Chesapeake Bay Bridge, and I've lived here for about 10 years and in that time I've read about and heard about so much stuff that's been lost in this area, that it makes me dizzy.  I've read that the infamous Black Beard the pirate made it this far north and came ashore to have a look around.


I'm asking for funding that will allow me to take 5 local teens and go searching for artifacts and buried treasure on shorelines and underwater up and down the east coast.  My plan is to search at least a dozen shorelines in the geographical area and as much of the adjacent underwater areas as we can.


I've given the IndieWilson campaign a 60 day deadline, any longer than that and I'm afraid the water will get to cold for searching or diving in and around the Chesapeake Bay area.  If I get funded any sooner though, IndieWilson will begin!


If everything goes well, this is something I'm going to do again and again with possibly bigger groups and different locations.  IndieWilson will travel!  I hope to use my past experience as a Social Studies teacher and a SCUBA diver to engross kids in things they usually just read about in the classroom or watch on television, adventure, discovery and excitement.  From finding artifacts and buried treasure to asking, "Where did this come from"?  Kids will learn about the history of the local area and see how the ocean works in hiding the treasures that have been lost there.


I'm a stay-at-home parent for my three kids, so my income is extremely limited.  Although my sister-in-law has a boat that I can borrow and a buddy who's a certified PADI Dive Master that will volunteer his time, there's still equipment that I'd need to purchase to accomplish this campaign like;

   Metal Detectors, I'm hoping to be able to afford the models that work underwater as well as
   on land.
   Digging equipment,  for when we find something.
   Diving wetsuits and diving masks for the underwater searching.
   Surface supplied air compressor for underwater searching, so they won't have to 
   learn to SCUBA.
   Boat fuel, we'll need a boat to get to some of the planned search locations.
   Maps and charts of the search areas.

If I don't reach my funding goal at the end of 60 days, then I'm still taking the kids to search for buried treasure and learn about the environment, but our locations will be on beaches closer to home.

And now some perks for my donors:
For your donation of $5 you will receive a photo of your name written in the sand at a search site.
For your donation of $15 you will receive several pieces of sea glass from a search site and a photo of your name written in the sand at that search site, (before the tide washes it away).
For your donation of $25 you will receive a photo with any message you want in the sand and 1oz. of the sand where it was written, along with sea glass from the shore of the search site.
For your donation of $50 you will receive a 30 minute video of a beach with your name or message on it and sea glass from that shore as the waves lap at the shore to relax to.
For your donation of $75 you will receive your own private beach (sand, sea shells, sea glass and drift wood) built from one of the search sites along with a 30 minute video of the beach it was built from.

For your donation of $2500.00 or more of the funding, we will donate the first artifact found to a museum of your choosing, if you don't care then we will still donate it, in your name, to the appropriate local museum.

Thanks for learning about my IndieWilson campaign and if you want to keep up with us, on where we go and what we find, then check back.
