story:
Short Summary

Care About Climate is a program that forms partnerships with local and government sustainability programs, as well as global institutions such as the United Nations. Care about Climate’s goal is to foster and raise sustainable awareness, facilitating a global conversation about climate change that will inspire proactive climate politics as well as promote research, and educate the general public furthering sustainable awareness in communities across the globe. 

We provide educational tools and programs to make this happen, aiding communities in sustainable awareness and climate change around the globe. 

Currently we are looking to attend and be a presence at the People's Climate March this coming September, but we need your help getting there! Every little bit helps!!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $300 in order to attend and be a main presence at the People's Climate March in New York City this coming September. 

We are looking for donations so that we can supply the community with materials sporting our logo, and information so that they might be able to not only participate but further raise awareness using us as a resource in the future as well. Every little bit helps and will be put towards promotional materials for this event. 

Please help to support our presence at this nationally recognized event, and in return we will provide you with some cool stuff as well as event photos!

    The Impact

    Your donation will help make a difference in a countless number of lives as you will be donating to a cause raising awareness in climate change as well as sustainable methods. Help us touch even more lives by donating and expanding our presence at the People's Climate March this September. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Currently we are working to raise awareness by establishing a universal symbol (Care About Climate) for an entire movement that already has a lot of environmental support. Additionally, our efforts support the organic grassroots efforts that occur through social media as well as at events such as the People's Climate March. 

    We hope that others recognize the symbol, but this recognition will come only from promoting the symbol and encouraging others to interact with our programs, by of course using it at nationally recognized events such as the People's Climate March. 

    Currently, we have a great social media and graphic design team, several individuals that have the only task of making partnerships and contacting as many people as possible, and a network of youth throughout the country through a partnership with the Sierra Student Coalition. It is through these partnerships that we will encourage individuals to use the symbol, and promote sustainable awareness actively within their own communities. We currently also have connections to larger environmental nonprofits and are active in the UN Climate Negotiations. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Show your support! Promote our event or attend the event yourself September 21! Like us on Facebook, or visit our website at www.careaboutclimate.com for more information.

    Tell your friends about the People's Climate March, hopefully we can get some of them to attend as well! 

    Donate buttons, shirts, signs, we could use all of the promotional materials we can get! If you have access to a printing, and or T-shirt company please contact us about donating, we would greatly appreciate it!!

story:
WE WANT TO COLLECT VIDEO STATEMENTS FROM EVERYONE WHO LIVES ALONG THE PROPOSED NORTHERN GATEWAY PIPELINES PROJECT ROUTE.

  • Big Oil wants to build two 730mi/1177km pipelines to transport oil across BC Canada.
  • The project is an tremendous environmental threat and burden on local populations.
  • The majority of Canadians polled do not want this risky project to happen.
  • Big Oil and the Canadian government are still  trying to push it through.
  • Our goal is to build a tool that demonstrates what people want and why they want it.

IF WE CLEARLY DEMONSTRATE THAT THE MAJORITY OF PEOPLE DO NOT WANT THESE PIPELINES AND TANKERS, WILL THEY COMPLETELY DISREGARD DEMOCRACY?

No, it's not currently a recognized part of any democratic process,but we will be collecting auditable data that delivers a measurable result that cannot be dismissed without moral implications.

We need you to help us fund and promote this powerful system. We're making it easy; just buy a tshirt... or two or three.

Sample user interface concepts as seen on www.equilibrium.org:

Equilibrium Engine is a combination of social networking tools and tactics designed to create greater representation for the people. This system will provide decision makers with absolute clarity about what we want.

This system will aggregate perspectives and analyze issues. We will collect stories, geographical information and basic demographic data.  Resulting data can be used to deliver compelling arguments and expose motivations. This tool will encourage higher moral and ethical standards and accountability.

We end up with qualitative and quantitative data that can be used to shape our engagement strategies and strengthen our collective case.

This system can unite all of the fragmented groups and individuals working hard on this cause. We can all use this system to organize and share ideas and benefit form each others efforts.

We'll put teams on the ground to collect statements and to train local teams to mobilze. We'll provide mobile devices to support teams as needed. The passionate people living in these communities can help us scale this massive outreach initiative very quickly.

PLEASE VISIT www.EquilibriumEngine.org TO GET A FULL UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT WE HOPE TO ACCOMPLISH AND TO LEARN HOW YOU CAN HELP.

About the Tar Sands

Canada's Tar sands are believed to be the second largest oil reserve on earth (next to Saudi Arabia) and represent an enormous economic opportunity for Canada and Big Oil. Unfortunately, the economy and the environment do not always share the same priorities, often one flourishes at the other's expense.

The current oil sand mining methodologies are driven by cost and technology limitations, resulting in processes that make this mining operation one of the world's greatest environmental threats. Global demand and capitalism continue to drive priorities, positioning  environmental concerns far behind profits.

Perhaps it is overly idealistic to suggest this oil should not be mined, but it is completely reasonable to suggest there is a more responsible way to do it. Big Oil is realizing record profits at the expense of our environment. This hunger for profit results in catastrophic moral and ethical compromises.

The Enbridge Northern Gateway Pipelines Proposal is an extreme example of Big Oil's thirst for profit and disregard for the environment. The proposal puts thousands of square miles of wilderness at risk in the name of profit. This is not acceptable, especially considering Big Oil's history of system failures.

Our objective is to document the people's voice in this historic struggle.
